Title: Data Scientist L5 - Content EMEA
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Role

The Content Data Science and Engineering (DSE) team is passionate about storytelling and bringing our members joy. Our mission to entertain the world is anchored in our content, and data is a crucial component in shaping our comprehensive content strategy. We focus on creating analytical products that support our Content partners in their complex and nuanced decision-making processes. We are a highly collaborative team that partners across Netflix to drive impact.

We are seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to provide key insights to our Content decision makers in EMEA. You will generate insights by scoping and executing deep dive analysis with local partner analytics teams, Consumer Insights, and Finance & Strategy. In success, you will collaborate on existing priorities but also will propose and execute on new opportunities. This role features ample opportunity for project ownership and will support impactful decision-making, across existing content initiatives and novel ones.

In This Role You Will


Be a strategic thought partner with business stakeholders to define high impact analytical problems and innovative ways to solve them with data.
Develop statistical models explaining viewership, content engagement, and other key behavioral patterns.
Build dashboards and visualization that enables stakeholders to self-serve metrics and trends effectively.
Actively socialize and educate, aiding on interpretation.
Translate analytic insights into actionable recommendations for business or content improvement, and communicate these findings clearly to a broad audience.
Identify and proactively socialize regional insights, including those that may generalize to opportunities in other markets.


What You Will Bring


Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills to influence stakeholders using clear insights and recommendations.
Exceptional thought partnership to build credibility and relationships with stakeholders.
Strong statistical knowledge: understanding of predictive modeling; ability to tease out incrementality vs. correlations, confounder identification and amelioration, etc.
Basic understanding of experimentation including power calculations and interpretation of results.
Strong SQL skills and experience with distributed analytic processing technologies (S3, Presto, Hive, & Spark).
Strong skills in Python or R.
Highly effective in engaging with diverse stakeholders and adept at cultivating strong partnerships.
Passionate about communicating difficult concepts to non-technical audiences.
Self-starter who thrives under a high level of autonomy.
Enthusiastic about Netflix culture.


Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there! 👋

Are you an ambitious Machine Learning engineer? Do you want to use your data science and engineering skills to help fast-growing tech scale-ups by means of ML? Furthermore, are you ready for the adventure of expanding Enjins together with our ambitious team? Then keep reading!

About Us 🚀

At Enjins, we're committed to building AI solutions for meaningful change. We do this for customers in industries where a positive change can be made: Climate tech, Mobility and Marketplaces. Our portfolio includes partnerships with renowned names like Crisp, Groendus, SnappCar, Tier Mobility, Independer, PlanBlue (check our cases page for examples of our work).

With our headquarters in the Netherlands (Utrecht) and a second hub in Berlin we have shown impressive growth year-over-year, a proven proposition that fits current market needs, and a strong branding that resembles quality, innovation, and pragmatism. In 2025, we'll continue to invest in expanding our team within the Utrecht Hub to further grow our reach in the Dutch scale-up ecosystem. As the AI industry is booming, we have ambitious goals for the coming years ahead. From this hub, our ML engineers develop innovative AI solutions in collaboration with various scale-up customers.

At Enjins, our success hinges upon the quality of our team and the breadth of their ideas. We believe that truly remarkable insights and innovative solutions for our customers emerge from the rich interplay of diverse cultures, knowledge, and experiences among our workforces.

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing Machine Learning team, comprising of 15 other equally amazing Machine Learning Engineers.

In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast and we'll support your growth ambitions as much as possible. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!

Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to;]


You become a full member of our growing ML Engineering team
You'll work in small teams on ML projects for innovative Dutch & foreign clients in ClimateTech, Mobility and Marketplaces.
You'll develop and implement robust ML applications for these clients
You'll apply your data engineering, computer science and machine learning knowledge on projects and you work with the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow and Kafka
You'll translate the implications of the project to business stakeholders and focus on the human aspects to increase the impact of our ML applications
Together we will keep building our young company Enjins, in which you will play a more and more important role!



Within 1 month you'll:


Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCP
Start your first customer project!



Within 3 months you'll:


Develop and implement robust ML applications for your client, working on building new solutions and ironing out any old integration problems. This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skills.
Had multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skills



Within 6 months you'll:


You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work best
Have helped in the interview process for additional ML Engineers to join Enjins' growing team
Have helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantly



Requirements

About you: 💬


You have finished your Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or another (technical) degree that is of relevance
You are ambitious and willing to invest in your personal development path towards a Senior ML Engineer
You are pragmatic and proactive and you like to work in small teams for innovative clients
You've excellent communication skills and enjoy translating complex problems to non-tech people
You are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CEO, CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum results
You are fluent in English and are eligible to work in the Netherlands



Your tech skills: 🔧


You have extensive software engineering experience in Python, SQL and git. Other languages or frameworks are a big plus
You have experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP) and its data engineering components
You are familiar with software and data engineering concepts like containerization (Kubernetes & Docker), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOps
You have experience with machine learning and know how to create ML models and bring them to production
You are a passionate engineer who 1) wants to make a positive impact to our world and 2) loves discovering new programming languages, frameworks or cloud services. After all, our world is changing continuously!
You've applied the above concepts in one or more relevant (side) jobs



Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
A dedicated training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level
Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities
Receive an Apple MacBook Pro for work
Enjoy 28 vacation days (based on full-time employment), comprising 20 statutory vacation days and an additional 8 days provided by the employer. You have the flexibility to utilise 3 national holidays (Easter Monday, Whit Monday, & Ascension Day) among the 8 days provided.



Have we spiked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

  • A dedicated training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level

Title: Biological Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

Syngenta Seeds, a leading developer and producer of Field Crops, Vegetable, and Flower Seeds, is part of Syngenta Group. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops.

Job Description


Type: Permanent
Business Unit: P&S – Vegetable Seed Enhancement Technology
Location: NL-Enkhuizen 


Responsibilities

The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) is closely connected to the vegetable seeds R&D, production and processing plants and services all Syngenta vegetable sites globally. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated Biological Data Scientist to join us and be a member of a multidisciplinary team embedded with a variety of stakeholders to support the global vegetable seeds business. You will focus on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and building artificial intelligence systems to automate measurements and understanding of seeds and plants. Key responsibilities will include:


Translating the imaging and AI systems to commercial scales that could be used across vegetable seed processing plants.
Designing and implementing automated seed processing systems using image-based methods and artificial intelligence.
Applying AI and machine learning techniques to study and analyse seed phenotypes and seedling characteristics.
Processing and interpreting large datasets to identify trends in seed quality and translating the findings to practical solutions to improve seed quality.
Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to drive innovation in seed science and practical solutions beneficial to the global Syngenta VEG business.


Qualifications


Ph.D. or MSc degree with proven experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
Strong knowledge of image analysis, machine learning, and seed physiology; or willingness to learn and establish strong knowledge of seed physiology and business.
Strong project management skills with the ability to lead projects in a corporate environment.
Ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences, while influencing and persuading key stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions, while valuing and incorporating expert inputs when needed.
English language proficiency at minimum B2 level (Common European Framework scale) and willingness to learn Dutch.
Enjoys working in a highly diverse corporate environment with focus on innovation and customer centricity.


Additional Information

Take your chance!

At Syngenta, we believe in creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are valued and given the opportunity to grow. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive package of secondary employment benefits.

Are you excited to strengthen our team? Don't miss this great opportunity! Apply online today at www.syngenta.com. For questions, please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin at Nienke.terluin@syngenta.com.
Show more

Title: AI Specialist
Description:
Als Generatieve AI-specialist maak je onze chatbots slimmer en persoonlijker, zodat ze klanten vriendelijker en efficiënter helpen. Je verbetert de klantervaring door chatbots nog beter te laten reageren op vragen en sneller met de juiste oplossingen te komen. Met jouw analytisch denkvermogen en pragmatische aanpak maak je onze chatbots elke dag een beetje beter.

Wat doe je als AI Specialist bij Coolblue?

Als Generatieve AI Specialist werk je aan chatbots voor klanten om een conversationele klantreis te creëren. Je schrijft de prompt, test het prototype en evalueert op grote schaal de uitkomsten. Bij Coolblue bouwen we onze applicaties direct op de modellen van OpenAI, Google en Anthropic. Met diepe kennis van deze nieuwe technologie kunnen we innovatieve geïntegreerde oplossingen bouwen in onze huidige processen.

Als toekomstig prompt engineer schrijf jij je motivatiebrief natuurlijk met AI. Upload daarom geen motivatiebrief, maar juist het prompt waarmee je deze brief zou genereren.

Dit vind je leuk om te doen


Nieuwe kennis opdoen over Generatieve AI door trainingen en ontwikkelingen te volgen.
Best practices opzetten voor het gebruik van Generatieve AI binnen Coolblue.
Intensief samenwerken met diverse domeinen om AI-toepassingen in hun vakgebied te ontdekken.
Waarde aantonen door prototypes te maken in Langchain.
Systematisch uitkomsten evalueren door prompts niet 1 keer, maar 1000 keer automatisch te testen.
Je kennis delen via demo’s, trainingen en als sparringpartner binnen Coolblue.


Hier herken jij jezelf in


Een afgeronde hbo- of wo- opleiding.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het schrijven van Python code.
Onstilbare honger naar nieuws over Generative AI, ervaring in Langchain is een pré.
Weet ChatGPT om de tuin te leiden met je prompts. Nieuwe (technische) kennis maak jij je snel eigen.
Analytisch en Pragmatisch en niet vies van een hacky oplossing.
Communicatief ijzersterk in het Nederlands én in het Engels


Dit zoek jij verder in een baan


Geld.
Meer dan 30 trainingen in onze eigen Studiefabriek.
Korting op alle spullen die we verkopen.
25 vakantiedagen. Als je belooft dat je terugkomt.
Reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling.
Een kantoor waar je foto's van wilt maken op een toplocatie. Vanaf Rotterdam Centraal is het 3 keer vallen voor je er bent. Oké, het is 2 minuten lopen.
Ongekend goede werksfeer. Met versbereide happen, maandelijkse borrels, legendarische Coolblue-feesten, de leukste teamactiviteiten en een informele, speelse afdeling.
Ruimte voor nieuwe initiatieven en ideeën. Daar staan we altijd voor open. Of je nu een week, maand of een jaar bij ons werkt.
Uitdagend werk om helemaal in op te gaan, zodat je af en toe vergeet dat je aan het werk bent.
Een platte organisatie in de breedste zin van het woord. Zo kun je gewoon een biertje drinken met de baas.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist , Leusden




Natuurlijk is Data Science een essentieel onderdeel van onze Digital Transformation doelstellingen.

En die zijn ambitieus. Want om de nummer 1 te blijven in de Do It Yourself-markt, moeten we data slim inzetten om innovatief en efficiënt te blijven.

Onze organisatie groeit, en met de toenemende focus op data-gedreven werken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Scientist die ons gedreven team komt versterken. Heb jij de technische expertise, strategisch inzicht en leiderschapskwaliteiten om data science binnen Intergamma naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!




Over de functie:

De afgelopen twee jaar hebben we als team al mooie stappen gezet in de richting van data-driven innovatie. We hebben de eerste producten opgeleverd en geanalyseerd. Nu staan we als team klaar om deze successen verder te optimaliseren en door te ontwikkelen. Als Data Scientist werk je aan het bouwen en optimaliseren van machine learning-modellen en datapipelines die direct bijdragen aan deze doelen. Je speelt een sleutelrol in het realiseren van de roadmap, met de focus op het vertalen van data naar concrete inzichten die onze bedrijfsdoelen ondersteunen.




Je bent onder meer verantwoordelijk voor:

Het vergelijken van prestaties van verschillende bouwmarkten om best practices te identificeren en processen te verbeteren.
Het analyseren van klantdata en productcombinaties om datagestuurde beslissingen te nemen die de klantbeleving verbeteren.
Het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor klantwaarde om klanttevredenheid en -loyaliteit te verhogen.
Het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde machine learning-modellen en deep learning-oplossingen die bijdragen aan de bedrijfsdoelstellingen.
Het bouwen en optimaliseren van complexe datapipelines en -architecturen.
Het vertalen van complexe business vraagstukken naar creatieve data science-oplossingen.
Het leiden van uitdagende projecten zoals het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor voorraadbeheer, het optimaliseren van prijsstrategieën, en het personaliseren van klantreizen door middel van machine learning.
Het motiveren en coachen van ons data science-team en het bieden van mentorship aan junior teamleden.
Het zichtbaar maken van data science binnen en buiten de organisatie door deel te nemen aan communities, het geven van presentaties, en het delen van kennis over markttrends.
Nauw samenwerken met teams zoals Marketing, Supply Chain en IT om cross-functionele data-oplossingen te ontwikkelen die onze bedrijfsprocessen optimaliseren.




Wat breng je mee:

Technische vaardigheden:
Diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen, deep learning, en geavanceerde data-analysetechnieken.
Ervaring met cloudplatforms zoals AWS, Azure, of GCP.
Beheersing van programmeertalen zoals Python, R, en SQL.
Ervaring met MLOps-tools en frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch of MLflow is een sterke pré.
Ervaring met relevante tools als Dataiku of Databricks
Business vaardigheden:
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in het Nederlands, om complexe analyses helder over te brengen aan diverse stakeholders.
Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van data-oplossingen die direct bijdragen aan bedrijfsresultaten.
Leiderschapskwaliteiten:
Vermogen om een team te inspireren, motiveren en naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
Ervaring met het beheren van data science-projecten en stakeholdermanagement.




Wat wij bieden:

Een bruto fulltime maandsalaris van € 3.800,- tot € 6.000,- (Intergamma betaalt per periode van 4 weken), inschaling is afhankelijk van ervaring.
Telefoon en laptop van de zaak, een goede pensioenregeling, en 32 vakantiedagen.
Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om deels thuis te werken.
Een dynamische werkomgeving bij een marktleider die ontwikkeling, werkplezier en welzijn centraal stelt.
Ruime mogelijkheden voor innovatie, diversiteit en persoonlijke groei.
Een unieke kans om impact te maken in een groeiende en innovatieve organisatie.




Achter elke klus vind je Intergamma:

Intergamma is dé organisatie achter de doe-het-zelf-formules GAMMA en Karwei. Met bijna 160 eigen bouwmarkten in Nederland en België zijn we al jaren de onbetwiste nummer één duurzame retailer op de doe-het-zelfmarkt. In Europa horen we bij de 15 grootsten. En daar zijn we trots op!

Vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Leusden werken we met bijna 400 betrokken medewerkers samen om onze goede naam als omnichannel doe-het-zelf retailer hoog te houden. Dat doen we door volop te blijven investeren in verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven die ons verder de toekomst in helpen om gezond en winstgevend te blijven.




Sla nu de spijker op z’n kop!

Eerst nog vragen? Bel dan met Kido Otten op 06 83455440. Gelijk solliciteren kan ook via bijgaande sollicitatieknop.

Show more
HTML:
Data Scientist , Leusden


Natuurlijk is Data Science een essentieel onderdeel van onze Digital Transformation doelstellingen.

En die zijn ambitieus. Want om de nummer 1 te blijven in de Do It Yourself-markt, moeten we data slim inzetten om innovatief en efficiënt te blijven.

Onze organisatie groeit, en met de toenemende focus op data-gedreven werken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Scientist die ons gedreven team komt versterken. Heb jij de technische expertise, strategisch inzicht en leiderschapskwaliteiten om data science binnen Intergamma naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!


Over de functie:

De afgelopen twee jaar hebben we als team al mooie stappen gezet in de richting van data-driven innovatie. We hebben de eerste producten opgeleverd en geanalyseerd. Nu staan we als team klaar om deze successen verder te optimaliseren en door te ontwikkelen.   • Diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen, deep learning, en geavanceerde data-analysetechnieken.
  • Ervaring met cloudplatforms zoals AWS, Azure, of GCP.
  • Beheersing van programmeertalen zoals Python, R, en SQL.
  • Ervaring met MLOps-tools en frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch of MLflow is een sterke pré.

  • Vermogen om een team te inspireren, motiveren en naar een hoger niveau te tillen.

Wat wij bieden:

  • Telefoon en laptop van de zaak, een goede pensioenregeling, en 32 vakantiedagen.

  • Een dynamische werkomgeving bij een marktleider die ontwikkeling, werkplezier en welzijn centraal stelt.
  • Ruime mogelijkheden voor innovatie, diversiteit en persoonlijke groei.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Only at McKinsey

Work on real-world, high-impact projects across a variety of industries – Identify micro patterns in data that our clients can exploit to maintain their competitive advantage and watch your technical solutions transform their day-to-day business.

Experience the best environment to grow as a technologist and a leader – Develop a sought-after perspective connecting technology and business value by working on real-life problems across a variety of industries and technical challenges to serve our clients on their changing needs.

Be surrounded by inspiring individuals as part of diverse multidisciplinary teams - Develop a holistic perspective of AI by partnering with the best design, technical, and business talent in the world as your team members.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.

Your Impact

You will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.

You will be a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. 

As a Data Scientist, you’ll


Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions.
Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client.
Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics.
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox.
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish.
You will take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers; work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally.
Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact; you will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport. 


Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence
0-2 years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning) R and/or Python (must), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued)
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Willingness to travel
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Freeday, we aim to unlock human potential by leveraging disruptive technologies and building an AI-powered digital workforce that excels in repetitive tasks. By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.

Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary and pension plan.
Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
A company laptop to support your work effectively.
Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team




Our Culture:




At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.




Requirements:

1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.




***

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist / Hybrid Amsterdam / 7 months / Start ASAP




Required Skills & Experience:




- Master's degree or PhD in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field

- 3+ years of experience applying optimization techniques to supply chain or retail problems

- Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements into mathematical models

- Strong knowledge of linear programming, integer programming, and constraint satisfaction

- Proficiency in Python and optimization libraries (e.g., CPLEX, Gurobi, OR-Tools)

- Experience with data manipulation and analysis using SQL and Python




Preferred Qualifications:




- Experience in retail or supply chain management

- Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application to optimization problems

- Background in developing production-grade optimization systems

- Familiarity with cloud-based deployment of optimization solutions




What 3 things from above are most important?

Advanced Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills - Demonstrated ability to formulate complex business problems as mathematical models and select appropriate optimization techniques to solve them efficiently.

- Production-Level Programming Experience - Proven track record of implementing optimization algorithms in production environments, with proficiency in translating mathematical models into robust, scalable code.

- Business Acumen in Retail/Supply Chain - Strong understanding of retail operations and supply chain dynamics, with the ability to connect optimization solutions to measurable business outcomes.

Title: Internship - Data Science AI/ML
Description:
The future starts here! Ready to join NXP?

Become part of project management office team to develop and implement the next level of automation for project monitoring and control. We are looking for a highly motivated student that will help us with investigating the possibilities to use Data Sciences/AI/ML techniques in making our activities less time consuming, making our processes uniform and reducing time-to-market.

Your Team

This opportunity is within the Programs and Projects Management Office of IVN. Our goal is to help teams cross the chasm from ideas and early concepts to products manufactured in very high volumes. This must be achieved while maintaining the three pillars of Project Management: Time, Quality and Money. At same time, we have the ambition to continuously improve ourselves and experience and learn new methods, which is where you come in to teach us new things and take us out of the comfort zone.

Your Responsibilities


Gathering requirements for automation
Developing elementary data mining/analysis techniques
Developing/prototyping while preparing thorough design documentation
Familiarization with code repositories and version control Integration/implementation of feedback from beta users
Basic familiarization with IC design environment and tooling User documentation


What’s In It For You


This opportunity is mainly suitable for someone who wants to discover/explore working in large/multi-national company. You will work with stakeholders, uncover requirements and deliver proposals and fine-tune for final delivery. At the same time, you will discover how a large company works, dealing with stakeholders and develop your consultative approach based on knowledge you already have/own.
A great opportunity to develop your skills (technical, soft skills, communication, etc.).
Gaining experience in a multinational and diverse environment.
Working on real assignments which contribute to NXP’s objectives.


Your Profile


Internship for Master of Data Science, AI/ML, Microelectronics.
This opportunity is not suitable for Master/Graduation Thesis.
Affinity with AI and ML model, semiconductor.
Team player, willing to work in international and multi-disciplinary teams.
Flexible and able to multi-task.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English.
Good level of English is required (attendance to meetings / presentations with international team, reading and writing of documentation)


Duration

This is a full-time internship (40 hours per week) with a duration of 6 months or longer. Please note that in order to be considered for an internship/working student assignment, you need to be registered as a student during the entire period.

Creating Secure Connections and Infrastructure for a Smarter World

NXP Semiconductors N.V. (NASDAQ: NXPI) makes products and environments safer, more sustainable, and more secure with innovative connectivity and edge processing solutions for a smarter world. We are in the business of better. Not just better technologies, but better innovations to improve society. As the world leader in secure connectivity and processing solutions for embedded applications, NXP is solving the world’s most complex technology challenges to accelerate business innovation, enhance how we work, and advance how we live. If you are as excited about this opportunity as we are, we kindly invite you to apply. After a screening based on your profile you can be expected to have a video interview with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by business.

What Can You Expect?

Development opportunities: We believe that a key component to growing our business is to develop our people. To enable you to grow your career at NXP, we provide you with a mix of learning through on-the-job experiences, learning from industries bests, and learning through education to help you develop your core and professional skills.

Our offices: The Netherlands is home to our global headquarters (Eindhoven) along with two additional sites (Nijmegen, Delft) and includes a diverse team of over 2000 employees with 51 different nationalities focused on R&D, manufacturing, product development, business operations, legal and sales.

Hiring process: Applying only takes a minute! Fill in the online application and share your CV with us. After a positive screening based on your CV you will have an initial video conversation with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by several business interviews. Here are some useful tips to help you prepare.

And more: Life at NXP is more than work alone. Join one of the many social activities that are organized by and for employees in the Netherlands, such as our Christmas parties and International Walking Day. We have a YOUNG community that organizes a mix of social and professional events for our young professionals and an active Women in NXP. We also take time to give back to our communities by engaging young girls to learn about Technology during Girls Day or participating in several volunteering activities.

What’s Next?

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we kindly invite you to apply! If you have any questions, we are happy to answer them. Please contact, Chanchal Sharma, Talent Acquisition Specialist on chanchal.sharma_1@nxp.com

More information about NXP in the Netherlands...


Show more

  • Basic familiarization with IC design environment and tooling User documentation

What’s In It For You

  • This opportunity is mainly suitable for someone who wants to discover/explore working in large/multi-national company. You will work with stakeholders, uncover requirements and deliver proposals and fine-tune for final delivery. At the same time, you will discover how a large company works, dealing with stakeholders and develop your consultative approach based on knowledge you already have/own.
  • A great opportunity to develop your skills (technical, soft skills, communication, etc.).
  • Gaining experience in a multinational and diverse environment.
  • Working on real assignments which contribute to NXP’s objectives.

Your Profile

  • Internship for Master of Data Science, AI/ML, Microelectronics.
  • This opportunity is not suitable for Master/Graduation Thesis.
  • Affinity with AI and ML model, semiconductor.
  • Team player, willing to work in international and multi-disciplinary teams.
  • Flexible and able to multi-task.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English.
  • Good level of English is required (attendance to meetings / presentations with international team, reading and writing of documentation)

Duration

This is a full-time internship (40 hours per week) with a duration of 6 months or longer. Please note that in order to be considered for an internship/working student assignment, you need to be registered as a student during the entire period.

Creating Secure Connections and Infrastructure for a Smarter World

NXP Semiconductors N.V. (NASDAQ: NXPI) makes products and environments safer, more sustainable, and more secure with innovative connectivity and edge processing solutions for a smarter world. We are in the business of better. Not just better technologies, but better innovations to improve society. As the world leader in secure connectivity and processing solutions for embedded applications, NXP is solving the world’s most complex technology challenges to accelerate business innovation, enhance how we work, and advance how we live. If you are as excited about this opportunity as we are, we kindly invite you to apply. After a screening based on your profile you can be expected to have a video interview with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by business.

What Can You Expect?

Development opportunities: We believe that a key component to growing our business is to develop our people. To enable you to grow your career at NXP, we provide you with a mix of learning through on-the-job experiences, learning from industries bests, and learning through education to help you develop your core and professional skills.

Our offices: The Netherlands is home to our global headquarters (Eindhoven) along with two additional sites (Nijmegen, Delft) and includes a diverse team of over 2000 employees with 51 different nationalities focused on R&D, manufacturing, product development, business operations, legal and sales.

Hiring process: Applying only takes a minute! Fill in the online application and share your CV with us. After a positive screening based on your CV you will have an initial video conversation with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by several business interviews. Here are some useful tips to help you prepare.

And more: Life at NXP is more than work alone. Join one of the many social activities that are organized by and for employees in the Netherlands, such as our Christmas parties and International Walking Day. We have a YOUNG community that organizes a mix of social and professional events for our young professionals and an active Women in NXP. We also take time to give back to our communities by engaging young girls to learn about Technology during Girls Day or participating in several volunteering activities.

What’s Next?

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we kindly invite you to apply! If you have any questions, we are happy to answer them. Please contact, Chanchal Sharma, Talent Acquisition Specialist on chanchal.sharma_1@nxp.com

More information about NXP in the Netherlands...

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Are you an AI & ML Engineer who thrives on building intelligent systems and developing cutting-edge machine learning models?







This is your chance to join an innovative organization where your expertise will shape the future of AI-driven solutions! You’ll have the freedom to experiment, deploy, and optimize models while working alongside top-tier engineers and business leaders.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Designing and implementing machine learning models and AI algorithms.
Developing scalable, production-ready AI/ML solutions.
Working with large datasets to build predictive analytics and automation.
Optimizing model performance, deployment, and monitoring in real-world applications.




Essential Skills:




✅ 3+ years of experience in AI & ML Engineering

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Strong proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn

✅ Experience with data pipelines and MLOps

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Proven ability to develop and deploy ML models at scale

✅ Professional proficiency in Dutch (native not required)




Bonus Skills:




Knowledge of NLP, Computer Vision, or Generative AI.
Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, or Kafka).







Flexible working: Hybrid setup – 2 days in-office, the rest remote!




Fantastic opportunities for career growth in a booming industry.




Work on high-impact AI projects with real-world applications.




Don’t miss this opportunity! Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Foxtek Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands (Hybrid)




Are you an AI/ML Engineer driven by building smart systems and developing innovative machine learning models?




You’ll be part of an international team, who are passionate about the work they do. The company offers a dynamic work environment, with career progression with the AI/ML Space.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Build scalable, robust applications using Python and cloud platforms.
Develop end-to-end AI solutions, from concept to production.
Deploy ML pipelines using Python on cloud platforms.
Stay updated with state-of-the-art ML research.
Deploy ML models to large user bases.
Stay updated on cutting-edge ML research and tools.




Essential skills:

✅ 3+ years of experience in AI/ML Engineering

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Strong proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch.

✅ Experience with CI/CD and MLOps

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Experience deploying ML models to a large user base

✅ Professional proficiency in English. Any Dutch (or German) is a bonus.







Flexible working: Hybrid – 2 days in Amsterdam office, the rest remote!




Fantastic opportunities for career growth in a booming industry.




Work with one of Europe’s fastest growing AI specialists




Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Internship
Description:
Hey there! 👋

Are you looking for a place to graduate where you can gain hands-on experience in deploying, scaling, and maintaining AI-driven solutions? Do you want to bridge the gap between machine learning and production systems? Then join our team as an ML Engineering intern!

Why? 🤔

At Enjins we want to make Machine Learning solutions that are here to stay. Our mission is to become the go-to ML engineering company in the world of tech scale-ups, for both talent and customers.

How? 🚀

We are driven by impact, and so is our vision on Machine Learning. We don't want a data scientists' laptop to be a graveyard for brilliant models. That's why we created an approach that allows us to actually implement Machine Learning that realises business value. This approach demands our ML engineers to stand out in engineering, data science and consulting skills.

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

We are looking for an intern to strengthen our team in one of two exciting graduation projects. You'll work on innovative AI solutions, focusing on automation, deployment, and optimization of machine learning systems. Your research and implementation will contribute directly to real-world applications, working closely with our AI engineers in a dynamic environment of start- and scaleups.

Your responsibilities:


Design, develop, and optimize AI pipelines for scalable deployment.
Research best practices for monitoring, versioning, and automating AI workflows.
Implement solutions that enhance the efficiency and reliability of AI models in production.
Collaborate with a small team to bring innovative AI solutions to life.



Your graduation project options:


Oddit: We are currently developing an LLM-based application called Oddit that is able to create AI roadmaps and strategies based on inputs such as interviews, data quality scans and code reviews. Basically, we automate our own workflow. Within this project there are plenty GenAI research angles, that will have direct impact on our product (Oddit).
Your AI Engineering Pitch: Bring your own AI engineering topic related to our focus industries ClimateTech, Marketplaces, or Mobility. Whether it's optimizing an AI model performance in Energy, improving real-time data pipelines in a geospatial setting, or enhancing the AI system scalability for a large platform, we encourage you to pitch an AI idea that aligns with our focus industry.


Starting date: 1st of June or July: 4-6 months

Requirements

Who are you?:🚶‍♀️


You're graduating in a Master's Degree in AI, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar (technical) field.
You have some experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, or Azure).
You're familiar with Python and have experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and model deployment.
You are pragmatic, proactive, and thrive in small, agile teams.
You are fluent in at least English.
You like to build stuff; preferably you have an ambition to grow your skills in both software as well as AI/ML.



Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


A team of talented and ambitious ML engineers.
Insights into real-world AI challenges and deployment strategies.
The possibility of a full-time position as AI engineer at Enjins after your internship.



Have we spiked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Captain is looking for a pioneering Data Scientist to join our team




About Captain

Captain is a data analytics platform that enables brands and retailers to collaborate more effectively. By providing producers with the right insights and predictions, they can better manage how their products reach consumers. This is essential as we believe there are still too many inefficiencies in the supply chain.

‍

Over the past year, we’ve built a solid technical foundation and secured several leading clients, especially in the food industry. We’re currently expanding rapidly, backed by EU funding to develop models for price elasticity, demand forecasting, and assortment rationalization — all aimed at enabling data-driven category management.

‍

About the Role

This is a pivotal role for us — and can be for you too. We are looking for a Data Scientist with experience in Category Management, either on the retailer or supplier side. You will help us integrate complex data sources and build scalable models that create real value for our clients.

‍

Your work will focus on bringing together syndicated and proprietary datasets (e.g., Nielsen, Circana, GfK, SIS, 7EVEN, ex-factory) and transforming them into insights and predictions that help our clients win with retail. This role is both analytical and strategic — you’ll be closely involved in product development, pilot projects, and customer delivery.

‍

You’ll be working in a small, fast-moving team — which means you’ll get a lot of responsibility early on, but also have the chance to learn and grow quickly. You’ll be close to the decision-making and directly see the impact of your work on real client projects.

‍Your Profile
3+ years experience as a data scientist or analyst
Experience with category management data and workflows
Strong command of Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with price elasticity, forecasting, or clustering models
Comfortable working with messy, high-volume datasets
Fluent in English (Dutch is a plus)

‍

Bonus points if you have:

FMCG experience at a supplier or retailer
Worked with assortment optimization or promo analytics
Familiarity with Azure, Databricks, or similar platforms

‍

What to Expect
Competitive salary between €4,250 and €5,000 per month (based on experience)
Employee stock option plan
One-year contract with permanent intent
25 vacation days
New MacBook
Mentorship and training budget
Hybrid work setup
Office in central Rotterdam (Microlab community)
Weekly team lunches and social events
Unlimited access to Udemy and Coursera

‍

Application Process

We keep it simple and personal. After your application, we’ll reach out for a conversation with our team. No unnecessary rounds — just a chance to get to know each other and explore fit.

‍

How to Apply

Send your CV and a short motivation to careers@gocaptain.ai.

We’re excited to hear how your experience in category management can help our clients grow — and how you want to grow with us.

Show more

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Are you an AI Engineer who thrives on building intelligent, real-world solutions in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment?




This is your chance to join a forward-thinking organization where innovation and adaptability are part of everyday life. Here, you’ll have the freedom to experiment, collaborate, and turn complex challenges into practical AI-powered applications that make a real difference for clients.




What You’ll Be Doing:




Designing/ implementing custom AI applications, from chatbots to process automation tools
Translating diverse datasets and legacy systems into scalable, modular AI solutions
Deciding when to enhance existing technology and when to build new solutions from scratch
Collaborating closely with a multidisciplinary team to turn ambitious ideas into working prototypes and production-ready systems
Delivering projects that have a direct impact on how clients operate and succeed




Essential Skills:




✅ Experience with Python and a strong knack for problem-solving

✅ Familiarity with modern AI concepts such as RAG and vector databases

✅ Comfortable with version control and project management tools

✅ Strong communication and teamwork skills

✅ Eagerness to learn and adapt as AI technologies evolve




Bonus Skills:




Experience with NLP, Computer Vision, or Generative AI
Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, Kafka)
Experience building data pipelines or working with MLOps
Professional proficiency in Dutch (native not required, but welcome)




What’s In It For You?




Flexible working hours and a hybrid work setup (in-office and remote options)
A modern, well-equipped office space in a central location
Daily catered lunches and regular team events
Dedicated time each week for personal or team learning and development
The benefits of a stable organization with the energy and support of a close-knit, growing team
Fantastic opportunities for rapid career growth and specialization, based on your ambition and interests

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Coders Connect is partnering with a cutting-edge start-up that is revolutionizing how businesses leverage data for decision-making. The company focuses on building advanced forecasting solutions that help drive sustainability efforts and optimize resource use. They're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team and be part of creating their first commercial MVP.




What you'll do:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing data-driven insights and helping shape the company's long-term success. Your responsibilities will include:

Building the First Product: Collaborate in a cross-functional team to design, optimize, and deploy both the forecasting algorithms and data visuals that will power the company's first MVP.
Designing a Future-Proof Infrastructure: Implement explainable ML and AI solutions, develop systems for monitoring model and data drift, and create processes that will allow the rapid production of new models.
Ensuring Platform Performance: Develop product analytics to monitor performance and inform product development decisions.
Staying Ahead with Technology: Keep up with the latest industry trends to ensure the use of cutting-edge technology that maximizes business impact.




Requirements:

Strong Forecasting Background: Extensive experience in building and deploying forecasting models, with hands-on knowledge of various tools and techniques.
Advanced ML Skills: Proficient in deploying machine learning pipelines and creating explainable AI solutions, while staying in tune with business needs.
Data Visualization Expertise: Skilled at translating complex datasets and time series into easy-to-understand insights.
Team-Oriented with a Product Focus: A clear communicator and collaborative team player with a product-led approach to engineering.
Start-up Experience: A background in early-stage environments, demonstrating adaptability and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced setting.
Relocation Flexibility: Must be an EU citizen and available to relocate to the Netherlands.




Preferred Tech Stack:

You will have input on shaping the company’s tech stack. Some preferred tools and technologies include:




Languages: Python for ML, R for data analysis
ML Libraries: scikit-learn, Prophet, TensorFlow, Keras
Data Processing/Storage: SQL, Spark
Cloud Platform: Azure
Version Control: Git




Benefits:

An initial one-year contract with the possibility of extension, based on the success of the collaboration.
A flexible hybrid work environment that promotes work-life balance.
Continuous learning opportunities and room for career growth within a fast-evolving company.
The chance to work with an international team of talented professionals across tech and product.
A meaningful opportunity to contribute to sustainability efforts and make a real-world impact.




Kindly note that VISA Sponsorship is not available for this position.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Up to 70k annually




Are you looking to join a company where you can apply advanced data science in a focused, intellectually curious environment?




The Company

This is a globally active organization working at the forefront of leadership development, organizational advisory, and strategic talent solutions. Our multidisciplinary team brings together experts in psychology, business strategy, analytics, and technology to unlock the potential of leaders and organizations around the world. We value deep thinking, purposeful innovation, and meaningful outcomes over public recognition.




The role

As a Data Scientist you’ll work at the intersection of machine learning, organizational psychology, and leadership science. You´ll collaborate closely to develop impactful solutions leveraging AI, NLP, and predictive analytics. Your work will inform executive decisions, shape leadership strategies, and support complex organizational transformations.




Identify high-impact opportunities for ML/AI across internal tools and client-facing products
Design, test, and deploy advanced models (especially NLP and AI-based) to address nuanced leadership and organizational challenges
Collaborate cross-functionally to embed data-driven insights into products and services
Contribute thought leadership and subject-matter expertise across data science, leadership strategy, and analytics innovation
Stay current with advances in ML, AI, and behavioral science to guide best practices
Bring an entrepreneurial mind set to the table and define new AI opportunities within the business.




Skills and Experience

Strong track record in machine learning, NLP, and AI application—Bayesian modeling is a plus
Proficient in Python (preferred), R, or similar languages and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; meticulous attention to detail
Experience or interest in leadership science, organizational psychology, or social science research
Able to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and empathy




Think this could be the right fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now via the button on this page.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the Company:

I am currently looking for a Freelance Data Scientist to support the expansion of a growing Data Science team within a leading organisation.




About the Role:

In this role, you will be instrumental in building scalable, high-quality AI solutions, partnering closely with stakeholders to deliver innovative generative AI and machine learning products.




Responsibilities:

Design, build, test, and deploy scalable machine learning and generative AI solutions, including LLM-powered applications.
Develop and maintain APIs for processing and categorising data across various formats, including audio and video.
Monitor, maintain, and optimise performance for deployed models such as chatbots, predictive systems, and customer care solutions.
Collaborate with internal customers and technical teams to gather requirements and translate them into practical solutions.
Contribute to the automation of development and deployment through CI/CD pipelines.
Ensure documentation is thorough, supporting reproducibility, maintainability, and compliance.
Troubleshoot production issues and provide ongoing support as needed.




Qualifications:

3–5+ years of hands-on experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or related disciplines.




Required Skills:

Strong proficiency with Python, Git, and Azure data stack.
Solid knowledge of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Generative AI (experience with OpenAI or similar platforms highly desirable).
Practical experience with MLOps for deployment, monitoring, and model optimisation.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across technical and non-technical teams.




Preferred Skills:

If this sounds of interest, please send your updated CV to zacharyt@montash.nl and we can set up a time to discuss it further.

Title: data scientist
Description:
De Afdeling Business Intelligence en Kwaliteit (BI&K) van de Eenheid Noord-Nederland heeft ruimte voor een gedreven data scientist. Bij de politie werk je aan vraagstukken waarbij data een belangrijke rol speelt. Kom jij met jouw talent en expertise het verschil maken?

Wat ga je doen?

Als data scientist houd je je bezig met onderzoek naar en de ontwikkeling en toepassing van data science-methoden zoals machine learning die bijdragen aan operationele vraagstukken binnen de politieorganisatie. Je werkt aan uiteenlopende projecten, zoals exploratieve data-analyses of het ontwikkelen en evalueren van modellen voor het classificeren van informatie in brondata. Je draagt bij aan maatschappelijk relevante ontwikkelingen en de beweging van datagedreven werken binnen de politie. Je maakt deel uit van een nationaal samenwerkingsverband waarin verschillende Business Intelligence en Kwaliteit (BI&K)-expertisegebieden actief zijn. In samenwerking met specialisten uit deze expertisegebieden werk je aan oplossingen voor vraagstukken uit de politiepraktijk en draag je bij aan de implementatie en het beheer daarvan. Je werkt op een landelijk data- en analytics-platform waar brondata geïntegreerd beschikbaar is voor dataexploratie en de ontwikkeling en exploitatie van modellen.

Waar ga je werken?

Je komt te werken bij het Team Business Intelligence. Dit team houdt zich bezig met de ontwikkeling van oplossingen om onze collega’s en verschillende ketenpartners van de juiste informatie te voorzien. Het team ontwikkelt en beheert standaardproducten en analyseoplossingen en draagt actief bij aan landelijke ontwikkelingen binnen het intelligencedomein en daarbuiten zoals thematisch en datagedreven werken. Samen met jouw collega’s denk je buiten de bestaande kaders om te komen tot realistische en passende oplossingen. Hoewel de standplaats Groningen is, verricht het team werkzaamheden door het hele land. Het kan voorkomen dat je voor het werk moet reizen en eventueel voor langere periode op een andere locatie werkzaamheden verricht.

Wie ben jij?

Je bent gespecialiseerd in het werken met en analyseren van data. Je hebt kennis van en ervaring in het toepassen van data science- en machine learning-oplossingen. Daarnaast kun je data engineering werkzaamheden oppakken die relevant zijn voor jouw data science oplossingen. Naast inhoudelijke ervaring ben je promotor van data gedreven werken op basis van je kennis, ervaring en overtuigingskracht. Je hebt een open en constructieve houding gericht op het verbinden van het datadomein met het werk dat door de collega’s in intelligence, opsporing en handhaving wordt uitgevoerd. Je onderscheidt gemakkelijk hoofd- en bijzaken en brengt informatie uit diverse bronnen met elkaar in verband. Je kunt analyses omzetten in concrete oplossingen en feiten kun je helder en gestructureerd vastleggen en presenteren. Je signaleert kansen en bent alert op trends, ontwikkelingen en jurisprudentie en hebt oog voor ethische en maatschappelijke aspecten die je werk raken. Je kunt zelfstandig werken waarbij je proactief op zoek gaat naar nieuwe mogelijkheden en kansen.

Verder heb je


hbo (bachelor) werk- en denkniveau*;
een politie- of PSI-diploma;
aantoonbare ervaring in de ontwikkeling en evaluatie van modellen;
aantoonbare werkervaring in het implementeren en beheren van modellen ten behoeve van productieprocessen;
werkervaring met onderstaande onderwerpen
gedistribueerde zoek -en analyse omgevingen (Elasticsearch);
querytalen (GraphQL, SQL, Cypher);
graph databases (Neo4J);
programmeren (Python);
statistische analyse / machine learning / deep learning / NLP libraries;
CI/CD en CI/CD-tools;
container gebaseerde applicaties (Kubernetes).
Wat wij bieden

De standplaats is Groningen. Er is ruimte voor 1 fte. Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur per week.

Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst. We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een aanstelling in tijdelijke dienst voor een proeftijd van een jaar. Bij voldoende functioneren wordt de aanstelling na een jaar omgezet in een vaste aanstelling.

We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een aantrekkelijk pakket arbeidsvoorwaarden. Denk hierbij aan


een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 4.293,- en maximaal € 6.299,- (schaal 11 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek;
een Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB) dat uit twee delen bestaat
Een bruto deel van 17,86% van je salaris. Met dit budget kun je een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samenstellen. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het uitbetalen van je budget, het kopen van vakantie-uren of ontwikkelactiviteiten zoals een opleiding.
Een netto deel van € 377,- per jaar. Dit budget kun je bijvoorbeeld gebruiken voor duurzaamheidsdoelen, vakbondscontributie en voor vitaliteit.
goede pensioenregeling en betaald ouderschapsverlof ( meer info over verlof, regelingen en mogelijkheden ).

De formele functie binnen het functiegebouw van de politie is operationeel specialist C .

Interesse

Bel of mail met Wouter van der Heijen, operationeel specialist D BI&K (06 – 18 14 48 72, wouter.van.der.heijden@politie.nl ) als je meer informatie over de functie wilt hebben.

Voor vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure bel of mail je met Olga van Sonsbeek, recruiter (06 - 18 62 97 15, olga.bussink@politie.nl )

Solliciteer uiterlijk 20 mei 2025 via de sollicitatiebutton.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Wat verder belangrijk is


Een betrouwbaarheids- en omgevingsonderzoek maken deel uit van de selectieprocedure.
Je hebt de Nederlandse nationaliteit (dit mag ook je tweede nationaliteit zijn).
Goed politiewerk heeft verschillende inzichten nodig. Met welke unieke blik kom jij ons versterken?
Je hebt een diploma op hbo-niveau (bachelor) of je bent daaraan gelijkgesteld via EVC. Of je hebt minimaal twee jaar aantoonbare ervaring op het gevraagde werk- en denkniveau. Dit moet je aantonen met je cv, aangevuld met een officiële functiebeschrijving, vacaturetekst of ander document waarin het gevraagde werk- en denkniveau duidelijk staat vermeld. Let wel voor aanstelling op de functie is ook een politie- of PSI-diploma vereist.


Show more
