Title: AI/ML specialist Edge AI
Description:
AI/ML specialist Edge AI Eindhoven the Netherlands

Your Profile

• University degree: MSc, PhD or PDEng in a technical specialism, like Computer Science or equally relevant.

• 5+ years of experience in (software) engineering, with significant exposure/involvement with Machine Learning / AI required

• Affinity and experience with embedded processors, software and NN accelerators required.

• Broad experience with embedded software architectures, build systems, version control systems required.

• Broad experience with Operating systems GNU/Linux, embedded systems, development boards, and processors, and SW competencies as listed below required.

• Excellent communication skills in English (verbal /written) required. Experience in working in/with multi-site and multi-cultural projects/teams preferred.

• An (active) Github account (pref).




Your Competencies

• To give you a feeling for the types of competences, some examples are:

• Flexibility in working with AI frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), preferably via Python and C++ interfaces required.

• Understanding of AI toolchains, deployment, portability and inference engines (CUDA, TensorRT, TFLite, ONNX, etc.) preferred.

• Familiarity with setting up and maintaining related development environments (docker, TensorBoard, performance profiling, ClearML, etc.) required.

• Knowledge of build systems (YOCTO, OpenEmbedded, etc.) beneficial, working with cross-compilation toolchains for ARM preferred.

• Solid programming experience of C, C++, Python and Bash programming languages on Linux systems required.

• Experience with on-device learning and federated learning appreciated.

• Familiarity with future technologies for extreme efficiency such as in-memory, analog, and neuromorphic computing beneficial.

• Experience with Edge AI.




Department

We drive innovation on system level for the Automotive, Consumer / Internet of Things, Industrial and Medical/Health businesses in applications like highly automated and safe driving , radar systems, electrification, mobile robotics, industry 4.0, and personal health. We foresee that artificial intelligence through embedded neural networks will often provide a significant part of the ‘smartness’ in the products for these markets.

We innovate by combining technologies, IPs and products from different entities of our client and by participating in collaboration projects with customers, universities and research institutes. Together with the other departments, we anticipate future technology trends and gather innovative system and application insights for the roadmaps by developing innovative system prototypes, often in co-operation with external partners and customers. Where possible, we support new business development / new markets across departments, leveraging the companies technologies and competences. We also created and maintain a lab which showcases all the latest inventions to visitors of our headquarters.

The work is performed in a team of AI-experts, embedded in our clients world-wide AI-activities. The team’s current scope in research and advanced development is to research and evaluate methods for efficient machine learning (ML) inference while fully exploiting the HW/SW characteristics of all of our clients AI platforms, targeting multi-objective optimization. We support the departments with deep know-how to embed these ML-methodologies in the clients HW/SW AI products. We stay on top of and utilize today’s state of the art developments in the academic and open source communities, and participate there-in through partnerships, PhD- and master-student programs, publications etc. We seek to expand the team with ambitious embedded AI architects/engineers.

Our responsibilities are in the areas described below; where the exact responsibility of the candidate is determined taking his capabilities in mind:

• Automatic joint design and optimization for neural networks through Scalable and Collaborative Neural Architecture Search

• Innovating Transformer models, architectures and training methodologies to deployment on the Edge

• Domain generalization over sensors, configurations and datasets

• The methods are applied to vision, radar, audio and other time-series-data for above-mentioned industries

• Integration of the investigated methods and neural networks in larger applications, open source frameworks and compelling demonstrators

• Executing the above in co-operative and EU-supported projects with external partners (universities, companies), and in our clients long term innovation program (“research”)

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working
Be part of a fast-growing company that helps businesses leverage data analytics for better decision-making.
Collaborate with a highly skilled, dynamic, and supportive team.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning in analytics and consulting.
Competitive salary and benefits package, including training, mentorship, and travel opportunities.



What you will do


Conduct analyses using advanced analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations and interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Looker.
Solve complex problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and create actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitate workshops and training sessions for clients and team members.
Manage stakeholders and communicate effectively with executives.
Coach and mentor junior team members, fostering their growth and development.



What you’ll bring


3+ years of professional work experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses, and derive recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills in data analysis, machine learning, and programming. Proficiency in Python, SQL, R, and cloud computing platforms.
Experience with Python data tools (e.g., Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Ability to communicate complex statistical and analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent command of the English language.
Experience in consulting is a plus.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
✔ Are you a skilled machine learning engineer with a strong background in algorithm development and implementation?

✔ Are you looking for a role that combines hands-on technical work with consulting?

✔ Do you get satisfaction from seeing your models and algorithms being used in real-world applications?

✔ Do you enjoy being part of a team of experts who are passionate about machine learning and AI?




Then Xomnia is the place for you!

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Xomnia, your work for our clients will range from building data pipelines to data exploration and modeling, to productionizing your models and deploying them in a cloud environment. For instance, our team has developed scalable deployment pipelines using MLOps best-practices for a large insurance company in the Netherlands, enabling business teams to swiftly productionize a machine learning model for a new department.

Additionally, we have undertaken diverse projects, such as optimizing the electricity grid for the future, ensured you have stable internet connection at home and collaborated with LUMC on cancer research.

Together with the team, you will implement and adapt best-practises for modeling, programming and engineering using the latest MLOps principles, which includes automation, CI/CD and orchestration. These principles apply to the whole chain of the machine learning lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and monitoring. We value knowledge sharing and staying ahead of the curve in our constantly evolving field, with opportunities to explore and work with emerging technologies such as Generative AI. We are looking for a team player who is dedicated to keep learning, and enjoys sharing knowledge with others.




Please note that for this position, we are looking for candidates that have the legal right to work in the Netherlands as we do not offer visa sponsorship.




What you will be working on

Collaborating with a cross-functional team at our client to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learning
Designing and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniques
Developing and maintaining machine learning pipelines, including feature preparation, model training, model deployment and model serving using MLOps principles.
Analyzing and interpreting results to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement
Staying up-to-date with the latest machine learning techniques and technologies and apply them to business problems as appropriate
Following and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CD




What you will need

A minimum of 3 years experience in a position such as a machine learning engineer, data scientist or data engineer, building scalable solutions to bring models to production
A degree in computer science, data science, artificial intelligence or similar
Enthusiasm for MLOps and GenAI
Experience in data wrangling and building data pipelines
Advanced knowledge of statistics and mathematics
Experience with building batch and streaming ETL pipelines
Excellent Software Engineering skills in Python
Experience with containerisation (Docker), CI / CD and testing
Experience in working with at least one cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Keen on sharing knowledge and being eager to keep developing yourself
Affinity for consulting and a drive to help clients
Proficiency is English is mandatory and Dutch highly preferred.




What we offer

Competitive salary
Flexible work arrangements
Office in the heart of Amsterdam
two annual bonuses
€5000 development budget
Xomnia trips 🚀
25 vacation days
Cool merchandise 💙
Intern trainings & events
Pension scheme
Phone allowance
Full compensation of travel costs
Free and healthy lunch at the office




About Us

We are Xomnia, the AI consulting company. We’re curious problem solvers who believe data will change the way we live, work and communicate. Being at the forefront of this revolutionary change in a sustainable, positive way is what drives us.

We solve challenging data science and engineering projects, from start to finish. From developing an application for real-time fraud detection on Google Cloud Platform, to setting up a customized recommender engine in an existing Microsoft Azure environment - we develop and deploy tailor-made data science solutions.

Xomnia started in 2013 in one room in the heart of Amsterdam. These days we take up nearly two houses. But more than just a workspace, we're a community that values authenticity. Here, everyone is encouraged to be themselves, to learn, and to have fun in the process.

Representing over 20 nationalities, our team values the unique cultural perspective that each individual brings to the table. Moreover, with the Dutch tech sector seeing a female representation around 11%, we are proud that over 30% of our workforce is female. Nevertheless, we recognize that there is more to be done, and we continue working to overcome barriers that still exist.




We encourage all candidates to apply, and we don’t discriminate based on race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age. However, a reality that we face is that many of our clients prefer to communicate in Dutch, making Dutch proficiency essential for some roles. Additionally, while we wish that we could sponsor visas for everyone, there are instances when it is not feasible.

If you're experienced, passionate, and align with our values, we want to hear from you.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Up to 60k annually




Are you looking to join a company where you can apply advanced data science in a focused, intellectually curious environment?




The Company

This is a globally active organization working at the forefront of leadership development, organizational advisory, and strategic talent solutions. Our multidisciplinary team brings together experts in psychology, business strategy, analytics, and technology to unlock the potential of leaders and organizations around the world. We value deep thinking, purposeful innovation, and meaningful outcomes over public recognition.




The role

As a Data Scientist you’ll work at the intersection of machine learning, organizational psychology, and leadership science. You´ll collaborate closely to develop impactful solutions leveraging AI, NLP, and predictive analytics. Your work will inform executive decisions, shape leadership strategies, and support complex organizational transformations.




Identify high-impact opportunities for ML/AI across internal tools and client-facing products
Design, test, and deploy advanced models (especially NLP and AI-based) to address nuanced leadership and organizational challenges
Collaborate cross-functionally to embed data-driven insights into products and services
Contribute thought leadership and subject-matter expertise across data science, leadership strategy, and analytics innovation
Stay current with advances in ML, AI, and behavioral science to guide best practices
Bring an entrepreneurial mind set to the table and define new AI opportunities within the business.




Skills and Experience

Strong track record in machine learning, NLP, and AI application—Bayesian modeling is a plus
Proficient in Python (preferred), R, or similar languages and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; meticulous attention to detail
Experience or interest in leadership science, organizational psychology, or social science research
Able to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and empathy




Think this could be the right fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now via the button on this page.

Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


Interact with our clients on regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Perform data analysis in the field of Growth Revenue Management, Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM Analytics and/or Risk Analytics.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis
Prepare and facilitating workshops
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives
Coach and mentor team members



What You Will Bring


1-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, etc.).
An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. Strong working knowledge of SQL, Python, R, and/or Matlab.
Ability to talk the language of statistics, finance, and economics.
Profound knowledge of the English language.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Help jij ons om complexe ML-modellen naar productie te brengen en op schaal te draaien voor 5 miljoen ANWB-leden? Als ML Engineer bouw je mee aan de infrastructuur die onze data-gedreven diensten mogelijk maakt.

Jouw rol

Als Machine Learning Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vertalen van data science oplossingen naar robuuste, schaalbare systemen die in productie kunnen draaien. Je speelt een cruciale rol in het overbruggen van de kloof tussen experimentele modellen en waardevolle bedrijfsoplossingen.


Modellen productiewaardig maken
Bouwen van schaalbare ML-pijplijnen
Reviewen en meehelpen van experimentele code naar productiewaardige, geteste en onderhoudbare code
Implementeren van monitoring, logging en alerting voor modellen in productie
Zorgen voor efficiënte model serving strategieën
Samenwerken met Data Scientists
Adviseren over best practices voor reproduceerbare en productiegerichte code
Meedenken over model-architectuur vanuit een engineering perspectief
Gezamenlijk oplossen van technische uitdagingen
MLOps/ LLMOps platform ontwikkelen
Bijdragen aan de verbetering van ons MLOps/ LLMOps platform
Automatiseren van herhalende processen in de ML lifecycle


Ons aanbod


Bruto maandsalaris tussen € 4.024 - en € 6.488,- (o.b.v. 38 uur) en een eindejaarsuitkering van 5,58%.
Prima pensioenregeling.
Korting op verschillende ANWB-producten en diensten.
Volop trainings-, opleidings- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden bij onze ANWB Academie.
Goede voorzieningen om thuis te werken en een thuiswerkvergoeding van €2,40 per dag (onbelast) de ANWB is voorstander van het hybride werken.
25 verlofdagen en 13 adv-dagen per jaar op basis van 40-urige werkweek. Ook kun je sparen voor extra verlof.
Internetvergoeding van €35,- per maand.
Persoonlijk inzetbaarheidsbudget van €700,- bruto per jaar.
ANWB-lidmaatschap met Wegenwacht Nederland Standaard of de Wegenwacht Fiets Service.


Ons team

Waar denk jij aan als je aan ANWB denkt? Grote kans dat je aan de Wegenwacht denkt. Dat klopt! Toch doen we veel meer. Wij zijn een vereniging die ook producten verkoopt in onze winkels, maatschappelijk relevante projecten realiseert, verzekeringen biedt, reizen voor onze leden organiseert, energieleverancier en nog veel meer. Dat maakt ANWB een veelzijdige werkgever met verschillende expertises onder één dak en waarbij maatschappelijke impact vooropstaat. Al deze producten en diensten genereren veel data die we binnen het ACE team, het Analytics Center of Expertise, gebruiken om werkzaamheden binnen de ANWB te optimaliseren en te innoveren. Jij wordt onderdeel van dit team.

Het ACE team voert opdrachten uit binnen de gehele ANWB. Je werkt in een team van Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers en een Analytics Translator. Als ML Engineer vorm je de brug tussen Data Science en productie, waarbij je nauw samenwerkt met zowel Data Scientists als MLOps Engineers. Je zorgt ervoor dat modellen op een schaalbare en betrouwbare manier worden geïmplementeerd en je draagt bij aan het onderhoud en de optimalisatie van het MLOps platform.

Als achtergrond neem jij mee

Je bent een technisch talent met passie voor het bouwen van robuuste ML-systemen! Je combineert software engineering expertise met kennis van machine learning en maakt graag de vertaalslag van experiment naar productie. Als achtergrond neem je verder mee:


Afgeronde WO opleiding in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science of vergelijkbare richting
2-5 jaar ervaring met het bouwen van production-grade machine learning systemen
Uitstekende programmeervaardigheden in Python, inclusief ervaring met software development best practices zoals testing, versioning en code reviews
Grondige kennis van ML frameworks (zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) en begrip van fundamentele ML-concepten
Ervaring met cloud platforms, met name AWS en specifiek SageMaker
Bekend met containerization (Docker)
Ervaring met CI/CD pipelines en MLOps principes
Affiniteit met data engineering concepten (data pipelines, ETL processen)
This position requires an excellent control of the Dutch language in writing and speech. Minimum B2.


Show more

  • Afgeronde WO opleiding in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science of vergelijkbare richting
  • 2-5 jaar ervaring met het bouwen van production-grade machine learning systemen
  • Uitstekende programmeervaardigheden in Python, inclusief ervaring met software development best practices zoals testing, versioning en code reviews
  • Grondige kennis van ML frameworks (zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) en begrip van fundamentele ML-concepten
  • Ervaring met cloud platforms, met name AWS en specifiek SageMaker
  • Bekend met containerization (Docker)
  • Ervaring met CI/CD pipelines en MLOps principes
  • Affiniteit met data engineering concepten (data pipelines, ETL processen)
  • This position requires an excellent control of the Dutch language in writing and speech. Minimum B2.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
At Sytac, we’re on a mission to become the leading name in digital solutions. We aim to help Dutch companies stay ahead with the latest technology. We’re not just another IT company; we’re a lively team of tech enthusiasts dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Our success comes from our amazing team—people who love technology and are dedicated to being the best in everything we do.




If you’re excited about leveraging your AI expertise to drive innovation and make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!




We are looking for strong AI Platform Engineers with expertise in Azure, specifically in Azure AI services, Azure ML, Azure AI Foundry, Agentic frameworks, AI gateway for LLMs, and advanced RAG architecture (we already have vanilla RAG in place). Experience with Databricks Mosaic is highly desirable.




Your role will involve:

Designing, building, and testing the infrastructure of a central AI Platform on Azure using the latest AI and GenAI capabilities.
Ensuring a seamless operation and deployment of Azure AI services.
Designing, improving, and maintaining CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps.
Integrating various tools and technologies in the DevOps toolchain to accelerate Data Science teams’ use cases from development to real-world applications.
Ensuring reliability and monitoring the usage, availability, and health of systems and products.
Identifying industry best practices and assessing the feasibility and benefits of implementing such practices.
Collaborating with various team members and teams to develop infrastructure that supports AI services.




Profile Description / Minimum Qualifications

Minimum 4 years of hands-on experience building, managing, supporting, and automating cloud environments (preferably in Azure).
Strong expertise in Azure AI services, Azure ML, Azure AI Foundry, AI Gateway for LLMs, RAG architectures (advanced RAG), and Databricks Mosaic.
Proficiency in IaC (Infrastructure as Code) and PaC (Policy as Code) (e.g., Bicep, Terraform).
Strong experience in scripting and programming languages (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell).
Minimum 4 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer, managing applications end-to-end in a cloud environment, including designing solutions, building, monitoring, and maintaining systems (preferably in Azure).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitLab, GitHub Actions—preferably Azure).
Awareness and familiarity with security and compliance standards for enterprise cloud adoption.
Determination and “stubbornness” to drive solutions and implement the right strategies.
Fluent in English (verbal and written).




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Data Science and Engineering tools from our tech stack (e.g., Databricks, Apache Spark, MLflow, Airflow).
Experience with monitoring tools for cloud environments.
Certifications in Azure-104, Azure-204, Azure-500 are a plus.

Show more

  • Minimum 4 years of hands-on experience building, managing, supporting, and automating cloud environments (preferably in Azure).
  • Strong expertise in Azure AI services, Azure ML, Azure AI Foundry, AI Gateway for LLMs, RAG architectures (advanced RAG), and Databricks Mosaic.
  • Proficiency in IaC (Infrastructure as Code) and PaC (Policy as Code) (e.g., Bicep, Terraform).
  • Strong experience in scripting and programming languages (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell).
  • Minimum 4 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer, managing applications end-to-end in a cloud environment, including designing solutions, building, monitoring, and maintaining systems (preferably in Azure).
  • Proficiency in CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, GitLab, GitHub Actions—preferably Azure).
  • Awareness and familiarity with security and compliance standards for enterprise cloud adoption.
  • Determination and “stubbornness” to drive solutions and implement the right strategies.
  • Fluent in English (verbal and written).


Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Data Science and Engineering tools from our tech stack (e.g., Databricks, Apache Spark, MLflow, Airflow).
  • Experience with monitoring tools for cloud environments.
  • Certifications in Azure-104, Azure-204, Azure-500 are a plus.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you interested in using machine learning, software engineering and data for practical and socially relevant questions?

Your function

Are you a driven Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for intelligent systems, strong software engineering skills, and a good understanding of data infrastructure? In the nascent data, AI, and innovation team at the VU, you will have the unique opportunity to make an impact on research and education as both an architect and builder. You will be responsible for the full lifecycle of machine learning models and systems, from conceptual design to successful implementation, and will play a crucial role in designing, setting up, and optimizing the necessary infrastructure and data pipelines.

In this collaborative role, you will work closely with data engineers, data scientists, software developers, and experts from education and research. As a member of a new team, you will have the unique opportunity to help shape the VU's data and AI strategy, with ample room for personal and professional growth.

Your Tasks Include


Understanding and translating business and functional needs into concrete machine learning problem statements and results.
Designing and developing scalable machine learning and deep learning solutions that meet the organization's needs.
Performing data processing tasks such as normalization, feature selection, dimensionality reduction, and handling missing or outlier data.
Working closely with data scientists, data engineers, and development teams to improve, develop, and implement machine learning algorithms.
Translating machine learning algorithms into production-ready code.
Evaluating model performance using cross-validation and relevant metrics.
Monitoring implemented models, detecting data or concept drift, and updating or retraining models as needed.
Ensuring compliance with performance standards and data security requirements.
Continuously staying informed about new developments in machine learning and implementing them within the organization.


Your profile

Personal Skills


You have the ability to experiment and analyze results. You are curious and eager to learn, think analytically, and work methodically. You are also enterprising and enjoy taking initiative.
Ability to communicate technical concepts and results in an understandable way to both technical and business stakeholders.
Ability to collaborate effectively with multiple teams and stakeholders, including analytics teams, development teams, product management, and operations. You have a constructive attitude and can connect interests.
Experimental and entrepreneurial mindset.
You are eager to learn and enjoy staying up-to-date with the latest (technical) developments.


Technical Skills


Expert knowledge of PyTorch, cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP), and Python.
Proficiency in machine learning algorithms such as multi-class classification, decision trees, support vector machines, and deep learning.
Understanding of probability and statistical models (generative and descriptive models).
Advanced programming experience with C/C++, Java, R, Python.
You have experience with version control systems.


What do we offer?

Education

A challenging position in a socially engaged organisation. At VU Amsterdam, you contribute to education, research and service for a better world. And that is valuable. So in return for your efforts, we offer you:


a salary of minimum € 4.537,00 (Scale 11) and maximum € 6.209,00 (Scale 11) gross per month, on a full-time basis. This is based on UFO profile Engineering and Application Manager 3. The exact salary depends on your education and experience.
a position for at least 0.8 FTE. Your employment contract will initially last 1 year. Afterwards, there is a prospect of a permanent contract.


We also offer you attractive fringe benefits and regulations. Some examples:


A full-time 38-hour working week comes with a holiday leave entitlement of 232 hours per year. If you choose to work 40 hours, you have 96 extra holiday leave hours on an annual basis. For part-timers, this is calculated pro rata.
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
space for personal development
hybrid working enables a good work-life balance
a wide range of sports facilities which staff may use at a modest charge


About Us

Over het team

The VU has established the AI Competence Network (AICN) to stimulate and facilitate active, cross-domain, and multidisciplinary collaboration. The primary goal is to jointly develop and apply responsible AI solutions that add concrete value and create a positive impact in education, research, and operations. From the new data, AI, and innovation team, you will contribute to this on behalf of IT.

Information Technology

We at Information Technology (IT) have the responsibility of ensuring a worry-free digital environment for researchers, students and staff. We facilitate teaching and research with IT resources, advise on IT products and services, and keep the application landscape for work and study up-to-date. We ensure that the university’s IT facilities are up and running 24/7.

At the same time, we focus on the future of digital - everything from the smart campus and cyber security to open science and artificial intelligence. Along with the faculties and service departments, we look ahead to ask: how can we prepare now for tomorrow’s questions? Together we look for better and better ways to support the university’s ambitions in the areas of education, research and valorisation.

Are you interested in joining IT? Working in IT means operating on a complex, often hectic and challenging playing field, where both development and management demand your attention. We give you plenty of scope to show initiative and take responsibility. Learning from one another is key, while remaining focused on results. In Information Technology, you will join over 200 colleagues spread over 4 departments.

Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam

Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam stands for values-driven education and research. We are open-minded experts with the ability to think freely - a broader mind. Maintaining an entrepreneurial perspective and concentrating on diversity, significance and humanity, we work on sustainable solutions with social impact. By joining forces, across the boundaries of disciplines, we work towards a better world for people and planet. Together we create a safe and respectful working and study climate, and an inspiring environment for education and research. Learn more about our codes of conduct

We are located on one physical campus, in the heart of Amsterdam's Zuidas business district, with excellent location and accessibility. Over 6,150 staff work at the VU and over 31,000 students attend academic education.

Diversity

Diversity is the driving force of VU Amsterdam. VU wants to be accessible and receptive to diversity in disciplines, cultures, ideas, nationalities, beliefs, preferences and worldviews. We believe that trust, respect, interest and differences lead to new insights and innovation, to sharpness and clarity, to excellence and a broader understanding.

We stand for an inclusive community and believe that diversity and internationalisation contribute to the quality of education, research and our services.

Therefore, we are always searching for people whose backgrounds and experience contribute to the diversity of the VU community.

Interested

Are you interested in this position and do you believe that your experience will contribute to the excellence of our services? In that case, we encourage you to submit your application, even if you don't meet all requirements.

Submitting a diploma is part of the application process.

Applications received by e-mail will not be considered.

Acquisition in response to this advertisement is not appreciated.

Title: AI engineer
Description:
Please note that we are only accepting candidates that live in or near the city of Amsterdam, The Netherlands. While we fully embrace remote work, we also value culture and connection - so our ideal candidate will be excited to come and join us at our studio at least once a week to share the energy and excitement of what we’re building together.

 

About Us

Huub is a platform that fully automates specific business processes by leveraging AI intelligently. We operate with a lean team of tech professionals and subject matter experts to develop and roll out these functionalities in the market. Are you looking for a place where you can work on concrete solutions for urgent problems while using bleeding-edge technology? Then Huub might be the right place for you.

 

Job Description

As an AI Engineer focusing on Prompt Engineering and Advanced AI Architecture, you will be responsible for designing, optimizing, and implementing AI solutions that enhance conversational and decision-making processes. You will improve AI-driven workflows by leveraging advanced AI agent architectures, efficient AI integrations, and prompt engineering.

You will work closely with other AI Engineers, platform architects, CI/CD teams, and UX specialists to ensure that our AI systems perform optimally, remain secure, and comply with best practices. You will contribute to the development of innovative methods to make AI interactions more effective, scalable, and intuitive.

 

Responsibilities

AI Architecture & Modeling

Integrate and optimize chat and reasoning models using LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith within AI workflows.
Design and develop AI agents with advanced context management and memory architectures.
Apply Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to enhance information management.
Collaborate with infrastructure teams to build scalable and reliable AI solutions.

 

Prompt Engineering & Conversation Design

Develop and optimize prompts for various use cases within AI-driven processes.
Design and refine conversational flows and agent-based workflows within AI systems.
Implement safety guardrails and moderation strategies to ensure the reliability and ethical standards of AI interactions.

 

Requirements

Proven experience with cutting-edge AI technologies and methodologies.
A Master’s degree (WO) in AI, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
At least 3 years of experience in AI engineering, machine learning, or a similar technical role.
Experience in prompt engineering and conversation design for LLMs.
Deep knowledge of LangChain, LangGraph, and LangSmith.
Experience in designing robust AI agents and context-based workflows.
Understanding of AI ethics and moderation to build secure AI solutions.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills and a proactive mindset.




What We Offer

Huub operates as a lean tech startup, giving you the opportunity to build innovative AI solutions using cutting-edge technology. We offer a dynamic work environment where you have the freedom to develop your expertise and make an impact in a fast-growing AI ecosystem. We offer a competitive salary package with equity participation.




How to Apply

Send your CV and cover letter to vincent.lindeboom@huub.nl

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities


Integrate machine learning models with operational applications and tools
Design and build APIs and software libraries that support the integration of models
Manage, deploy models at scale that solve business problems
Optimize machine learning models through hyperparameter tuning and feature engineering to better solve defined business problems
You will be part of the analytics engineering lifecycle, including designing distributed systems, writing production-level code for data sciences models, conduct code reviews while working alongside our data engineering and infrastructure teams.
Support the investigation of new software packages/tools, APIs, and algorithms to deliver quality analytics and machine learning at scale


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering or related field
3 to 5 years of experience in Machine Learning Engineering
Experience working with Databricks
Experience with GitLab pipelines
Competency with infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform with AWS)
Experience with MLOps & model lifecycle management using Databricks
Experience with development & deployment of large scale Machine Learning Project 2+ years of experience with MLOps
Develop & test large scale machine learning applications with team of data scientists and engineers
Experience with various programming and scripting languages (Python, Bash, C++)
Extensive knowledge of machine learning evaluation metrics and best practices
Collaborative individual who thrives in a team environment, specifically within a matrix organization
Creative problem solver and innovator


What makes' working as MLE at Brenntag great?


Opportunity to develop high impact & real value generating machine learning applications.


What you can expect from us:


Unique greenfield environment to drive change in a global business
Have fun working in the passionate and experienced team
Opportunity to present your ideas and learn from others at our Product Engineering Guild
Hybrid workplace model
Cool office with canteen, Friday beers and Nintendo Switch
Competitive compensation package
International team
Friendly and supportive colleagues


Brenntag provides equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees of all backgrounds and identities to create a workplace where difference is valued because it forms a resilient and more innovative organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion or belief, parental and family status, or any other protected characteristic. We welcome applications from women, men and non-binary candidates of all ethnicities and socio-economic backgrounds.

Brenntag TA Team

Title: Data scientist | Utrecht
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about data and location? Does the complexity of what lies beneath our feet excite you just as much as the challenges of working with large databases? Do you have hands-on experience in operationalizing AI solutions? Join TNO – Geological Survey of the Netherlands (TNO-GDN) in Utrecht as a Data Scientist and make your mark on the future.

What will be your role?

At TNO-GDN, we turn geological data into 3D models of the subsurface to help the Netherlands better understand what’s happening underground.

Subsurface information plays a vital role in spatial planning (think large infrastructure or construction projects), the energy transition (such as geothermal energy and storage), safety (like earthquakes and dike monitoring), and climate adaptation (including drought and drinking water). With the help of data and models, we explore the potential of the subsurface, assess how to use it sustainably, and advise on opportunities and risks.

The Netherlands holds an enormous wealth of subsurface data, managed by TNO-GDN in the BRO (Key Register of the Subsurface) and the DINO database. Turning this data into a model, analysis, or AI solution that’s ready for internal or external use involves many steps. That’s where you come in. With your enthusiasm for data and passion for the Dutch subsurface, you’ll help make complex data clear and accessible using innovative techniques. Your work will directly support one of the largest programmes within TNO and contribute to solving major challenges in energy, water, and critical materials.

What We Expect From You

As a Geo Data Scientist, you’ll work in a multidisciplinary team within the GeoData & Information Management department. Expect a dynamic group of developers, database specialists, and geoscientists. Together, you’ll develop new ways to gain insights from subsurface data. About 60% of your time will be dedicated to research and development of AI solutions. The remaining 40% will be spent on putting those solutions into production—together with MLOps experts, cloud engineers, and infrastructure specialists.

You’re curious and eager to grow your skills in programming, (geo)statistics, machine learning, and AI deployment. Thanks to your creativity and proactive attitude, you quickly absorb new knowledge and apply it to real-world challenges. Your strong communication skills help you share your insights with colleagues from different backgrounds and a wider audience. You keep up with the latest AI developments and take ownership of your projects.

What you bring


A degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Geo Statistics, Earth Sciences, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in applied AI projects, with solutions deployed to broad internal or external user groups (or even at enterprise level).
Affinity with geosciences or geospatial data science is a plus.
A creative problem-solver with a solution-driven mindset.
Enthusiastic about learning new technologies and software.
Able to explain complex theories or problems in a clear and simple way.
A collaborative team player who can also work independently.
Experienced in designing, implementing, and operationalizing data-driven solutions.
Strong in Python, PyTorch, and/or R.
Familiar with cloud environments—preferably Microsoft Azure.
Skilled in bringing AI solutions into production.
Knowledgeable across the full AI lifecycle, including monitoring.
Experienced with MLOps and version control for data and code.
Comfortable navigating and adapting within complex organizations.


What You'll Get In Return

Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 4.473,- and € 7.406 (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.

TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect


An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field.
The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs.
33 days annual leave on a full-time basis.
An employer that values and encourages diverse talent, with initiatives like the Female Leadership Program, our Rainbow Community and round tables on inclusion topics.
We offer a comprehensive and flexible mobility plan that also includes full compensation for public transportation for commuting and business travel.
Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues . That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly.
Flexible working hours, the possibility to work parttime (32 of 36 hours) and the possibility of working from home.
Extensive relocation package for international candidates.
A good pension scheme.


Read More About Tailoring Your Benefits Package.

TNO as an employer

At TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer .

At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion .

The selection process

Please apply before 18th of May, 2025. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.

The selection process may include an online assessment and a reference check.

A certificate of Conduct (VOG) is required before starting a new job at TNO.

The remaining 40% will be spent on putting those solutions into production—together with MLOps experts, cloud engineers, and infrastructure specialists.

You’re curious and eager to grow your skills in programming, (geo)statistics, machine learning, and AI deployment. Thanks to your creativity and proactive attitude, you quickly absorb new knowledge and apply it to real-world challenges. Your strong communication skills help you share your insights with colleagues from different backgrounds and a wider audience. You keep up with the latest AI developments and take ownership of your projects.

What you bring

  • A degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Geo Statistics, Earth Sciences, or a related field.
  • At least 5 years of experience in applied AI projects, with solutions deployed to broad internal or external user groups (or even at enterprise level).
  • Affinity with geosciences or geospatial data science is a plus.
  • A creative problem-solver with a solution-driven mindset.
  • Enthusiastic about learning new technologies and software.
  • Able to explain complex theories or problems in a clear and simple way.
  • A collaborative team player who can also work independently.
  • Experienced in designing, implementing, and operationalizing data-driven solutions.
  • Strong in Python, PyTorch, and/or R.
  • Familiar with cloud environments—preferably Microsoft Azure.
  • Skilled in bringing AI solutions into production.
  • Knowledgeable across the full AI lifecycle, including monitoring.
  • Experienced with MLOps and version control for data and code.
  • Comfortable navigating and adapting within complex organizations.

What You'll Get In Return

Challenging and varied work with a real impact. And plenty of opportunities as, at TNO, you are in charge of shaping your career. We offer a gross monthly salary between € 4.473,- and € 7.406 (based on your knowledge and experience), 8% holiday pay, a 13th month bonus of 8.33% and a flex budget (5.58% + € 180). In addition, you will be given every opportunity to develop yourself.

TNO offers optional employee benefits, enabling you to tailor your benefits package to match your personal situation. You may also expect

  • An extremely professional, innovative working environment where colleagues are leading experts in their field.
  • The opportunity to attend courses, workshops and conferences, and to receive training and coaching based on your needs.
  • 33 days annual leave on a full-time basis.
  • An employer that values and encourages diverse talent, with initiatives like the Female Leadership Program, our Rainbow Community and round tables on inclusion topics.
  • We offer a comprehensive and flexible mobility plan that also includes full compensation for public transportation for commuting and business travel.
  • Great social events with your team and other TNO colleagues . That’s how you will get to know a lot of people really quickly.
  • Flexible working hours, the possibility to work parttime (32 of 36 hours) and the possibility of working from home.
  • Extensive relocation package for international candidates.
  • A good pension scheme.

Read More About Tailoring Your Benefits Package.

TNO as an employer

At TNO, we innovate for a healthier, safer and more sustainable life. And for a strong economy. Since 1932, we have been making knowledge and technology available for the common good. We find each other in wonder and ingenuity. We are driven to push boundaries. There is all the space and support for your talent and ambition. You work with people who will challenge you who inspire you and want to learn from you. Our state-of-the-art facilities are there to realize your vision. What you do at TNO matters impact makes the difference. Because with every innovation you contribute to tomorrow’s world. Read more about TNO as an employer .

At TNO we encourage an inclusive work environment, where you can be yourself. Whatever your story and whatever unique qualities you bring to the table. It is by combining our unique strengths and perspectives that we are able to develop innovations that make a real difference in society. Want to know more? Read what steps we are taking in the area of diversity and inclusion .

The selection process

Please apply before 18th of May, 2025. The selection process comprises two interview rounds. In a final meeting we will discuss the terms of employment and your tailored benefits package. We aim to finalize the entire process within four weeks.

The selection process may include an online assessment and a reference check.

A certificate of Conduct (VOG) is required before starting a new job at TNO.

Title: ML Platform Engineer (Python, MLFlow, Airflow)
Description:
About Sytac:

At Sytac, we’re on a mission to be the leading name in digital solutions, helping Dutch companies stay ahead with cutting-edge technology. We’re not just another IT company; we’re a lively team of tech enthusiasts pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Our success comes from our amazing people—those who love technology and strive to be the best in everything they do. Our goal is to be recognized as one of the top 10 tech partners and among the top 25 employers for tech professionals. Join us as we work to make a real difference in the world of technology!




Job Description

Are you passionate about leveraging cutting-edge Machine Learning technologies? As a Platform Engineer, you’ll contribute to various Analytics Engineering projects, supporting data scientists in training, deploying, monitoring, and operationalizing models. You’ll play a key role in developing and maintaining a scalable data execution platform while promoting good coding practices and creating reusable solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

ML Platform Development: Collaborate to design, develop, and maintain a central ML platform.
Model Deployment: Help data scientists train, deploy, and monitor models in production.
Software Engineering: Ensure good practices like versioning, testing, documentation, and code review.
CI/CD Templates: Develop reusable code and CI/CD templates for model deployment and lifecycle management.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists and engineers to integrate MLOps capabilities.
Monitoring & Observability: Implement solutions for monitoring and tracking model performance.
Automation: Automate deployment and provisioning with Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.




Profile Requirements:

ML: Solid experience in ML projects and tools like sklearn, MLFlow, and TensorFlow.
MLOps: Deep understanding of MLOps architecture and processes.
Data: Proficiency in SQL and Python, with experience in Apache Airflow and Kubernetes.
Engineering: Knowledge of best practices (version control, testing, code reviews).
Cloud: Familiarity with GCP or Azure, and experience with SQL/NoSQL databases.
Distributed: Experience with large-scale, secure applications in distributed systems.
Communication: Strong English skills and a team player mentality.




About the Team:

You’ll be part of a dynamic, multi-national, and multi-cultural team building a cloud-ready Data Analytics Platform. The team, consisting of ML Platform Engineers and MLOps Engineers, has already delivered a Machine Learning Platform on-premise and is now transitioning to Google Cloud Platform. Join us on this exciting journey to shape a data-driven future.




What We Offer:

Salary: €70K–€100K based on seniority
Pension: 7.7% contribution with BeFrank (3.85% from us)
Vacation: 25 days for work-life balance
Sytac Days: Time for conferences or certifications
Training Budget: Up to €2400/year for professional development
Tech/WFH Budget: €500 to start + €30/month
Bike Lease: We cover 50% of installments
Car Lease: Flexible commuting options
Commuting: €0.23/km or NS Business Card
Events: Sports, ski trips, BBQs, and more
Referral Bonus: Rewards for great hires (up to €5K)
Dutch Classes: To help immerse in Dutch culture




If you’re excited about leveraging your machine-learning expertise to drive innovation, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Mid-Snr AI & Data Engineer (Contract – Detachering Only)

Location: Utrecht, Netherlands (On-site/Hybrid)

Contract Duration: 6 months

Start Date: 19 May 2025

Hours per Week: 36

Salary: € 6800 - € 7083 per month




Important Requirements

Must be fluent in Dutch
Must be currently residing in the Netherlands
Only candidates via Detachering (secondment) will be considered — no ZZP (freelancers)




Role Overview

We are looking for a Senior AI & Data Engineer to support a large-scale ICT transformation project for a leading public sector organization in the Netherlands. This role involves the development of intelligent data pipelines, execution of data migrations, and deployment of modern AI-driven search capabilities in Microsoft Azure.




Key Responsibilities

Set up cloud environments and pipelines in Microsoft Azure
Execute complex data migrations, including document and structured data
Build tools to support recidivism detection and contextual document classification
Deliver search infrastructure using ElasticSearch and AI-driven techniques (LLMs, RAG, Vector Search, Graph Search)
Support broader infrastructure improvements for enhanced information discovery and knowledge work




Project Context

This position is part of a broader ICT renewal program extending to 2027. You will operate with a high degree of independence, delivering defined outcomes with regular reviews. The environment is structured for professionals capable of driving results autonomously.




Required Qualifications

University degree (WO-level or higher)
3+ years in developing and implementing AI & Data Science solutions
Strong Python development experience (as a Senior or Lead Developer)
Proven expertise with Microsoft Azure for setting up environments and executing data projects
Deep understanding of metadata, MDM, data modeling, and modern search technologies
Solid theoretical and applied foundation in AI and data science techniques




Preferred Experience

Prior work in regulated sectors or government organizations
Experience in large-scale, automated environments
Completed WO+ (postgraduate) education




If you’re a Dutch-speaking AI & Data Engineering expert currently based in the Netherlands, and seeking your next challenge within a high-impact public sector program, we encourage you to apply — detachering candidates only.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Deze vacature in het kort

Vacaturenummer: 1165790 Type: Vast Sluitingsdatum: 23-05-2025

Locatie: Amsterdam (Hoofdkantoor) Salarisschaal (36 uur): 10 max € 5.376,- (inclusief 21% IKB max € 6.504,-) Aantal uur: 36

Wat ga je doen en waar draag je aan bij?

Word jij onze ambitieuze AI Engineer met een passie voor duurzame technologie en innovatie? Bij Waternet werk je aan toonaangevende projecten die bijdragen aan een slimme en efficiënte waterhuishouding. Word onderdeel van ons team en draag bij aan de toekomst van waterbeheer!

Wat ga je doen?

Als AI engineer werk je mee aan het ontwikkelen en implementeren van AI-oplossingen voor de gehele watercyclus. Samen zorgen we ervoor dat er drinkwater uit je kraan komt, maar ook dat het riool goed werkt, dat je droge voeten houdt én dat grachten schoon blijven. In deze nieuwe, uitdagende rol denk je mee over de back-end, richt je deze in, voer je data-analyse uit en train en implementeer je modellen om de processen binnen Waternet te optimaliseren.

Hoe Je Werkweek Eruit Ziet


Start van de week met een gezamenlijke stand-up om de werkzaamheden te bespreken
Twee keer per week samen op kantoor werken voor o.a. het overleg en een prettige samenwerking
Ontwikkelen van modellen voor bedrijfstaken binnen Waternet, zoals waterzuivering of emissiereductie
Afstemmen van functionaliteiten met de business
Ophalen, opschonen en voorbereiden van data
Testen van modellen en analyseren van resultaten
Voorbereiden van deployment en monitoren van modelprestaties
Uitvoeren van code reviews en samenwerken met collega’s
Deelnemen aan refinement-sessies om werk te prioriteren en op te splitsen
Bijwonen of geven van kennissessies om kennis te delen en bij te blijven


Welkom in het team

Je komt terecht in het Datalab-team, dat deel uitmaakt van de afdeling IV/ICT – een afdeling die de afgelopen tijd flink is gegroeid. Datalab is een klein, dynamisch en flexibel team dat op verschillende plekken binnen de organisatie actief is. Hierdoor krijg je de kans om snel kennis te maken met de verschillende afdelingen en processen binnen Waternet. Alles wat we doen, draait om één belangrijk doel: het leveren van schoon, veilig en duurzaam water.

Samen werken we aan innovatieve oplossingen voor een waterhuishouding die klaar is voor de toekomst.

Wat breng je mee?


Je beschikt over HBO werk- en denkniveau
Je hebt een passie voor Kunstmatige intelligentie, met name de benodigde backend
Je hebt interesse in Large Language Models en bent ook bekend met manieren om image recognition toe te passen.
Een afgeronde opleiding in Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Informatica, Data Science of een gerelateerd veld.
Ervaring met Python, en frameworks zoals TensorFlow of PyTorch.
Kennis van cloudtechnologie met name azure
Probleemoplossend vermogen en creativiteit om complexe uitdagingen aan te gaan.
Affiniteit met duurzaamheid en een bijdrage willen leveren aan maatschappelijke impact.
Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal goed, zowel in woord als geschrift.


Dit krijg je ervoor terug

Als je bij Waternet werkt, heb je uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden:  


Salaris tussen de € 3.952,- en € 5.376,- (schaal 10) bruto per maand voor 36 uur per week, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.
Maar liefst 21% van jouw maandsalaris bestaat uit Individueel Keuze Budget (IKB). Hiermee kun je bijvoorbeeld extra verlofuren kopen, opleiding bekostigen of je kunt het gewoon laten uitbetalen als loon
Je krijgt 151,2 uur vakantie op jaarbasis bij 36 uur per week
Hybride werken; de mogelijkheid om de helft van je week thuis te werken
Mogelijkheid tot flexibele werktijden, afhankelijk van je werkzaamheden, zoals 4x9 uur
Een ruim opleidingsbudget van minimaal € 6.000,-
Een reiskostenvergoeding van € 0,23 netto per kilometer of een vergoeding op basis van 2e-klasse woon-werk verkeer
Een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 3,- netto per thuiswerkdag
Een vergoeding van maximaal € 850,- om je thuiswerkplek in te richten
Een pensioenverzekering via het ABP Pensioenfonds


Werken bij Waternet

Bij Waternet werk je met een uniek product: water. Samen met zo’n 2000 collega’s zorgen we voor veilig drinkwater, schone grachten, rivieren en droge voeten. Waternet werkt met de nieuwste technieken en is bijna 100% klimaatneutraal. Bij ons werken echte vakmensen: van dijkinspecteur tot dataspecialist en van techneut tot teamleider. Al deze betrokken medewerkers maken Waternet samen tot een werkgever waar je jezelf kan zijn. Wij stimuleren je om elke dag een stukje beter te worden. Je vindt dan ook een groot aanbod aan opleidingen en trainingen bij onze eigen Waternet Academie.

Wij vragen onze nieuwe medewerkers om een geldige Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag. Een assessment kan onderdeel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure.

Nieuwsgierig?

Wil je meer weten over de vacature AI Engineer of heb je vragen over werken bij Waternet? Neem contact op met Warsha Ramkhelawan van recruitment. Zij is bereikbaar op warsha.ramkhelawan@waternet.nl of +31625047112.

Sollicitatieprocedure


Je solliciteert online


Leuk dat je solliciteert! Wij nemen alle cv’s en brieven door. Na sluitingsdatum krijg je binnen een week een reactie.


Telefoontje van een recruiter


We nodigen je uit voor een 1e gesprek.


1e gesprek


Je maakt kennis met je leidinggevende en een directe collega. We willen weten of je bij de functie en het team past. En jij hebt vast ook veel vragen aan ons.


2e gesprek


Meestal willen we je een 2e keer spreken. Bij dit gesprek gaan we dieper in op de inhoud van de functie.


Aanbod


Ben jij de nieuwe collega die we zoeken en ben jij ook blij? Dan krijg je van ons een goed aanbod. Onze recruiter belt je hierover persoonlijk.


Je tekent je contract


Welkom bij Waternet!

Solliciteer nu

Werken bij Waternet


Informele cultuur
Zinvol werk
Veel vrijheid


Solliciteer nu

Heb je nog vragen?

Bel onze recruiter

Warsha Ramkhelawan

+31625047112

(U verlaat deze site) (U verlaat deze site) (U verlaat deze site)

Solliciteer nu

Title: AI Engineer
Company: Sprints & Sneakers | Growth Marketing Agency | Bcorp
Description:
Functieomschrijving

Waar impact, experiment en AI samenkomen.

We zoeken bij Sprints & Sneakers een AI Engineer die AI en Automation technologie slim inzet om processen te versnellen, teams te versterken en onze impact te vergroten. Iemand die met AI-oplossingen werkt, zonder opnieuw het wiel uit te vinden. Als je wel het wiel opnieuw kunt uitvinden is dat natuurlijk ook van harte welkom!

Over de rol

Als AI Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het inzetten van AI-tools om werk te automatiseren, data-analyse te versnellen en onze teams en partners efficiënter te laten werken. Je koppelt tools aan elkaar, traint collega's in gebruik, en bouwt werkbare oplossingen op basis van platformen zoals ChatGPT, Claude, Zapier, Make, Notion AI en Langchain.

Je vertaalt behoeften naar concrete automatiseringen, promptflows en slimme workflows die écht verschil maken.

Kortom, je krijgt de ruimte om écht vette dingen te bouwen!

Over Sprints & Sneakers

Sprints & Sneakers is een Growth Marketing Agency in Amsterdam en Groningen. Het is ons doel om bedrijven te helpen groeien die een positieve impact maken op de wereld. Dit doen we door creatieve-, datagedreven experimenten op het gebied van marketing & sales. Ons team bestaat uit zo’n 40 collega’s. Vanaf april 2024 willen wij in 1000 dagen groeien naar een team van 100 collega’s waarin we 100 impact gedreven partners helpen groeien.

Maandag tot donderdag werken we met onze partners. Vrijdag staat in het teken van onze eigen groei. Zowel die van onszelf als die van sprints & Sneakers. Elke vrijdag hebben we een training en werken we aan ons persoonlijk groeipad. Daarnaast werken we aan verbeterprojecten, strategie en gaan we aan het verbeteren van onze processen en key tactics.

Onze Core Values


Be honest
Always be learning
Build valuable relationships
Have respect
Ownership
Make it memorable
Put in the work


Vereisten


Ervaren in het toepassen van AI-tools in een zakelijke context.
Affiniteit mat marketing is een grote pre
Handig met no-code en low-code tools
Nieuwsgierig en leergierig: je ontdekt, test en deelt
Analytisch en procesmatig sterk
Bekend met het AI-landschap (LLMs, vector databases, RAG)
Zelfstandig en resultaatgericht, zonder de samenwerking te verliezen


Wat je gaat doen?


Inzetten en koppelen van AI-tools
Bouwen van werkende proof-of-concepts en automatiseringen voor interne teams en partners
Meedenken met onze growth teams over slimme AI-oplossingen in customer journeys
Verzorgen van interne kennisdeling over AI-toepassingen (prompting, use cases, risico’s)
Proactief spotten van kansen om werk slimmer en sneller te maken


Wat Krijg Je Van Ons


Salaris tussen de €3.000 - €5.000 bruto per maand op basis van ervaring en impact die je gaat maken
Een baan die niet alleen inhoudelijk leuk is, maar ook nog veel zingeving brengt. We zijn niet voor niets B-Corp.
Naast werken voor onze growth partners, met regelmaat goede doelen helpen via onze Growth for Good projecten.
Mogelijkheid om mede-eigenaar van S&S te worden via ons aandelenprogramma.
Ieder jaar mee op Team Trip!
Winstdeling op basis van rol en performance.
25 vakantiedagen en 4 Quality of Life dagen.
NS Businesscard.
Elke dag een heerlijke veggie lunch op kantoor en elke vrijdag Chef’s Lunch
Een referral bonus als je een nieuwe partner of collega aandraagt.
Een persoonlijk groeipad waarin we samen met jou werken aan jouw persoonlijke en professionele groei via onze Academy
Een flexibel wellbeing budget van €35,- per maand via Alleo.


Recruitmentproces


Een kennismakingsgesprek met Hugo om te kijken of er een wederzijdse match is.
Het maken van een case op kantoor
Een meeloopdag waarin jij erachter komt hoe het is om bij ons te werken, en wij erachter komen hoe jij bent als collega.
Als laatste stap volgt er een gesprek met een van de eigenaren van Sprints & Sneakers.
Bij een wederzijdse match, verwelkomen we je graag in Team Sprints & Sneakers!


Sprints & Sneakers is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Onze beslissingen bij het aannemen zijn gebaseerd op objectieve maatstaven en we zullen niet discrimineren tegen enig aspect van jouw identiteit. Wij geloven dat een divers team essentieel is voor ons gezamenlijk succes en waarderen een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zijn impact kan maken en zijn ware unieke zelf op het werk kan brengen.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there! 👋

Are you an ambitious Senior Machine Learning engineer? Do you want to use your data science and engineering skills to help fast-growing tech scale-ups in ClimateTech, Mobility and Marketplaces by means of ML? Furthermore, are you ready for the adventure of expanding Enjins together with our ambitious team? Then keep reading!

About Us 🚀

At Enjins, we're committed to building AI solutions for meaningful change. We do this for customers in industries where a positive change can be made: Climate tech, Mobility and Marketplaces. Our portfolio includes partnerships with renowned names like Crisp, Groendus, SnappCar, Tier Mobility, Independer, PlanBlue (check our cases page for examples of our work).

With our headquarters in the Netherlands (Utrecht) and a second hub in Berlin we have shown impressive growth year-over-year, a proven proposition that fits current market needs, and a strong branding that resembles quality, innovation, and pragmatism. In 2024, we'll continue to invest in expanding our sales team within the Utrecht Hub to further grow our reach in the Dutch scale-up ecosystem. As the AI industry is booming, we have ambitious goals for the coming years ahead. From this hub, our ML engineers develop innovative AI solutions in collaboration with various scale-up customers.

At Enjins, our success hinges upon the quality of our team and the breadth of their ideas. We believe that truly remarkable insights and innovative solutions for our customers emerge from the rich interplay of diverse cultures, knowledge, and experiences among our workforces.

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing Machine Learning team, comprising of 15 other equally amazing Machine Learning Engineers.

In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast and we'll support your growth ambitions as much as possible. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!

Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to;]


You become a full member of our fast-growing ML Engineering team
You'll work in small teams on ML projects for innovative Dutch & foreign clients in ClimateTech, Mobility and Marketplaces.
You'll develop and implement robust ML applications for these clients
You'll apply your data engineering, computer science and machine learning knowledge on projects and you work with the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow and Kafka
You'll translate the to business stakeholders and focus on the human aspects to increase the impact of our ML applications
You'll manage a growing set of projects
Together we will keep building our young company Enjins, in which you will play a more and more important role!


Within 1 month you'll:


Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCP
Start your first customer project!


Within 3 months you'll:


Develop and implement robust ML applications for your client, working on building new solutions and ironing out any old integration problems. This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skills
Had multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skills


Within 6 months you'll:


You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work best
Have helped in the interview process for additional ML Engineers to join Enjins' growing team
Have helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantly



Requirements

Minimum Qualifications:🚶‍♀️


You have a relevant background with respect to Machine Learning Engineering and a minimum of 2 years of relevant working experience, in leading development projects and teams.
You are ambitious, pragmatic and proactive and you like to work in small teams for innovative clients
You are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum results
You know your way around Python, SQL and Git



Preferred Qualifications: 🏃‍♀️


You have experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP) and its data engineering components
You have experience with the world of containerization (Kubernetes & Docker), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOps
You have experience in technical consultancy settings
You are a passionate engineer who loves 1) to contribute to making a positive impact and 2) discovering new programming languages, frameworks or cloud services. After all, our world is changing continuously!
You are fluent in both Dutch and English and are eligible to work in the Netherlands



Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
A dedicated and personal training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level
Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities
Receive an Apple MacBook Pro for work
Enjoy 28 vacation days (based on full-time employment), comprising 20 statutory vacation days and an additional 8 days provided by the employer. You have the flexibility to utilise 3 national holidays (Easter Monday, Whit Monday, & Ascension Day) among the 8 days provided


Have we sparked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:

  • Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
  • Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
  • A dedicated and personal training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level
  • Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
  • Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities
