Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

Title: AI Trainee
Description:
Gezocht: enthousiaste AI-trainee die samen met ons development team werkt aan het ontdekken van creatieve mogelijkheden met Large Language Models.

De essentie


Wie: een enthousiast beginnend werkende met technische aanleg en intrinsiek enthousiasme voor AI en Large Language Models.
Wat: meewerken aan onze development roadmap voor de conversie van WordPress (PHP) naar Sanity (JavaScript), slimmer gebruik van AI voor code review, het testen van applicaties en om creatieve AI-oplossingen bedenken.
Waar: een dynamische werkomgeving op het snijvlak van LLM, DevOps en Prompting.
Waarom: omdat je graag experimenteert met AI-technologie, je development-skills wilt verbeteren én tegelijkertijd ons helpt innoveren. Jij leert van ons, wij leren van jou - een perfecte uitwisseling dus!


Dit Ga Je Doen

Samen met het development team ga je verder op ontdekkingsreis in de wereld van AI. Je werkt onder andere mee aan onze transitie van WordPress naar Sanity, waarbij we optimaal gebruik willen maken van Large Language Models. Je denkt mee over creatieve toepassingen, experimenteert met nieuwe technieken en helpt ons om slimmer te werken met AI. Het belangrijkste is dat we samen de grenzen van AI, Agents, RAG, etc. ontdekken.

Dit Is Het Development Team

Dit vragen wij van jou


Je hebt al veel met AI geëxperimenteerd. Agents, RAG, Gemini, Model chaining en Ollama zijn voor jou bekende woorden.
Je krijgt energie van het ontdekken van nieuwe mogelijkheden met AI
Je bent primair development gedreven en altijd op zoek naar creatieve oplossingen
Kennis van WordPress (PHP) en/of Sanity (JavaScript) is een pre, maar geen must
Lokaal draaien van modellen Modellen en ze aansturen met code heb je vaker gedaan.
We vinden het belangrijk dat je zoveel mogelijk op locatie werkt bij ons en dat je woonachtig bent in Nederland!


Hoe is het om

bij Kaliber te werken?

Loop je weleens over de Zeedijk in Utrecht? Dan heb je ons misschien al gespot. Net naast koffiehuis Dagger, recht aan rivier de Vecht werken wij met 60-ish collega’s in de voormalige broodjesfabriek ‘de Lubro’. Daar maken we, bedenken we, knutselen we, experimenteren we, stickeren we, dansen we, eten we - en springt er soms iemand in een ballenbak. Of verandert het toilet in een discotheek. Wat we vooral in de Lubro doen, is zoveel mogelijk werk maken waar onze opdrachtgevers héél, héél blij van worden. En wij zelf ook.

Dit Krijg Je Bij Ons


Een uitdagend traineeship van 12 maanden met uitzicht op een vaste aanstelling
Persoonlijke begeleiding vanuit het development team, met persoonlijke ondersteuning
Een uitgebreid leer- en ontwikkeltraject om je AI-skills naar een professioneel niveau te tillen
Praktijkervaring in het werken met de nieuwste AI-technologieën
Ruimte voor eigen initiatief en ideeën
Mooi salaris


Cases die we graag delen

We Werken Het Liefste Aan Projecten Waar We Onze Tanden In Kunnen Zetten. Iets Vernieuwends, Uitdagends. Werk Dat Waarde Toevoegt. Af En Toe Winnen We Een Award Met De Oplossingen Die We Bedenken, Maar Dat Vinden We Niet Het Belangrijkste. Het Is Het Werk Zelf Dat Telt. Zoals


Een gepersonaliseerd platform voor Jumbo
Een verfrissende comeback van de 90's hit 'No Limit' voor VodafoneZiggo
Een carrière bij bol begint op dit platform dat wij maakten
Een AI-gedreven Career Coach op de site voor Team EIFFEL


We maken ook graag werk dat buiten de kaders van je computer- of telefoonscherm reikt:


Een AI photobooth die Redditors fascineert
Een WC waarmee we hard gingen op TikTok
Gamification voor gedetineerden
Een interactieve AI installatie die bier bedenkt


Klaar om te solliciteren?

Kriebelt het al? Zin om bij Kaliber aan de slag te gaan? Reageer dan met een korte motivatie en je cv.

We lezen je bericht en als we enthousiast zijn, dan nodigen we je graag uit voor een kennismakingsgesprek. Hierin vertellen wij alles over Kaliber en horen we graag meer over jou. Heb je vragen? Neem dan gerust contact op met Lobke Broers, Talent & Office Manager, via lobke@kaliber.net of 030 287 64 00. Wie weet tot binnenkort!

Please note: due to the nature of our work, you'll need professional Dutch proficiency to rock this job.

En recruiters: we waarderen jullie enthousiasme, maar we regelen onze vacatures liever zelf. Geen acquisitie dus, bedankt!
Show more

  • Mooi salaris

Cases die we graag delen

We Werken Het Liefste Aan Projecten Waar We Onze Tanden In Kunnen Zetten. Iets Vernieuwends, Uitdagends. Werk Dat Waarde Toevoegt. Af En Toe Winnen We Een Award Met De Oplossingen Die We Bedenken, Maar Dat Vinden We Niet Het Belangrijkste. Het Is Het Werk Zelf Dat Telt. Zoals

  • Een gepersonaliseerd platform voor Jumbo
  • Een verfrissende comeback van de 90's hit 'No Limit' voor VodafoneZiggo
  • Een carrière bij bol begint op dit platform dat wij maakten
  • Een AI-gedreven Career Coach op de site voor Team EIFFEL

We maken ook graag werk dat buiten de kaders van je computer- of telefoonscherm reikt:

  • Een AI photobooth die Redditors fascineert
  • Een WC waarmee we hard gingen op TikTok
  • Gamification voor gedetineerden
  • Een interactieve AI installatie die bier bedenkt

Klaar om te solliciteren?

Kriebelt het al? Zin om bij Kaliber aan de slag te gaan? Reageer dan met een korte motivatie en je cv.

We lezen je bericht en als we enthousiast zijn, dan nodigen we je graag uit voor een kennismakingsgesprek. Hierin vertellen wij alles over Kaliber en horen we graag meer over jou. Heb je vragen? Neem dan gerust contact op met Lobke Broers, Talent & Office Manager, via lobke@kaliber.net of 030 287 64 00. Wie weet tot binnenkort!

Please note: due to the nature of our work, you'll need professional Dutch proficiency to rock this job.

En recruiters: we waarderen jullie enthousiasme, maar we regelen onze vacatures liever zelf. Geen acquisitie dus, bedankt!

Title: Agricultural Data Scientist
Description:
As the Agricultural Data Scientist, you contribute to the growth and strategic goals of HZPC by combining Data Science (crop analytics using e.g. (learning) models and business intelligence) with expertise on crop production systems (epidemiology, post-harvest physiology, and disease management) including plant sciences (plant biology, plant and crop physiology). By combining domain-specific knowledge with technical skills, you can work on the design and deployment of decision support systems, offer data-derived analytics to the agronomy team, contribute to business data infrastructures, and be an active member in ongoing (research) projects.




What does this mean?

Agronomical and data science are translated into practical applications to improve the performance of our varieties in seed production.




Main responsibilities of this role

Develop and integrate data infrastructures for seed potato production, ensuring effective data collection and advanced analytics.
Support business decisions by extracting insights from existing and future datasets, using appropriate analytical techniques to enhance variety practices and improve performance.
Provide variety-specific production analytics and agronomic insights to the Agronomy team and other stakeholders.
Design, structure, and implement crop analytics for digital applications and decision-support systems.
Create and support business insight tools, including dashboards and models, to facilitate report generation and data-driven decision-making.
Develop and maintain tooling to share knowledge effectively with agronomy teams, field managers, and farmers, improving collaboration and cultivation practices.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in crop production data technologies, applying them to optimize business processes and analytics.
Take an active role in supervising data integrity and quality to ensure consistency and reliability within existing data infrastructures.
Contribute to experimental research project designs and provide technical support for production-related studies.




Your profile

You are a business-minded, result-oriented professional with strong analytical capabilities and a creative mindset. You excel at identifying opportunities, acting on your own initiative, and collaborating effectively within a team. Your strengths in time management and systematic analysis enable you to manage complex tasks while achieving predetermined goals. You have a natural eagerness to learn and apply new knowledge, coupled with the ability to create innovative solutions to challenges.




In addition, you have:

A Bachelor’s and Master’s degree with solid knowledge of data science and crop science, along with experience in agricultural crop production.
Proficiency in analytical tools such as SQL, Python, and R, and familiarity with relevant software for the tasks described.
Strong command of English in speaking, listening, and writing. Knowledge of the Dutch language is desirable and considered an advantage.




What we offer

This is a full-time, permanent role with a maximum of 40 hours per week. We will discuss together what a workable structure is to be effective for you personally. You will be in our office in Joure, often traveling to our Research site in Metslawier, and collaborate internationally with our colleagues across the globe.




Additionally, we also offer:

A fully HZPC-paid pension, allowing you to focus on your future without worries.
33 days off based on a 40-hour workweek.
A 13th-month salary, paid out monthly for extra financial security.
A place in a dynamic international organization with diverse opportunities for career and personal development.
An additional reward in the form of our variable bonus, paid out every November based on achieved objectives.




About HZPC

Founded in 1898 and rooted in the Netherlands, HZPC has become a global market leader in innovative breeding, seed potato trading, and concept development. Our ambition is sustainable growth. We offer innovative potato varieties that are optimized for local cultivation conditions. We share knowledge and provide solutions that dynamically anticipate the climatic, cultural, and commercial challenges that the whole area of food has to deal with. With 400 employees in 16 countries and exporting to more than 90 countries, we contribute to the availability of responsible food for the well-being of millions of people worldwide. You can find more information on our website: www.hzpc.com.




Your Reaction

We are looking forward to receiving your response! You are invited to show your interest by submitting your application and CV via the application form on the website. For more information about the recruitment process, you can contact Ilse Kuiper (Talent Acquisition Lead) via ilse.kuiper@hzpc.com. For additional information please contact Frank van der Werff (Senior Head Production) via frank.vanderwerff@hzpc.com.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Through your machine learning solutions, you create simplified processes for our customers and help us establish ourselves as 'digital first'.

With a solution-oriented and active mindset, you come up with technical solutions, using AI models. Through your solutions, the data team and the AI team create more business value. In addition to creating business value, knowledge transfer and coaching are also an important part of your job. The goal is to take the engineering skills of your fellow data scientists to the next level, among other things by following best practices.

What you are going to do

You are able to take the lead in devising and designing AI-driven applications. We are currently mainly building state-of-the-art applications with (OpenAI's GPT) LLMs. An important point of attention here is that everything is secure, scalable and repeatable. You will work closely with the Data Scientists to improve the Machine Learning Lifecycle. The focus is on code quality, CI/CD, testing and monitoring. Security is an important part of your application and you are aware of the compliance rules within NN. If you would love to experience an overlap of AI, Software and Data Engineering in your work, then this is your place.


You will further develop a platform solution that is able to classify incoming emails and attachments at scale
You bring AI models (data products) to production, for example in the form of APIs
You develop and maintain the machine learning infrastructure, fitting into the NN landscape
You develop AI applications based on CI/CD, high-quality code, testing and monitoring


What we offer you

NN invests in an inclusive, inspiring work environment and in skills and competences for the future. We match this with employee benefits that are in line with what is needed today and in the future. This way, we offer our employees the opportunity to get the best out of themselves. We offer you:


Salary between €4,414 and €6,306 depending on your knowledge and experience This is based on 40 hours per week. It’s also possible to work 36 or 38 hours per week.
13th month and holiday allowance are paid with your monthly salary
27 vacation days for a 5-day working week and one Diversity Day
A modern pension administered by BeFrank
Plenty of training and learning opportunities
NS Business Card 2nd class, which gives you unlimited travel, also privately. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometers travelled
Allowances for setting up your home office and for internet use


Who you are

You find it important to bring well-designed applications to production with low maintenance. Furthermore, you enjoy sharing your knowledge with others. You like to take the time to take your colleagues along in your steps and explain things to them. Your open attitude and strong communication skills help enormously with this. Good command of the Dutch language is preferred and you currently reside in the Netherlands. Furthermore, you have:


A bachelor's or master's degree in IT or a study with a strong IT component, with at least 3 years of work experience
Experience in the field of Software/DevOps engineering and developing ML applications
Working knowledge of the data science process, such as data collection, cleaning, model review, and model implementation
Experience in developing (Flask) APIs, Azure Function Apps and CI/CD
Experience with building applications in the Azure Cloud, Docker & Terraform


Who you will work with

You will be working in our Competence Center, where we work on applications for the business through projects. Your team includes data scientists and machine learning engineers. We also work with various end-to-end teams, all of which exchange specialist knowledge. In this way, we work very efficiently on scalable solutions. In this process, we learn a lot from each other. Our ambition is to become even better at AI.

Together we work on state-of-the-art solutions, in Python and in the (Azure) cloud. In your work, you experience a lot of freedom and responsibility. That ensures that you continue to grow. In the team we work hybrid, where we meet together at the office at least once a week.

Any questions?

If you have any questions about the job or recruitment process, you can reach out via email to Hilde Diemel, Talent Acquisition Specialist via hilde.diemel@nn-group.com.

We bieden je


NS Business card, ook privé te gebruiken
27 vakantiedagen en 1 Diversiteitsdag
13e maand en vakantiegeld
Hybride werken
Show more

Title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there! 👋

Are you an ambitious Lead Machine Learning engineer? Do you want to use your data science and engineering skills to help fast-growing tech scale-ups in ClimateTech, Mobility and Marketplaces by means of ML? Furthermore, are you ready for the adventure of expanding Enjins together with our ambitious team? Then keep reading!

About Us 🚀

At Enjins, we're committed to building AI solutions for meaningful change. We do this for customers in industries where a positive change can be made: Climate tech, Mobility and Marketplaces. Our portfolio includes partnerships with renowned names like Crisp, Groendus, SnappCar, Tier Mobility, Independer, PlanBlue (check our cases page for examples of our work).

With our headquarters in the Netherlands (Utrecht) and a second hub in Berlin we have shown impressive growth year-over-year, a proven proposition that fits current market needs, and a strong branding that resembles quality, innovation, and pragmatism. In 2024, we'll continue to invest in expanding our sales team within the Utrecht Hub to further grow our reach in the Dutch scale-up ecosystem. As the AI industry is booming, we have ambitious goals for the coming years ahead. From this hub, our ML engineers develop innovative AI solutions in collaboration with various scale-up customers.

At Enjins, our success hinges upon the quality of our team and the breadth of their ideas. We believe that truly remarkable insights and innovative solutions for our customers emerge from the rich interplay of diverse cultures, knowledge, and experiences among our workforces.

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

As a Lead Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing Machine Learning team. In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast and we'll support your growth ambitions as much as possible. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!

Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to;]


You will lead the ML Engineering team together with the other Lead ML Engineers
You work in small teams on ML projects and take responsibility for maximum impact at our customers. You're customer-facing and manage a growing set of accounts
You apply your machine learning, engineering and business knowledge and guide others to learn more. You are not afraid of new (technological) challenges. After all, our world is changing continuously!
You are ready for more responsibility to carry our company forward! We will involve you in the important business decisions (team, customers, innovation) and give you more responsibilities along the way



Within 1 month you'll:


Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCP
Start your first customer project!



Within 3 months you'll:


Develop and implement robust ML applications for your client, working on building new solutions and ironing out any old integration problems. This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skills
Lead the ML team to new heights and bring your experience to solve any development issues
Had multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skills



Within 6 months you'll:


You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work best
Have hired additional ML Engineers to join your growing Enjins' ML team
Have helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantly



Requirements

Minimum Qualifications:🚶‍♀️


You have a relevant background with respect to Machine Learning Engineering and a minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience.
You have experience in coaching and managing project delivery, teams and accounts.
You are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum results
You have experience with cloud infrastructure and data engineering
You have experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOps



Preferred Qualifications: 🏃‍♀️


You have experience with machine learning and know how to create ML models and bring them to production
You consider yourself ambitious, responsible, pragmatic
You are fluent in English and are eligible to work in the Netherlands



Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
A dedicated and personal training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from our C-Level
Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities
Receive an Apple MacBook Pro for work
Enjoy 28 vacation days (based on full-time employment), comprising 20 statutory vacation days and an additional 8 days provided by the employer. You have the flexibility to utilise 3 national holidays (Easter Monday, Whit Monday, & Ascension Day) among the 8 days provided



Have we spiked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:

  • Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
  • Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
  • A dedicated and personal training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from our C-Level
  • Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes

Title: Data Scientist Forecaster, Eindhoven
Description:
Jij bent een echte data wizard met een passie voor forecasting! In onze snel groeiende organisatie help jij door middel van slimme voorspelalgoritmes ons energieverbruik en opwek te voorspellen. Jij bent onderzoekend ingesteld, maar kan details van hoofdzaak onderscheiden. Elke week bespreken we de forecasting resultaten en proberen we onze algoritmes samen met jou te verbeteren.




Wie zijn wij?




Hezelaer Energy is een vooruitstrevend energiebedrijf dat een leidende rol speelt in de energietransitie. Naast onze activiteit als innovatief energieleverancier, werken we aan het verslimmen van energiesystemen. Dat doen we door het integreren, automatiseren en optimaliseren van diverse energie assets, waaronder batterijen, zonnepanelen, windmolens en oplaadpunten voor elektrische voertuigen. We maximaliseren bovendien de waarde van de energieportfolio’s van onze klanten door zelfstandig handelstransacties uit te voeren. Zo dragen we bij aan een kostenefficiënt, energiezuinig en duurzaam energiesysteem.




Onze gezonde groeiambitie hebben we de afgelopen jaren waargemaakt dankzij voortdurende innovatie en actieve aanpassing aan de veranderende markt. Met een snel groeiend en enthousiast team bouwen we samen aan het energiebedrijf van de toekomst.


Taken



Je ontwikkelt mee aan het voorspelalgoritme voor ons e-programma.


Je schrijft in nauwe samenwerking met het team robuuste code om ervoor te zorgen dat het algoritme altijd blijft werk, ongeacht de omstandigheden.


Wekelijks zitten we samen om nieuwe verbetermogelijkheden te onderzoeken en toe te passen.


Jij hebt directe impact op de bedrijfsresultaten van Hezelaer.



Vereisten



Afgeronde technische WO opleiding zoals Econometrie, (Technische) Wiskunde of Natuurkunde.


Ervaring met time series forecasting.


Ervaring met programmeertalen zoals SQL, R en/of Python.


Werkervaring in de energiemarkt is een plus.


Bekend met GIT is een plus



Benefits



Samen kijken we welk groeipad bij je past en je krijgt volop kansen om te groeien en ontwikkelen. We bieden begeleiding op maat!


Naast een marktconform salaris, reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling is er een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling


Een creatieve, dynamische en informele bedrijfscultuur


Standplaats is ons nieuwe kantoor op Strijp-T in Eindhoven





Nieuwsgierig? We leren je graag kennen!

Show more
HTML:
Jij bent een echte data wizard met een passie voor forecasting! In onze snel groeiende organisatie help jij door middel van slimme voorspelalgoritmes ons energieverbruik en opwek te voorspellen. Jij bent onderzoekend ingesteld, maar kan details van hoofdzaak onderscheiden. Elke week bespreken we de forecasting resultaten en proberen we onze algoritmes samen met jou te verbeteren.


Wie zijn wij?


Hezelaer Energy is een vooruitstrevend energiebedrijf dat een leidende rol speelt in de energietransitie. Naast onze activiteit als innovatief energieleverancier, werken we aan het verslimmen van energiesystemen. Dat doen we door het integreren, automatiseren en optimaliseren van diverse energie assets, waaronder batterijen, zonnepanelen, windmolens en oplaadpunten voor elektrische voertuigen. We maximaliseren bovendien de waarde van de energieportfolio’s van onze klanten door zelfstandig handelstransacties uit te voeren. Zo dragen we bij aan een kostenefficiënt, energiezuinig en duurzaam energiesysteem.


Onze gezonde groeiambitie hebben we de afgelopen jaren waargemaakt dankzij voortdurende innovatie en actieve aanpassing aan de veranderende markt. Met een snel groeiend en enthousiast team bouwen we samen aan het energiebedrijf van de toekomst.


Taken

  • Je ontwikkelt mee aan het voorspelalgoritme voor ons e-programma.

  • Je schrijft in nauwe samenwerking met het team robuuste code om ervoor te zorgen dat het algoritme altijd blijft werk, ongeacht de omstandigheden.

  • Wekelijks zitten we samen om nieuwe verbetermogelijkheden te onderzoeken en toe te passen.

  • Jij hebt directe impact op de bedrijfsresultaten van Hezelaer.


Vereisten

  • Afgeronde technische WO opleiding zoals Econometrie, (Technische) Wiskunde of Natuurkunde.

  • Ervaring met time series forecasting.

  • Ervaring met programmeertalen zoals SQL, R en/of Python.

  • Werkervaring in de energiemarkt is een plus.

  • Bekend met GIT is een plus


Benefits

  • Samen kijken we welk groeipad bij je past en je krijgt volop kansen om te groeien en ontwikkelen. We bieden begeleiding op maat!

  • Naast een marktconform salaris, reiskostenvergoeding en pensioenregeling is er een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling

  • Een creatieve, dynamische en informele bedrijfscultuur

  • Standplaats is ons nieuwe kantoor op Strijp-T in Eindhoven


Nieuwsgierig? We leren je graag kennen!

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Roles and Responsibilities:

Research, develop, and implement state-of-the-art techniques to implement Large Language Models (LLM) and Generative AI on datacenter silicon compute solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and execute projects that leverage LLMs for various applications, such as text generation, summarization, translation, and more.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and generative models, and apply this knowledge to our compute solutions roadmap.
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior team members, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning.

Minimum Qualifications:

Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
Proven expertise in working with Large Language Models, particularly GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) variants.
Strong understanding of generative models, deep learning, and natural language processing techniques.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Demonstrated ability to drive projects from ideation to implementation, producing tangible outcomes.
Experience with deploying AI models into production environments is desirable.

Show more

  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and generative models, and apply this knowledge to our compute solutions roadmap.

  • Proven expertise in working with Large Language Models, particularly GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) variants.
  • Strong understanding of generative models, deep learning, and natural language processing techniques.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Demonstrated ability to drive projects from ideation to implementation, producing tangible outcomes.
  • Experience with deploying AI models into production environments is desirable.

Title: Data Scientist for SEO
Description:
Data Scientist –

Can you turn messy SEO data into clear, actionable growth wins?

We’re looking for a Data Scientist who can take large, unstructured SEO datasets and extract insights that drive rankings, traffic, and revenue. You’ll work closely with our SEO strategists to identify opportunities, test hypotheses, and measure what actually moves the needle.

We're a strategy-first digital agency trusted by private equity firms and 8-figure ecom brands. We hire smart, self-managing people who want freedom, not babysitting. You’ll own your outcomes, go deep into data, and help shape SEO strategy at a high level.

Compensation & Next Steps


(contract, based on experience)
Part-time trial period (paid), then full-time contract
Fully remote, async team—work from anywhere


The Role

What You’ll Own


Building data models that forecast SEO impact and ROI
Automating the analysis of rankings, traffic, and content performance
Identifying patterns across SERP behavior, competitors, and user intent
Creating dashboards that guide strategic SEO decisions
Running statistical tests to validate SEO experiments


Ideal Profile

Who You Are


2+ years working with SEO or digital marketing datasets
Advanced skills in Python, SQL, and data visualization (Looker, Power BI, or similar)
Experience with web scraping, APIs (Google Search Console, GA4), and NLP
Comfortable presenting technical findings to non-technical stakeholders
Bonus: Familiarity with content clustering, internal linking, and topical authority


What's on Offer?


Work alongside & learn from best in class talent
Excellent career development opportunities
Attractive salary & benefits
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Coders Connect is partnering with a cutting-edge start-up that is revolutionizing how businesses leverage data for decision-making. The company focuses on building advanced forecasting solutions that help drive sustainability efforts and optimize resource use. They're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team and be part of creating their first commercial MVP.




What you'll do:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing data-driven insights and helping shape the company's long-term success. Your responsibilities will include:

Building the First Product: Collaborate in a cross-functional team to design, optimize, and deploy both the forecasting algorithms and data visuals that will power the company's first MVP.
Designing a Future-Proof Infrastructure: Implement explainable ML and AI solutions, develop systems for monitoring model and data drift, and create processes that will allow the rapid production of new models.
Ensuring Platform Performance: Develop product analytics to monitor performance and inform product development decisions.
Staying Ahead with Technology: Keep up with the latest industry trends to ensure the use of cutting-edge technology that maximizes business impact.




Requirements:

Strong Forecasting Background: Extensive experience in building and deploying forecasting models, with hands-on knowledge of various tools and techniques.
Advanced ML Skills: Proficient in deploying machine learning pipelines and creating explainable AI solutions, while staying in tune with business needs.
Data Visualization Expertise: Skilled at translating complex datasets and time series into easy-to-understand insights.
Team-Oriented with a Product Focus: A clear communicator and collaborative team player with a product-led approach to engineering.
Start-up Experience: A background in early-stage environments, demonstrating adaptability and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced setting.
Relocation Flexibility: Must be an EU citizen and available to relocate to the Netherlands.




Preferred Tech Stack:

You will have input on shaping the company’s tech stack. Some preferred tools and technologies include:




Languages: Python for ML, R for data analysis
ML Libraries: scikit-learn, Prophet, TensorFlow, Keras
Data Processing/Storage: SQL, Spark
Cloud Platform: Azure
Version Control: Git




Benefits:

An initial one-year contract with the possibility of extension, based on the success of the collaboration.
A flexible hybrid work environment that promotes work-life balance.
Continuous learning opportunities and room for career growth within a fast-evolving company.
The chance to work with an international team of talented professionals across tech and product.
A meaningful opportunity to contribute to sustainability efforts and make a real-world impact.




Kindly note that VISA Sponsorship is not available for this position.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Ben je gepassioneerd over data modelling en wil je een blijvende impact maken? Streef je ernaar om praktijkervaring op te doen als data scientist in verschillende sectoren? Zoek je een dynamische omgeving waar je je carrière kunt starten met uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden, waaronder on-the-job coaching en een divers trainingscurriculum? Solliciteer dan voor de functie van Junior Data Scientist bij IG&H!

Als Data Scientist bij IG&H ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vertalen van complexe data naar bruikbare inzichten voor onze klanten. Je begint met het grondig begrijpen van hun specifieke uitdagingen en werkt samen met je team om de meeste waarde te creëren. Je past geavanceerde datamodelleringstechnieken toe, van dataverwerking tot machine learning en grote taalmodellen. Je zorgt ervoor dat de resultaten helder en overtuigend gepresenteerd worden, zodat ze een echte impact hebben. Wij geloven dat succes ontstaat wanneer analytische expertise wordt gecombineerd met strategisch inzicht en de focus op de klantbehoefte.

Wij Zoeken Iemand Die


In staat is om complexe datasets om te zetten in waardevolle inzichten en oplossingen voor onze klanten.
Diepgaande klantbehoeften analyseert en deze vertaalt naar concrete data-oplossingen.
Ervaring heeft met het toepassen van geavanceerde technieken zoals machine learning en grote taalmodellen.
Vaardig is in het communiceren van data-analyse en resultaten op een manier die een blijvende impact creëert.
Strategisch en analytisch denken combineert om waardevolle en relevante resultaten te leveren voor klanten.


Bij IG&H werk je in de sectoren retail, financiële diensten en gezondheidszorg, wat je de mogelijkheid geeft om te werken aan een breed scala aan uitdagende projecten. Je krijgt de kans om samen te werken met verschillende consultants binnen en buiten het Data & AI-team, wat je helpt om je vaardigheden te verbreden en je ambities te ontdekken.

Over Het Data & AI Team

"Werken voor het Data & AI Team bij IG&H Consulting is ongelooflijk divers en tegelijkertijd leuk. Het is een geweldige plek geweest om mijn technische knowhow, managementadviesvaardigheden en commerciële effectiviteit te ontwikkelen. Het team is jong en ambitieus, met een sterke wens om complexe puzzels op te lossen, zich persoonlijk en professioneel te ontwikkelen en leuke activiteiten samen te doen. Al met al is IG&H al meer dan 6 jaar een geweldige plek om te werken!" Lars van Kempen – Senior Manager Data & AI

Job requirements

Vereisten


Master diploma in Econometrie, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence of een vergelijkbaar vakgebied
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels, vanwege klantbehoeften
Werkervaring door stages en/of werkstudentschap
Analytische, inventieve en praktische skills
Vaardigheden in Python en/of R


Wat Wij Jou Bieden


Werken bij een Great Place To Work met een prettige sfeer, enthousiaste collega's die je ondersteunen en veel leuke activiteiten
Continue ontwikkeling via de IG&H Academy en actieve coaching on the job
Meteen een vast (onbepaald) contract
Uitstekend salaris en arbeidsvoorwaarden
Bedrijfsauto / goede mobiliteitsregeling
25 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om er tot 5 extra op te nemen
Bonussysteem
Mogelijkheid om na 3 jaar dienstverband een sabbatical te nemen
IG&H faciliteert een Healthy Human-programma, waarbij je begeleiding krijgt bij alle aanpassingen in het leven, zoals het krijgen van een kind of het zorgen voor een ziek familielid
Mogelijkheid om parttime te werken (32 uur), minimaal 4 dagen per week
Geweldige kans om een actieve bijdrage te leveren aan de verdere groei van de organisatie
En meer, waar we graag verder op ingaan


Waarom IG&H?

IG&H helpt toonaangevende bedrijven in Gezondheid, Retail en Financiën te transformeren door samen te werken met top technologiepartners. We bieden waardevol advies, design en digitale platforms, met als resultaat de succesvolle afstemming van mensen, bedrijfsvoering en technologie. Onze cultuur is uniek: met meer dan 350 getalenteerde collega's creëren we een omgeving waar verandering en uitdaging omarmd worden. We bieden een zorgzame werkomgeving met continue leermogelijkheden via de IG&H Academy en persoonlijke begeleiding door een mentor, zodat je jezelf kunt ontwikkelen en de grenzen kunt verleggen voor zowel jezelf als onze klanten.

Wat betekent dat voor jou?

Aan de ene kant, als deze vacature bij je past, dan is dit een Great Place To Work, met super tevreden medewerkers en klanten (NPS > 60). Bovendien behalen we dubbele groeicijfers en hebben we onze blik stevig gericht op verdere internationale uitbreiding. We staan nog maar aan het begin van dit spannende avontuur. Waarom zou je er geen deel van uitmaken?

Je kunt direct solliciteren via de sollicitatieknop. Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Seline de Keijzer via recruitment@igh.com. Hopelijk ontmoeten we je snel!

We willen dat onze medewerkers de diversiteit van de samenleving weerspiegelen. We werken samen met een opmerkelijke mix van talenten, persoonlijkheden en culturen. IG&H is trots een werkgever te zijn die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in overweging genomen voor een baan, ongeacht nationaliteit, ras, religie, geslacht, genderidentiteit of -expressie, seksuele geaardheid, genetica, handicap of leeftijd. We geven om individualiteit, maar het belangrijkst is dat we trots delen op onze collectieve prestaties en een Great Place to Work.

Ben je een vertegenwoordiger van een wervings- of uitzendbureau? We waarderen je interesse, maar vragen vriendelijk om ons niet te benaderen over deze vacature. We werken indien nodig met preferred suppliers.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Up to 70k annually




Are you looking to join a company where you can apply advanced data science in a focused, intellectually curious environment?




The Company

This is a globally active organization working at the forefront of leadership development, organizational advisory, and strategic talent solutions. Our multidisciplinary team brings together experts in psychology, business strategy, analytics, and technology to unlock the potential of leaders and organizations around the world. We value deep thinking, purposeful innovation, and meaningful outcomes over public recognition.




The role

As a Data Scientist you’ll work at the intersection of machine learning, organizational psychology, and leadership science. You´ll collaborate closely to develop impactful solutions leveraging AI, NLP, and predictive analytics. Your work will inform executive decisions, shape leadership strategies, and support complex organizational transformations.




Identify high-impact opportunities for ML/AI across internal tools and client-facing products
Design, test, and deploy advanced models (especially NLP and AI-based) to address nuanced leadership and organizational challenges
Collaborate cross-functionally to embed data-driven insights into products and services
Contribute thought leadership and subject-matter expertise across data science, leadership strategy, and analytics innovation
Stay current with advances in ML, AI, and behavioral science to guide best practices
Bring an entrepreneurial mind set to the table and define new AI opportunities within the business.




Skills and Experience

Strong track record in machine learning, NLP, and AI application—Bayesian modeling is a plus
Proficient in Python (preferred), R, or similar languages and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills; meticulous attention to detail
Experience or interest in leadership science, organizational psychology, or social science research
Able to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and empathy




Think this could be the right fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now via the button on this page.

Show more

Think this could be the right fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now via the button on this page.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the Company:

I am currently looking for a Freelance Data Scientist to support the expansion of a growing Data Science team within a leading organisation.




About the Role:

In this role, you will be instrumental in building scalable, high-quality AI solutions, partnering closely with stakeholders to deliver innovative generative AI and machine learning products.




Responsibilities:

Design, build, test, and deploy scalable machine learning and generative AI solutions, including LLM-powered applications.
Develop and maintain APIs for processing and categorising data across various formats, including audio and video.
Monitor, maintain, and optimise performance for deployed models such as chatbots, predictive systems, and customer care solutions.
Collaborate with internal customers and technical teams to gather requirements and translate them into practical solutions.
Contribute to the automation of development and deployment through CI/CD pipelines.
Ensure documentation is thorough, supporting reproducibility, maintainability, and compliance.
Troubleshoot production issues and provide ongoing support as needed.




Qualifications:

3–5+ years of hands-on experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or related disciplines.




Required Skills:

Strong proficiency with Python, Git, and Azure data stack.
Solid knowledge of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and Generative AI (experience with OpenAI or similar platforms highly desirable).
Practical experience with MLOps for deployment, monitoring, and model optimisation.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate across technical and non-technical teams.




Preferred Skills:

If this sounds of interest, please send your updated CV to zacharyt@montash.nl and we can set up a time to discuss it further.

Title: data scientist
Description:
De Afdeling Business Intelligence en Kwaliteit (BI&K) van de Eenheid Noord-Nederland heeft ruimte voor een gedreven data scientist. Bij de politie werk je aan vraagstukken waarbij data een belangrijke rol speelt. Kom jij met jouw talent en expertise het verschil maken?

Wat ga je doen?

Als data scientist houd je je bezig met onderzoek naar en de ontwikkeling en toepassing van data science-methoden zoals machine learning die bijdragen aan operationele vraagstukken binnen de politieorganisatie. Je werkt aan uiteenlopende projecten, zoals exploratieve data-analyses of het ontwikkelen en evalueren van modellen voor het classificeren van informatie in brondata. Je draagt bij aan maatschappelijk relevante ontwikkelingen en de beweging van datagedreven werken binnen de politie. Je maakt deel uit van een nationaal samenwerkingsverband waarin verschillende Business Intelligence en Kwaliteit (BI&K)-expertisegebieden actief zijn. In samenwerking met specialisten uit deze expertisegebieden werk je aan oplossingen voor vraagstukken uit de politiepraktijk en draag je bij aan de implementatie en het beheer daarvan. Je werkt op een landelijk data- en analytics-platform waar brondata geïntegreerd beschikbaar is voor dataexploratie en de ontwikkeling en exploitatie van modellen.

Waar ga je werken?

Je komt te werken bij het Team Business Intelligence. Dit team houdt zich bezig met de ontwikkeling van oplossingen om onze collega’s en verschillende ketenpartners van de juiste informatie te voorzien. Het team ontwikkelt en beheert standaardproducten en analyseoplossingen en draagt actief bij aan landelijke ontwikkelingen binnen het intelligencedomein en daarbuiten zoals thematisch en datagedreven werken. Samen met jouw collega’s denk je buiten de bestaande kaders om te komen tot realistische en passende oplossingen. Hoewel de standplaats Groningen is, verricht het team werkzaamheden door het hele land. Het kan voorkomen dat je voor het werk moet reizen en eventueel voor langere periode op een andere locatie werkzaamheden verricht.

Wie ben jij?

Je bent gespecialiseerd in het werken met en analyseren van data. Je hebt kennis van en ervaring in het toepassen van data science- en machine learning-oplossingen. Daarnaast kun je data engineering werkzaamheden oppakken die relevant zijn voor jouw data science oplossingen. Naast inhoudelijke ervaring ben je promotor van data gedreven werken op basis van je kennis, ervaring en overtuigingskracht. Je hebt een open en constructieve houding gericht op het verbinden van het datadomein met het werk dat door de collega’s in intelligence, opsporing en handhaving wordt uitgevoerd. Je onderscheidt gemakkelijk hoofd- en bijzaken en brengt informatie uit diverse bronnen met elkaar in verband. Je kunt analyses omzetten in concrete oplossingen en feiten kun je helder en gestructureerd vastleggen en presenteren. Je signaleert kansen en bent alert op trends, ontwikkelingen en jurisprudentie en hebt oog voor ethische en maatschappelijke aspecten die je werk raken. Je kunt zelfstandig werken waarbij je proactief op zoek gaat naar nieuwe mogelijkheden en kansen.

Verder heb je


hbo (bachelor) werk- en denkniveau*;
een politie- of PSI-diploma;
aantoonbare ervaring in de ontwikkeling en evaluatie van modellen;
aantoonbare werkervaring in het implementeren en beheren van modellen ten behoeve van productieprocessen;
werkervaring met onderstaande onderwerpen
gedistribueerde zoek -en analyse omgevingen (Elasticsearch);
querytalen (GraphQL, SQL, Cypher);
graph databases (Neo4J);
programmeren (Python);
statistische analyse / machine learning / deep learning / NLP libraries;
CI/CD en CI/CD-tools;
container gebaseerde applicaties (Kubernetes).
Wat wij bieden

De standplaats is Groningen. Er is ruimte voor 1 fte. Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur per week.

Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst. We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een aanstelling in tijdelijke dienst voor een proeftijd van een jaar. Bij voldoende functioneren wordt de aanstelling na een jaar omgezet in een vaste aanstelling.

We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een aantrekkelijk pakket arbeidsvoorwaarden. Denk hierbij aan


een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 4.293,- en maximaal € 6.299,- (schaal 11 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek;
een Individueel Keuzebudget (IKB) dat uit twee delen bestaat
Een bruto deel van 17,86% van je salaris. Met dit budget kun je een deel van je arbeidsvoorwaarden zelf samenstellen. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het uitbetalen van je budget, het kopen van vakantie-uren of ontwikkelactiviteiten zoals een opleiding.
Een netto deel van € 377,- per jaar. Dit budget kun je bijvoorbeeld gebruiken voor duurzaamheidsdoelen, vakbondscontributie en voor vitaliteit.
goede pensioenregeling en betaald ouderschapsverlof ( meer info over verlof, regelingen en mogelijkheden ).

De formele functie binnen het functiegebouw van de politie is operationeel specialist C .

Interesse

Bel of mail met Wouter van der Heijen, operationeel specialist D BI&K (06 – 18 14 48 72, wouter.van.der.heijden@politie.nl ) als je meer informatie over de functie wilt hebben.

Voor vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure bel of mail je met Olga van Sonsbeek, recruiter (06 - 18 62 97 15, olga.bussink@politie.nl )

Solliciteer uiterlijk 20 mei 2025 via de sollicitatiebutton.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Wat verder belangrijk is


Een betrouwbaarheids- en omgevingsonderzoek maken deel uit van de selectieprocedure.
Je hebt de Nederlandse nationaliteit (dit mag ook je tweede nationaliteit zijn).
Goed politiewerk heeft verschillende inzichten nodig. Met welke unieke blik kom jij ons versterken?
Je hebt een diploma op hbo-niveau (bachelor) of je bent daaraan gelijkgesteld via EVC. Of je hebt minimaal twee jaar aantoonbare ervaring op het gevraagde werk- en denkniveau. Dit moet je aantonen met je cv, aangevuld met een officiële functiebeschrijving, vacaturetekst of ander document waarin het gevraagde werk- en denkniveau duidelijk staat vermeld. Let wel voor aanstelling op de functie is ook een politie- of PSI-diploma vereist.

Title: AI/ML specialist Edge AI
Description:
AI/ML specialist Edge AI Eindhoven the Netherlands

Your Profile

• University degree: MSc, PhD or PDEng in a technical specialism, like Computer Science or equally relevant.

• 5+ years of experience in (software) engineering, with significant exposure/involvement with Machine Learning / AI required

• Affinity and experience with embedded processors, software and NN accelerators required.

• Broad experience with embedded software architectures, build systems, version control systems required.

• Broad experience with Operating systems GNU/Linux, embedded systems, development boards, and processors, and SW competencies as listed below required.

• Excellent communication skills in English (verbal /written) required. Experience in working in/with multi-site and multi-cultural projects/teams preferred.

• An (active) Github account (pref).




Your Competencies

• To give you a feeling for the types of competences, some examples are:

• Flexibility in working with AI frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch), preferably via Python and C++ interfaces required.

• Understanding of AI toolchains, deployment, portability and inference engines (CUDA, TensorRT, TFLite, ONNX, etc.) preferred.

• Familiarity with setting up and maintaining related development environments (docker, TensorBoard, performance profiling, ClearML, etc.) required.

• Knowledge of build systems (YOCTO, OpenEmbedded, etc.) beneficial, working with cross-compilation toolchains for ARM preferred.

• Solid programming experience of C, C++, Python and Bash programming languages on Linux systems required.

• Experience with on-device learning and federated learning appreciated.

• Familiarity with future technologies for extreme efficiency such as in-memory, analog, and neuromorphic computing beneficial.

• Experience with Edge AI.




Department

We drive innovation on system level for the Automotive, Consumer / Internet of Things, Industrial and Medical/Health businesses in applications like highly automated and safe driving , radar systems, electrification, mobile robotics, industry 4.0, and personal health. We foresee that artificial intelligence through embedded neural networks will often provide a significant part of the ‘smartness’ in the products for these markets.

We innovate by combining technologies, IPs and products from different entities of our client and by participating in collaboration projects with customers, universities and research institutes. Together with the other departments, we anticipate future technology trends and gather innovative system and application insights for the roadmaps by developing innovative system prototypes, often in co-operation with external partners and customers. Where possible, we support new business development / new markets across departments, leveraging the companies technologies and competences. We also created and maintain a lab which showcases all the latest inventions to visitors of our headquarters.

The work is performed in a team of AI-experts, embedded in our clients world-wide AI-activities. The team’s current scope in research and advanced development is to research and evaluate methods for efficient machine learning (ML) inference while fully exploiting the HW/SW characteristics of all of our clients AI platforms, targeting multi-objective optimization. We support the departments with deep know-how to embed these ML-methodologies in the clients HW/SW AI products. We stay on top of and utilize today’s state of the art developments in the academic and open source communities, and participate there-in through partnerships, PhD- and master-student programs, publications etc. We seek to expand the team with ambitious embedded AI architects/engineers.

Our responsibilities are in the areas described below; where the exact responsibility of the candidate is determined taking his capabilities in mind:

• Automatic joint design and optimization for neural networks through Scalable and Collaborative Neural Architecture Search

• Innovating Transformer models, architectures and training methodologies to deployment on the Edge

• Domain generalization over sensors, configurations and datasets

• The methods are applied to vision, radar, audio and other time-series-data for above-mentioned industries

• Integration of the investigated methods and neural networks in larger applications, open source frameworks and compelling demonstrators

• Executing the above in co-operative and EU-supported projects with external partners (universities, companies), and in our clients long term innovation program (“research”)

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working
Be part of a fast-growing company that helps businesses leverage data analytics for better decision-making.
Collaborate with a highly skilled, dynamic, and supportive team.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning in analytics and consulting.
Competitive salary and benefits package, including training, mentorship, and travel opportunities.



What you will do


Conduct analyses using advanced analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations and interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Looker.
Solve complex problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and create actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitate workshops and training sessions for clients and team members.
Manage stakeholders and communicate effectively with executives.
Coach and mentor junior team members, fostering their growth and development.



What you’ll bring


3+ years of professional work experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses, and derive recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills in data analysis, machine learning, and programming. Proficiency in Python, SQL, R, and cloud computing platforms.
Experience with Python data tools (e.g., Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Ability to communicate complex statistical and analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent command of the English language.
Experience in consulting is a plus.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
✔ Are you a skilled machine learning engineer with a strong background in algorithm development and implementation?

✔ Are you looking for a role that combines hands-on technical work with consulting?

✔ Do you get satisfaction from seeing your models and algorithms being used in real-world applications?

✔ Do you enjoy being part of a team of experts who are passionate about machine learning and AI?




Then Xomnia is the place for you!

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Xomnia, your work for our clients will range from building data pipelines to data exploration and modeling, to productionizing your models and deploying them in a cloud environment. For instance, our team has developed scalable deployment pipelines using MLOps best-practices for a large insurance company in the Netherlands, enabling business teams to swiftly productionize a machine learning model for a new department.

Additionally, we have undertaken diverse projects, such as optimizing the electricity grid for the future, ensured you have stable internet connection at home and collaborated with LUMC on cancer research.

Together with the team, you will implement and adapt best-practises for modeling, programming and engineering using the latest MLOps principles, which includes automation, CI/CD and orchestration. These principles apply to the whole chain of the machine learning lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and monitoring. We value knowledge sharing and staying ahead of the curve in our constantly evolving field, with opportunities to explore and work with emerging technologies such as Generative AI. We are looking for a team player who is dedicated to keep learning, and enjoys sharing knowledge with others.




Please note that for this position, we are looking for candidates that have the legal right to work in the Netherlands as we do not offer visa sponsorship.




What you will be working on

Collaborating with a cross-functional team at our client to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learning
Designing and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniques
Developing and maintaining machine learning pipelines, including feature preparation, model training, model deployment and model serving using MLOps principles.
Analyzing and interpreting results to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement
Staying up-to-date with the latest machine learning techniques and technologies and apply them to business problems as appropriate
Following and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CD




What you will need

A minimum of 3 years experience in a position such as a machine learning engineer, data scientist or data engineer, building scalable solutions to bring models to production
A degree in computer science, data science, artificial intelligence or similar
Enthusiasm for MLOps and GenAI
Experience in data wrangling and building data pipelines
Advanced knowledge of statistics and mathematics
Experience with building batch and streaming ETL pipelines
Excellent Software Engineering skills in Python
Experience with containerisation (Docker), CI / CD and testing
Experience in working with at least one cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Keen on sharing knowledge and being eager to keep developing yourself
Affinity for consulting and a drive to help clients
Proficiency is English is mandatory and Dutch highly preferred.




What we offer

Competitive salary
Flexible work arrangements
Office in the heart of Amsterdam
two annual bonuses
€5000 development budget
Xomnia trips 🚀
25 vacation days
Cool merchandise 💙
Intern trainings & events
Pension scheme
Phone allowance
Full compensation of travel costs
Free and healthy lunch at the office




About Us

We are Xomnia, the AI consulting company. We’re curious problem solvers who believe data will change the way we live, work and communicate. Being at the forefront of this revolutionary change in a sustainable, positive way is what drives us.

We solve challenging data science and engineering projects, from start to finish. From developing an application for real-time fraud detection on Google Cloud Platform, to setting up a customized recommender engine in an existing Microsoft Azure environment - we develop and deploy tailor-made data science solutions.

Xomnia started in 2013 in one room in the heart of Amsterdam. These days we take up nearly two houses. But more than just a workspace, we're a community that values authenticity. Here, everyone is encouraged to be themselves, to learn, and to have fun in the process.

Representing over 20 nationalities, our team values the unique cultural perspective that each individual brings to the table. Moreover, with the Dutch tech sector seeing a female representation around 11%, we are proud that over 30% of our workforce is female. Nevertheless, we recognize that there is more to be done, and we continue working to overcome barriers that still exist.




We encourage all candidates to apply, and we don’t discriminate based on race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or age. However, a reality that we face is that many of our clients prefer to communicate in Dutch, making Dutch proficiency essential for some roles. Additionally, while we wish that we could sponsor visas for everyone, there are instances when it is not feasible.

If you're experienced, passionate, and align with our values, we want to hear from you.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (Freelance)




1x a week on-site

12 Month Contract (Potential for extension)

Hourly Rate (Payroll Preferred, but can take on ZZP'ers)

Dutch Speaker




I am currently seeking a Freelance Machine Learning Engineer to join a growing Data Science team within a leading organisation. You will play a key role in building scalable, high-quality AI solutions, working closely with stakeholders to deliver innovative generative AI and machine learning products.




Roles and Responsibilities:




Design, build, test, and deploy scalable machine learning and generative AI solutions, including LLM-powered tools.
Develop and maintain APIs for processing and categorising data, including audio/video interactions.
Monitor and optimise performance of deployed models, including chatbots, prediction systems, and customer care solutions.
Collaborate directly with (internal) customers and technical teams to understand requirements and translate them into actionable solutions.
Contribute to automation and CI/CD pipelines to streamline delivery.
Document processes, ensuring solutions are reproducible, maintainable, and compliant.
Troubleshoot issues in production and provide ongoing support.




Requirements:




3–5+ years of experience in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python, Git, and modern machine learning frameworks.
Strong understanding of LLMs, NLP, and Generative AI (experience with OpenAI or similar is highly desirable).
Experience in MLOps practices for model deployment, monitoring, and performance tuning.
Strong communication skills, able to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.




If this would be of interest, please get in touch with shaip@montash.nl with your updated CV and we can discuss this further.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there! 👋

Are you an ambitious Senior Machine Learning engineer? Do you want to use your data science and engineering skills to help fast-growing tech scale-ups in ClimateTech, Mobility and Marketplaces by means of ML? Furthermore, are you ready for the adventure of expanding Enjins together with our ambitious team? Then keep reading!

About Us 🚀

At Enjins, we're committed to building AI solutions for meaningful change. We do this for customers in industries where a positive change can be made: Climate tech, Mobility and Marketplaces. Our portfolio includes partnerships with renowned names like Crisp, Groendus, SnappCar, Tier Mobility, Independer, PlanBlue (check our cases page for examples of our work).

With our headquarters in the Netherlands (Utrecht) and a second hub in Berlin we have shown impressive growth year-over-year, a proven proposition that fits current market needs, and a strong branding that resembles quality, innovation, and pragmatism. In 2024, we'll continue to invest in expanding our sales team within the Utrecht Hub to further grow our reach in the Dutch scale-up ecosystem. As the AI industry is booming, we have ambitious goals for the coming years ahead. From this hub, our ML engineers develop innovative AI solutions in collaboration with various scale-up customers.

At Enjins, our success hinges upon the quality of our team and the breadth of their ideas. We believe that truly remarkable insights and innovative solutions for our customers emerge from the rich interplay of diverse cultures, knowledge, and experiences among our workforces.

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing Machine Learning team, comprising of 15 other equally amazing Machine Learning Engineers.

In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast and we'll support your growth ambitions as much as possible. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!

Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to;]


You become a full member of our fast-growing ML Engineering team
You'll work in small teams on ML projects for innovative Dutch & foreign clients in ClimateTech, Mobility and Marketplaces.
You'll develop and implement robust ML applications for these clients
You'll apply your data engineering, computer science and machine learning knowledge on projects and you work with the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow and Kafka
You'll translate the to business stakeholders and focus on the human aspects to increase the impact of our ML applications
You'll manage a growing set of projects
Together we will keep building our young company Enjins, in which you will play a more and more important role!


Within 1 month you'll:


Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCP
Start your first customer project!


Within 3 months you'll:


Develop and implement robust ML applications for your client, working on building new solutions and ironing out any old integration problems. This way laying the foundation of your ML engineering skills
Had multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skills


Within 6 months you'll:


You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work best
Have helped in the interview process for additional ML Engineers to join Enjins' growing team
Have helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantly



Requirements

Minimum Qualifications:🚶‍♀️


You have a relevant background with respect to Machine Learning Engineering and a minimum of 2 years of relevant working experience, in leading development projects and teams.
You are ambitious, pragmatic and proactive and you like to work in small teams for innovative clients
You are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum results
You know your way around Python, SQL and Git



Preferred Qualifications: 🏃‍♀️


You have experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP) and its data engineering components
You have experience with the world of containerization (Kubernetes & Docker), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOps
You have experience in technical consultancy settings
You are a passionate engineer who loves 1) to contribute to making a positive impact and 2) discovering new programming languages, frameworks or cloud services. After all, our world is changing continuously!
You are fluent in both Dutch and English and are eligible to work in the Netherlands



Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
A dedicated and personal training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level
Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities
Receive an Apple MacBook Pro for work
Enjoy 28 vacation days (based on full-time employment), comprising 20 statutory vacation days and an additional 8 days provided by the employer. You have the flexibility to utilise 3 national holidays (Easter Monday, Whit Monday, & Ascension Day) among the 8 days provided


Have we sparked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know. If you want to reach out to us before applying with any questions, drop us an email at work@enjins.com

  • You are fluent in both Dutch and English and are eligible to work in the Netherlands


Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:

  • Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
  • Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and global environment
  • A dedicated and personal training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching from Leads and our C-Level
  • Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
  • Work from our office centrally located in Utrecht along the picturesque Oudegracht. Our office is not yet fully accessible to individuals with physical disabilities
