Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Frostbite is EA’s proprietary game engine that comes equipped with tons of tools and technologies designed to build incredible games. Our in-house engine offers the unique ability to adapt to each game while working hand-in-hand to prioritize what to build. Our goal is to empower creators all over the world to bring their best ideas to life by creating an engine that amplifies innovation across every discipline. Learn More: ea.com/frostbite

At Frostbite, we believe that data drives quality, accountability, and innovation in game engine development. We are growing our Frostbite Analytics team in service of this mission, and we want you to join us!

As a Data Scientist on the Frostbite Analytics team, you will report to the Senior Analytics Manager and work side-by-side with the Continuous Development team. Your projects will focus on enhancing developer workflows, increasing build farm efficiency, and improving automated failure triage, allowing engineers to work faster and with greater confidence in their code submissions.

We offer a hybrid working model with three days per week in office.

Responsibilities


Design, implement, and maintain data-driven solutions to improve build-farm operations, CI/CD workflows, and automated test failure analysis.
Analyze telemetry, test results, and other data to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and optimization opportunities.
Integrate actionable analytics into developer tools through dashboards, REST APIs, and automated processes.
Work with data engineers to improve data processing and storage for efficiency, latency, and cost-effectiveness.
Communicate insights and recommendations to leadership and internal partners in business-friendly language


Requirements


2+ years of experience in data science or ML ops, or related analytics roles
Master's in Computer Science, Statistics, or equivalent experience in a related field


Technical Skills


Proficiency in SQL and Python (Scala, C++, or C# is a plus), with experience in real-time analytics and data transformation workflows.
Familiarity with a range of quantitative methods for detecting failures, predicting outcomes, and optimizing processes, such as anomaly/time-series analysis, classification models, and reinforcement learning.
Experience working with telemetry data in software development or similar context
Experience with version control systems like Perforce or Gitlab.
Experience with ML and analytics platforms such as Databricks or SageMaker for developing and deploying models at scale.
Knowledge of CI/CD systems, automated build environments, and developer-facing analytics tools is a plus.


Soft Skills


Curious and analytical: You uncover patterns in data, ask the right questions, and explore new methods to foster continuous improvements that connect to the bigger picture.
Collaborative: You proactively seek out feedback and diverse perspectives, ensuring solutions are well-designed, scalable, and sustainable. You actively listen, adapt, and refine your approach for long-term impact.
Impact-focused: You prioritize high-value solutions that lead to measurable improvements, balancing technical rigor with real-world constraints to enhance efficiency and automation.


About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
Description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.

Din kompetens & profil

Machine Learning Engineer

Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter



Data Engineer

Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.

Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:


Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.



Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.

Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.

Om Amendo Tech

Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.

Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!

Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.

Frågor och kontakt

Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.

We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is ideal for engineers with demonstrable skills in AI as well as for software engineers who have recently transitioned to AI and ML expertise, and offers an opportunity to develop your craft whilst working closely with clients on delivering AI solutions to real-world challenges.

Job Summary

We are seeking an AI Engineer with a strong intuition for AI and a genuine enthusiasm in building robust, scalable solutions to power innovative digital experiences. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with a deep enthusiasm for advancing AI capabilities.

What We Offer


A chance to work closely with global brands on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and truly push the boundaries of what's possible.
A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


As an AI Engineer at Umain, your role will involve:


Assisting our clients in clarifying their questions and determining if using AI is a suitable solution for them
You understand the limitations of a model and how to address them within the product’s UX
Implementing AI-as-a-Service (e.g., OpenAI, Claude LLMs) in projects; you assess when these services are a good option and understand any potential limitations
Being familiar with pre-trained models and available datasets and the ability to apply them if existing AI services fall short for the use case at hand
Validating, deploying, monitoring, and maintaining built models, ensuring they can be used at scale
Developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines and machine learning workflows, optimizing for performance and reliability
Working with diverse, cross-functional teams on projects that deliver groundbreaking AI solutions for global brands


It’s a plus (not a requirement) if you have additional experience in:


PyTorch, Tensorflow
Transfer learning, few-shot learning, PEFT and LoRa
Multi-modal transformer models, RLHF


Who You Are

We Value Candidates Who Demonstrate


Great delivery skills: Proven capability to deliver AI solutions
Strong AI intuition: A deep understanding of AI concepts
Curiosity: Enthusiasm for emerging technologies, creativity in problem-solving, and an eagerness to learn in a rapidly evolving AI landscape
You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


Why Umain?

Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.

Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.

Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.

Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.

Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?

If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.

Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.

We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.
Show more
HTML:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.

We're on the lookout for developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is ideal for engineers with demonstrable skills in AI as well as for software engineers who have recently transitioned to AI and ML expertise, and offers an opportunity to develop your craft whilst working closely with clients on delivering AI solutions to real-world challenges.

Job Summary

We are seeking an AI Engineer with a strong intuition for AI and a genuine enthusiasm in building robust, scalable solutions to power innovative digital experiences. The ideal candidate combines technical expertise with a deep enthusiasm for advancing AI capabilities.

What We Offer

  • A chance to work closely with global brands on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and truly push the boundaries of what's possible.
  • A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
  • A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
  • Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.

As an AI Engineer at Umain, your role will involve:

  • Assisting our clients in clarifying their questions and determining if using AI is a suitable solution for them
  • You understand the limitations of a model and how to address them within the product’s UX
  • Implementing AI-as-a-Service (e.g., OpenAI, Claude LLMs) in projects; you assess when these services are a good option and understand any potential limitations
  • Being familiar with pre-trained models and available datasets and the ability to apply them if existing AI services fall short for the use case at hand
  • Validating, deploying, monitoring, and maintaining built models, ensuring they can be used at scale
  • Developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines and machine learning workflows, optimizing for performance and reliability
  • Working with diverse, cross-functional teams on projects that deliver groundbreaking AI solutions for global brands

It’s a plus (not a requirement) if you have additional experience in:

  • PyTorch, Tensorflow
  • Transfer learning, few-shot learning, PEFT and LoRa
  • Multi-modal transformer models, RLHF

Who You Are

We Value Candidates Who Demonstrate

  • Great delivery skills: Proven capability to deliver AI solutions
  • Strong AI intuition: A deep understanding of AI concepts
  • Curiosity: Enthusiasm for emerging technologies, creativity in problem-solving, and an eagerness to learn in a rapidly evolving AI landscape
  • You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
  • You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
  • You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
  • You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.

Why Umain?

Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.

Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.

Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.

Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.

Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?

If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.

Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.

We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
B3 Link, som är en del av B3-koncernen, är bland annat unika genom vår expertis inom AI-tillämpningar och förmåga att leverera projekt till våra kunder. Vi kombinerar teknik och affärsbehov, och tar ansvar för hela projektcykeln – från business case till implementering av AI-lösningar.

Om rollen

Nu söker vi dig som har erfarenhet inom maskininlärning! Att vara anställd på B3 Link innebär att du hjälper våra kunder i deras utvecklingsprojekt och dagliga utmaningar. Vi ser gärna att du har vana att arbeta såväl självständigt som kundnära och är van vid ett agilt teambaserat arbetssätt.

Vi letar efter dig som har:


Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet inom maskininlärning eller liknande område
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller
Gedigen erfarenhet inom minst ett programmeringsspråk (te.x. Python, Scala eller R)
Erfarenhet av SQL och databashantering
Erfarenhet av dataanalys- och visualiseringsverktyg så som Pandas, Matplotlib
Kunskap om maskininlärningsbibliotek som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn
Behärskar god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Vad vi erbjuder:

Att vi trivs tillsammans på B3 Link är otroligt viktigt. Anledningen till att många börjar hos oss är bland annat det stora fokuset på kompetensutveckling, där vi kontinuerligt delar kunskap med varandra och uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och certifieringar. Vi erbjuder bland annat:


Generös kompetensutveckling
Attraktiv lönemodell
En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning


Om B3

B3 Link är en del av B3-koncernen. B3 är en börsnoterad koncern och trygg arbetsgivare med hög medarbetarnöjdhet. B3 har ca 1000 medarbetare inom många olika expertområden. B3 är rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord erfarenhet, olikheter och energi samt satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

Har du frågor om tjänsten? Tveka inte att kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Lidia, för denna tjänst på lidia.hagos@b3.se.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Avigna is hiring Machine Learning Engineer

Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join the team to build, support, and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through effective management of cost and schedule.

In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Experience


4+ years of professional experience working in relevant roles as a Machine Learning Engineer
Strong coding experience in modern programming languages, especially Python (3+ years)
Experience developing software products successfully deployed to production
Hands-on experience with cloud technologies for ML development (Google Cloud, Vertex AI preferred)
Strong background in MLOps practices, ML pipeline development, and production deployment of ML applications
Deep understanding of AI/ML techniques and familiarity with various frameworks
Expertise in handling high-volume heterogeneous data (batch and stream) and solid knowledge of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies


Location:


Stockholm, Sweden


Mode Of Work


Onsite (Remote work not allowed)


Assignment Period


26 May 2025 to 31 Oct 2025


Responsibilities


Develop AI/ML software products, including exploring large datasets, testing new algorithms, and optimizing model outputs
Design, develop, and maintain large-scale data infrastructure for AI/ML projects
Apply software architecture principles and design patterns to create scalable, maintainable, well-structured solutions
Develop frameworks and components addressing common AI/ML needs, such as feature reuse, model traceability, and A/B testing
Collaborate with cross-functional agile teams, including engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders, to enhance the AI ecosystem


Qualification


BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience)
Cloud certification required (GCP, Azure, or AWS)
Familiarity with agile methodologies, team collaboration, and data-driven development


What We Offer


Access to a strong developer community within the company to learn and grow
Competitive salary
Good work-life balance along with health and life insurance


AVIGNA holds Service authorization for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP Business All in one.

We have received an SAP Recognized Expertise designation for SAP® S/4HANA. We have consultants serving various customers using SAP and non-SAP products. Our Consulting experience spans across Telecom, Retail, Electrical, Paper, and Social Service Industries.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
What We Do

At Helicon, we build digital products that matter. As a digital product development & innovation agency specializing in cleantech, we partner with forward-thinking businesses to build breakthrough digital products, platforms, and capabilities that drive sustainability and efficiency.

Who We Are

Our journey has taken us from developing one of Sweden’s largest virtual power plants by connecting over 15,000 buildings, to using AI to optimize energy, water, and resource management around the world. We have also helped launch award-winning cleantech startups and SaaS solutions for the energy sector.

But we don’t just measure success by the impact we have on our customers. We measure it by the real-world sustainability gains our solutions create. When our customers tell us that our solutions helped shut down a coal and oil power plant, integrate more renewables into their portfolio, or cut 36,000 tons of CO₂ emissions annually, we take immense pride in that.

What truly drives us is our passion for solving complex challenges together by combining strategy, design, engineering, and data science. At Helicon, speed, curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re passionate about technology and in using it to make a positive impact on our planet, you’ll fit right in with our team.

About The Role


As a Data Science consultant, you are expected to have one or several assignments for our clients, be part of the Helicon team, and work closely with developers
Your main task will be to build and maintain machine learning models and pipelines for our clients
The focus will be models for time series forecasting, as part of a bigger system/application: build and test new models ranging from basic statistical models to cutting-edge deep learning models
Evaluate and maintain models throughout their life cycle
Be an integral part of the data science team, be a team player, and have a passion for building and sharing knowledge, especially knowledge that adds value to our clients


About you;

You are structured and self-going as a person and curious about the latest developments in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. You want to dig deeper into the field and apply the tools of data science to real client challenges. At the same time, you keep a strong business mindset while working to make sure we are always one step ahead.

What you’ll bring to the table;


Background from a quantitative field, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering etc
+3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, including expertise in Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling
+3 years of experience working with the Python data science stack (Pandas, Dask Numpy, PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow, Pyspark/Spark)
Experience working with time series analysis and forecasting
Knowledge of, and experience with, building pipelines for machine-learning models
Experience with developing and maintaining machine learning models
Experience using different databases and/or building data engineering pipelines
Experience with developing infrastructure and/or applications, preferably in relation to machine learning (MLOps)
Based in Stockholm with a valid work permit
Able to work in a hybrid setup and fluent in Swedish and English


What We Offer

At Helicon, you can expect to work alongside truly tech-passionate people every day. What we do has a big impact on building a more efficient future, which gives us pride in our work. We foster a culture of humble collaboration, where we are always eager to learn and innovate. We prioritize balance between your job and private life and regularly host social activities like hackathons, after-work gatherings, yearly conferences, shuffleboard comps, and more!

Application

Even if you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply, as our number one priority is to hire the right people instead of nitty-gritty tech.

Our recruitment process usually consists of a first interview, a technical step followed by a business and culture-focused interview.

Our journey has taken us from developing one of Sweden’s largest virtual power plants by connecting over 15,000 buildings, to using AI to optimize energy, water, and resource management around the world. We have also helped launch award-winning CleanTech startups and SaaS solutions for the energy sector.

But we don’t just measure success by the impact we have on our customers. We measure it by the real-world sustainability gains our solutions create. When our customers tell us that our solutions helped shut down a coal and oil power plant, integrate more renewables into their portfolio, or cut 36,000 tons of CO₂ emissions annually, we take immense pride in that.

What truly drives us is our passion for solving complex challenges together by combining strategy, design, engineering, and data science. At Helicon, speed, curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re passionate about technology and using it to make a positive impact on our planet, you’ll fit right in with our team.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Equal IT is partnered with an exciting FinTech who are building real-time payment systems that actually work!




We are looking for another Senior Engineer to join our team who is comfortable getting deep into the backend, building reliable systems, scaling stuff that’s already working, and helping figure out what comes next.




You Will Spend Your Days

Writing Python — obviously 😄
Building services that talk and process authentication/payment flows
Scaling the platform and improving performance
Owning architecture decisions with the rest of the team
Shipping features that directly impact thousands of users (and counting)




Your Technical Background

3+ years building backend systems (doesn’t have to be all Python, but strong Python helps)
Cloud experience ideally with Google Cloud but AWS or Azure will work
Microservices and service-oriented stuff with a big bonus if done at scale




On top of that.....

Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD
GO or modern JavaScript Frameworks (frontend knowledge is useful, but not required)
Security best practices around transactions, auth, encryption, etc.
Experience in FinTech, or building systems where things really have to work




Culture

Engineers have a real voice
No micromanagement, just a good team that cares about doing quality work
Growing but not chaotic and small enough that your work has real impact




If this sounds interesting, feel free to message or apply directly and let's go from there.

Show more

Title: Är du student och vill utvecklas inom AI och Data Science?
Description:
Studerar du på högskola eller universitet och har ett stort intresse för AI och Data Science samt motiveras av att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad? Vill du även arbeta med modern teknik och molnbaserade lösningar på ett bolag som genomsyras av stark entreprenörsanda där du får vara med och påverka, utveckla och bidra tillsammans med inspirerande och passionerade kollegor? Då har vi på Svedea rätt utmaning för dig!

Nu söker vi 2–3 engagerade och drivna studentmedarbetare som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar!

Om tjänsten

Hos oss får du chansen att omsätta dina teoretiska kunskaper i praktiken och bidra till att utveckla vårt AI- och dataarbete. Du kommer att arbeta nära vårt Analysteam och vara involverad i flera spännande projekt där du förväntas ta ägarskap och driva arbetet framåt:


Migration till molnbaserade lösningar - Säkerställa en smidig migrering från Tableau till PowerBI där du får chansen att skapa insiktsfulla analyser och skräddarsydda rapporter.
AI-assistent och chatbots - Var med och sätt våra AI-assistenter på prov! Du kommer att få vara med och testa samt utmana de lösningar som vi bygger.
Dataanalys och beslutsstöd - Upprätthålla och utveckla Power BI-rapporter och data science-modeller som möter verksamhetens behov och förväntningar.


Tjänsten är en tidsbegränsad anställning på ett år i taget med goda möjligheter till en anställning efter avklarade studier. Antal arbetstimmar per vecka sker enligt överenskommelse utifrån vad som passar både ditt studieschema och våra behov. Under sommarperioden juni-augusti ser vi gärna att du kan arbeta fler timmar.

Start sker enligt överenskommelse och du kommer att vara stationerad på vårt Stockholmskontor.

Din bakgrund

Vi söker dig som är ansvarsfull, driven, nyfiken och engagerad. Du har god social kompetens och tycker om att arbeta tillsammans med andra men har också en förmåga att arbeta självständigt och du tar ägarskap över dina arbetsuppgifter. På Svedea arbetar vi aktivt och målmedvetet med vår företagskultur, vi lägger stort värde i att stötta och supporta varandra på jobbet och att var och en bidrar aktivt till en inkluderande företagskultur. Du trivs i en entreprenöriell miljö, samarbetar gärna med andra och tvekar inte att ta initiativ och hjälper till där det behövs.

Utöver din personlighet ser vi att du:


studerar på högskola eller universitet med inriktning data, teknik eller motsvarande och vill kombinera dina studier med ett jobb vid sidan av. Du har avklarat mer än hälften av din utbildning och har minst ett år kvar på dina studier.
har goda studieresultat och ett stort intresse för AI, data och analys
behärskar svenska flytande då det är vårt bolagsspråk


Vi erbjuder dig


Möjlighet att tillämpa dina kunskaper i verkliga projekt och få praktisk erfarenhet inom dataanalys och AI-modellering.
En inblick i vår verksamhet där du får värdefull kunskap och erfarenhet för din fortsatta utveckling samt möjlighet att knyta kontakter inför framtiden.
En företagskultur som kännetecknas av laganda med passionerade och engagerande kollegor som förstår vikten av att hjälpas åt och att ha kul tillsammans. Följ oss gärna på LinkedIn och Instagram för att ta del av allt spännande som händer hos oss!
En arbetsplats som är inspirerande och fartfylld, där vi tillsammans jobbar för att driva Svedeas resa framåt. Du kommer att ha en mentor som stöd men även ingå i ett team och arbeta med erfarna, engagerade och passionerade kollegor.
Flexibla arbetstider som passar ditt studieschema.
Kontor högst upp i ett av Kungsholmens häftigaste hus med 360 graders vy över stan och terrasser i flera väderstreck. Spana in vår Office tour nedan 👇


Låter det intressant?

Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi arbetar löpande med urval så vänta inte utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Tjänsterna kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum vilket är den 31 maj. Observera att vi enbart tar emot ansökningar via länken i annonsen. Om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Lead Data Scientist, Aslak Olofsson, via mejl aslak.olofsson@svedea.se eller telefon: 08-790 04 27.

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

Vi undanber oss kontakt med rekryteringsföretag i denna rekryteringsprocess.

Om Svedea

Svedea är en framgångssaga. Våra första 15 år har gjort oss till det ledande bolaget inom försäkring av fritidsfordon som motorcykel, båt och snöskoter och vi är en stark utmanare inom bil-, djur- och företagsförsäkring. Efter önskemål från våra kunder erbjuder vi nu även hem- och villaförsäkring. Idag har vi omkring 430 000 kunder och fortsätter att växa snabbt.

Vår vision är att förändra försäkringsbranschen genom att finnas tillgängliga och göra allt för våra kunder. Hemligheten bakom vår framgång är engagerade medarbetare som trivs på jobbet i kombination med en tydlig företagskultur. Nu ökar vi tempot för att fortsätta växa, behålla de mest engagerade medarbetarna och de nöjdaste kunderna*. Vår resa har bara börjat!


Svenskt Kvalitetsindex (SKI) har tilldelat Svedea utmärkelsen Sveriges nöjdaste kunder i kategorin fordonsförsäkringar 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 och 2024 samt i kategorin djurförsäkring 2023.
Show more
HTML:
Studerar du på högskola eller universitet och har ett stort intresse för AI och Data Science samt motiveras av att skapa lösningar som gör skillnad? Vill du även arbeta med modern teknik och molnbaserade lösningar på ett bolag som genomsyras av stark entreprenörsanda där du får vara med och påverka, utveckla och bidra tillsammans med inspirerande och passionerade kollegor? Då har vi på Svedea rätt utmaning för dig!

Nu söker vi 2–3 engagerade och drivna studentmedarbetare som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar!

Om tjänsten

Hos oss får du chansen att omsätta dina teoretiska kunskaper i praktiken och bidra till att utveckla vårt AI- och dataarbete. Du kommer att arbeta nära vårt Analysteam och vara involverad i flera spännande projekt där du förväntas ta ägarskap och driva arbetet framåt:

  • Migration till molnbaserade lösningar - Säkerställa en smidig migrering från Tableau till PowerBI där du får chansen att skapa insiktsfulla analyser och skräddarsydda rapporter.
  • AI-assistent och chatbots - Var med och sätt våra AI-assistenter på prov! Du kommer att få vara med och testa samt utmana de lösningar som vi bygger.
  • Dataanalys och beslutsstöd - Upprätthålla och utveckla Power BI-rapporter och data science-modeller som möter verksamhetens behov och förväntningar.

Tjänsten är en tidsbegränsad anställning på ett år i taget med goda möjligheter till en anställning efter avklarade studier. Antal arbetstimmar per vecka sker enligt överenskommelse utifrån vad som passar både ditt studieschema och våra behov. Under sommarperioden juni-augusti ser vi gärna att du kan arbeta fler timmar.

Start sker enligt överenskommelse och du kommer att vara stationerad på vårt Stockholmskontor.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Developer for a Fast-Growing Startup 🚀




Are you a skilled backend developer looking to make a real impact in an ambitious and fast-paced environment?

As part of their team you'll have the opportunity to help shape a product that genuinely improves people’s everyday lives. 🙌




What You’ll Do

🚀 Enhance and expand their platform.
🤝 Collaborate closely with other developers and key stakeholders to identify and address customer needs.
🛠️ Take ownership of projects, driving both development and improvements.




What They're Looking For

🧠 2–3 years of experience in web development, with strong Python skills.
🔍 An analytical mindset and passion for clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
🌐 A solid understanding of digital transformation and industry modernization.
A bonus: Django development, Open API's and integrations, AWS (or other cloud environments)




Why Join Them?

🎉 Be part of an enthusiastic, collaborative team where your contributions matter.
💡 Join a company culture that values creativity, learning, and mutual support.
🏢 Work from a central location with flexibility to suit your lifestyle.
📈 Access career development opportunities in a rapidly scaling startup.







If you’re excited about being a key player in building something transformative and contributing to a growth journey, we’d love to hear from you! ✨ Send us your CV and portfolio today!

Show more

Are you a skilled backend developer looking to make a real impact in an ambitious and fast-paced environment?

As part of their team you'll have the opportunity to help shape a product that genuinely improves people’s everyday lives. 🙌


What You’ll Do

  • 🚀 Enhance and expand their platform.
  • 🤝 Collaborate closely with other developers and key stakeholders to identify and address customer needs.
  • 🛠️ Take ownership of projects, driving both development and improvements.


What They're Looking For

  • 🧠 2–3 years of experience in web development, with strong Python skills.
  • 🔍 An analytical mindset and passion for clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
  • 🌐 A solid understanding of digital transformation and industry modernization.
  • A bonus: Django development, Open API's and integrations, AWS (or other cloud environments)


Why Join Them?

  • 🎉 Be part of an enthusiastic, collaborative team where your contributions matter.
  • 💡 Join a company culture that values creativity, learning, and mutual support.

  • 📈 Access career development opportunities in a rapidly scaling startup.



If you’re excited about being a key player in building something transformative and contributing to a growth journey, we’d love to hear from you! ✨ Send us your CV and portfolio today!

Title: Data Scientist inom växtfysiologi vid enheten för paleobiologi
Description:
Om arbetsplatsen

Naturhistoriska riksmuseet är en statlig myndighet med regeringens uppdrag att främja kunskapen, forskningen och intresset för vår värld. Myndigheten är en framstående forskningsinstitution och Sveriges största museum. Museet har under mer än 200 år samlat in föremål och data och bedrivit forskning om livet på jorden. Samlingarna innehåller fler än 11 miljoner växter, djur, svampar, miljöprover, mineral och fossil. All forskning och kunskap delas i utställningarna, Cosmonova och i aktiviteter på museet och digitalt.

Arbetsuppgifter

Vill du vara en del av ett team som arbetar med banbrytande forskning och utveckling inom paleobiologi med fokus på växters anpassning till miljöförändringar över de senaste 200 miljoner åren? Vi söker dig som är engagerad och har en stark teknisk och vetenskaplig nyfikenhet.

I rollen kommer du att:

Arbeta med automatisering av bildanalys med AI för att stödja forskningsprojekt och utveckla nya insikter.

Genomföra analys och modellering av växtfysiologisk data, med fokus på att förstå och lösa komplexa biologiska samband.

Ansvara för mikroskopering av fossila och moderna växter, samt bildanalys och modellering för att främja kunskap om växternas utveckling.

Delta i utvecklingen av enhetens samlings- och bilddatabas, en viktig resurs för samordning och tillgänglighet inom forskningen.

Kvalifikationer

För att lyckas i tjänsten ser vi att du behöver ha:


Masterexamen i fysik, datateknik eller närliggande ämne
Masterexamen inom växtfysiologi
Bred kompetens inom programmering
Erfarenhet av datahantering och statistisk analys med programvaran R eller liknande
Erfarenhet av mikroskopering
Goda kunskaper inom maskininlärning
Erfarenhet av bildanalys med hjälp av deep learning algoritmer som till exempel CNN
Goda kunskaper i databashantering, gärna FileMaker
Mycket goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i svenska och engelska
God kommunikationsförmåga


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av naturvetenskapligt samlingsarbete samt kunskap i taxonomi.

Du tar självständigt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter, tar initiativ och kommer med förslag på lösningar. Du är noggrann, följer upp det egna arbetet och avslutar det. Du har även god samarbetsförmåga.

Övrig information

Vårt mål är att genom forskning och publik verksamhet visa vägen till ökad kunskap och handlingskraft, för att vi tillsammans ska kunna bidra till en hållbar och ljus framtid. Vår långsiktiga strävan är att Naturhistoriska riksmuseets anställda ska spegla den mångfald som finns i Sverige. Vi välkomnar alla sökanden oavsett kön, bakgrund, ursprung och funktionsvariation.

Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanbeder oss därför kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
Show more

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Platform
Description:
As a Staff Data Scientist in Spotify’s Platform Mission, you will play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions for our platform infrastructure. You will develop actionable research, identify improvement opportunities, and influence the evolution of Spotify’s foundational infrastructure. You will primarily (but not exclusively) focus on Spotify’s platforms for data and security. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that our platforms are efficient, scalable, and aligned with user and organizational needs.

This is an opportunity to work on some of the most complex technical challenges at Spotify, leveraging effective and actionable data science.

What You'll Do


Analyze large datasets to identify bottlenecks and propose actionable solutions to improve platform performance.
Develop recommendations to optimize Spotify’s platform performance, reliability, and scalability.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate data science insights into the development of Spotify’s platforms.
Define and measure key performance metrics for platform reliability, scalability, and efficiency.
Partner with leadership to identify high-impact opportunities and prioritize data science projects that drive platform innovation.
Serve as a leader and trusted advisor for data science applications in platform development.
Communicate complex technical findings to diverse stakeholders, including executives and non-technical teams.
Provide technical mentorship to data scientists and analysts within the team.
Advocate for best practices in data science, including reproducibility, and ethical AI considerations.
Explore cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to enhance Spotify’s platform capabilities.
Stay informed on trends in data science, distributed systems, and cloud computing to influence the company’s long-term platform strategy.


Who You Are


Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a similar field.
8+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or applied statistics, with a focus on large-scale systems or infrastructure.
Proficiency in relevant tools such as Python, R, or BigQuery, and experience with distributed computing.
Comfort with machine learning frameworks and statistical modeling techniques.
Outstanding problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous technical challenges.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with an emphasis on storytelling with data. Leadership and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams.
Preferred qualifications: deep understanding of platform infrastructure (including distributed systems, cloud platforms, and SRE principles), proven track record of deploying data science solutions in production environments at scale, experience working with time-series data, anomaly detection, and forecasting in operational systems, familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).


Where You'll Be


This role is based in Stockholm or London.
We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come in 3 times per week.


Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.

Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: AI Engineer, Sweden - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Title: Forskare inom autonoma system
Description:
Är du forskare och har du intresse för teknik och försvar? Vill du använda din kompetens till att forska om och utveckla användningen av autonoma farkoster?

Vill du arbeta på en arbetsplats med hög kompetens och i spännande projekt för en säkrare värld

Då kan FOI vara din nya arbetsplats! Vi erbjuder ett arbetsliv i balans, en utvecklande arbetsmiljö och ett samhällsviktigt arbete!


Om tjänsten


I rollen som forskare kommer du att arbeta i en grupp med kolleger som forskar om olika aspekter av autonoma system. Det innebär utveckling av autonoma farkoster med fokus på algoritmer för uppdragsplanering, styrning, navigering och farkostdynamik. Forskningsresultaten och kunskaperna används till expertstöd i form av underlag för värdering och anskaffning av Försvarsmaktens framtida system. Syftet med arbetet är att förstå prestandan och förmågan både hos existerande system och framtida koncept. Arbetet är baserat på vetenskaplig metod och sker både på kontor och vid praktiska försök.



Om enheten



Du kommer att ingå i enheten Autonomi och modellförvaltning som tillhör avdelningen Försvarsteknik. Enhetens uppdrag är att arbeta med utveckling och analys av autonoma farkoster. Läs gärna mer om vad vi gör: Försvarsteknik - Totalförsvarets forskningsinstitut - FOI


Har du den kompetensprofil vi behöver?



Vi Söker Dig Som Har



Disputerat eller inom en snar framtid kommer att disputera inom systemteori, reglerteknik, robotik, tillämpad matematik, eller motsvarande inriktning som vi bedömer som relevant
god förmåga att kommunicera klart och tydligt i både tal och skrift på svenska och engelska



Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har



kunskaper i maskininlärning och programmering
kunskaper inom automation av UxV:er
förmåga till algoritm- och modellutveckling


Som person trivs du med att arbeta mot uppsatta mål och du fokuserar på resultat. Du är strategiskt lagd, förstår din roll och kan se till hela verksamhetens bästa i det arbete du utför. Vidare har du lätt för att samarbeta och bidrar till ett gott samarbetsklimat.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.


Vad erbjuder vi dig?


FOI erbjuder en unik arbetsplats, där du får möjlighet att arbeta med det som är viktigt för både totalförsvaret och hela samhället. FOI är en statlig myndighet under Försvarsdepartementet och är ett av Europas ledande forskningsinstitut inom försvar och säkerhet.

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsort för tjänsten är Stockholm-Kista.

Vi arbetar medvetet för en god arbetsmiljö med en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Utöver detta erbjuder vi en rad förmåner. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: https://www.foi.se/jobba-hos-oss.html


Vill du vara med och söka svaren för en säkrare värld?


Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och personligt brev via ansökningsknappen senast den 11 maj.

För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Karin Kraft. Fackliga företrädare är Staffan Lindgren (Saco-S) och Jakob Paulin (OFR/S – ST). Samtliga nås på 08-555 030 00.

Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). Inför säkerhetsprövning kommer den slutkandidat som är aktuell för tjänsten behöva lämna in vidimerade kopior på av oss angivna utbildnings-/examensbevis samt tjänstgöringsintyg som styrker de kunskaper och erfarenheter som är relevanta för tjänsten.

Då vi är en myndighet betraktas inlämnade ansökningshandlingar som allmän handling och kan på begäran lämnas ut till utomstående enligt offentlighets- och sekretesslagen.

Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag undanbedes.
Show more

Title: M.Sc project in Artificial Intelligence Researcher
Company: Department of Plant and Environmental Sciences, University of Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Master’s Thesis Project Opportunity: Artificial Intelligence used for Protein Function & Interaction Prediction




We are looking for a motivated Master’s student to explore the potential of modern machine learning approaches in gene function prediction. This project will focus on leveraging protein sequences, language models and sequence embeddings to:

• Predict gene function using convolutional and transformer-based architectures

• Investigate the use of attention mechanisms to improve existing predictors

• Develop novel approaches for predicting protein–protein interactions using embedding space

• Optionally, prototype a variational autoencoder (VAE) to structure protein embedding space




You will work with state-of-the-art embedding models, gain hands-on experience with deep learning (CNNs, transformers, VAEs), and have room to tailor the project toward your interests in functional genomics or protein interaction networks.




Basic experience with Python and ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch or TensorFlow) is a strong plus. Prior knowledge in bioinformatics is a plus, but not essential.




This opportunity is only given to students currently doing M.Sc. studies at the University of Copenhagen




Interested? Get in touch with Assoc. Prof. Marek Mutwil, PLEN, mutwil@plen.ku.dk

#Master #M.Sc #KU

Show more

Title: Senior Software Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Title: Senior Developer for XR Solution

Company: AR Comply

Location: Based in Copenhagen, Denmark

About Us:
AR Comply is at the forefront of creating innovative XR solutions for augmented training and remote specialist applications. At AR Comply we are revolutionizing the way training and remote support are delivered by leveraging cutting-edge augmented reality technologies. We are looking for a Senior Developer to join our team and contribute to the development of our cutting-edge XR solutions.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Developer to join our dynamic team. You will play a critical role in the development of our XR solutions, providing technical expertise and leadership. You will work closely with our CTO, engaging in strategic discussions, planning sprints, and ensuring the highest standards of code quality and efficiency.
Moreover, you will be responsible for the integration of generative AI into our solution.

Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with the CTO on new features and sprint planning.
- Provide guidance on best practices for task definition and description.
- Conduct code reviews, focusing on code efficiency, best practices, and the application of relevant code structures and design patterns.
- Support the other developers in ensuring best practices and ensuring continuous up-skilling.
- Develop and maintain XR solutions for augmented training and remote specialist support.


Qualifications:
- Extensive knowledge and experience in C# and .Net development.
- Strong knowledge of SQL and general database development.
- Expertise in cyber-security and security implementation.
- Familiarity with Azure services.
- Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
- Skilled in setting up and deploying in various environments.
- Experience with OpenAI API or Google Gemini.

Additional Qualifications:
- Experience with VR/XR development
- Experience with Unity

What We Offer:
- Opportunity to work on pioneering XR technology.
- A collaborative and innovative work environment.
- Opportunities for professional growth and development.

How to Apply:
If you are passionate about XR development and eager to work on transformative extended reality solutions, we want to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a portfolio of your work to thomas@arcomply.io with the subject line "Senior Developer Application - [Your Name]".

Join us at AR Comply and be a part of transforming the future of training and remote support with XR technology!


AR Comply is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Show more

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
Are you a Back End Developer with experience in Go programming?




We’re on the lookout for a Senior Back End Developer to join our client based in Denmark who are the leading provider of omnichannel payment and commerce solutions to global clients.




They are a rapidly growing company driven by a talented team with diverse experiences and unique insights. Their community stretches across the globe with offices in Copenhagen, Dallas, Dubai, London, Miami, Pune, and Singapore.




Key Skills:




Strong experience working with behavior-driven development, CI/CD, Docker and Kubernetes, messaging systems and Rest APIs.
Strong practical experience with distributed systems.
Experience from at least one Cloud platform.
Experience with the Go programming language.
You appreciate working with managed services, and serverless architecture.




What They Offer:




Thrive in a dynamic, global fintech environment.
Work with a diverse team of talented professionals.
Opportunities for career growth in a leading fintech provider.




If you're ready to be a key player in redefining omnichannel payments and commerce solutions worldwide then please apply!

Title: Solution Engineer, Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Take on this diverse technical role and play a key role in deploying our market-leading software solutions within our Defence customers’ environments through close collaboration with customers and our teams to deliver end-to-end technical solutions. From system integration to on-site technical support and training sessions you will make a genuine impact in this role!

Join our growing Defence Services organisation in Copenhagen
You will be based at our brand-new office in the heart of Copenhagen, and play a key role in our dynamic and growing team as it works to provide our customers with the best possible support and services.

In this role, you will report directly to the Senior Project Manager for the Nordic constellation, collaborating closely with the Nordic project teams but also with colleagues across our global constellations.

Deliver solutions to support critical decision-making on the battlefield
As a Solution Engineer, you will be a key player in delivering our SitaWare and Iris software products within our customers’ environments. Working closely with colleagues and customers, your tasks will cover a broad range of responsibilities within areas such as solution design, configuration, installation, technical support, technical training, interoperability and testing.

Your key tasks may include:


installing and configuring our software products in customer environments to meet complex user needs
solving technical problems, including fault-finding and troubleshooting
supporting the delivery of technical training for our customers
providing remote and on-site support to customers, especially during military exercises
coordinating with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, subcontractors, consultants and colleagues within Systematic
helping to ensure that projects are delivered within the agreed scope, on budget and on time.



In this role, you will have the opportunity to travel to customer sites and Systematic locations across the Nordics and Europe several times a year.

Bring your strong technical expertise into play
Our new colleague brings with them a strong and broad technical background and experience from a similar role. As a minimum, you hold a bachelor’s degree in software engineering or related field. Ideally, you have experience with and enjoy customer-facing activities as well as providing technical support.

We are also seeking a colleague with skills within one or more of the following:


Windows Enterprise & Server
Linux (Red Hat/Ubuntu)
SQL and MS SQL Server
Network (IP, TCP, UDP, multicast, routing, firewall)
Active Directory, scripting (PowerShell, Bash)
Java enterprise applications and microservices



Finally, you will be one step ahead if you also have experience at working with Docker and Kubernetes.

You must be a strong communicator in both English and Danish. A military background from an IT-related role is a plus but not a requirement.

Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. Systematic is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which organises almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme.

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on +45 8943 2000 and ask for Stine Aulby Mather, Senior Project Manager, Defence Services.

Curious about this position?

Pernille Aakjær Andersen

Senior Talent Acquisition Partner


Show more

In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme.

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on +45 8943 2000 and ask for Stine Aulby Mather, Senior Project Manager, Defence Services.

Curious about this position?

Pernille Aakjær Andersen

Senior Talent Acquisition Partner

Title: Front-end developer (unpaid, must already be Europe based)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an experienced and a knowledgeable front-end developer that will contribute from the start - driven, motivated and proactive, eager to solve problems and challenges. Has a can-do and go-getter attitude!

Join an international SaaS startup with global expansion and growth ambitions, helping to reduce carbon emissions in transportation.

We are a growing, diverse, and international team focused on doing our part in reducing the exacerbation of carbon dioxide emissions from passenger cars. We do this by nudging consumers to buy electric vehicles (EVs) and we collaborate with businesses as well as governments to support consumers in entering the market for EVs.

The team is developing a digital marketplace where consumers can learn about EVs and get help throughout their purchase journey to acquire a car. We are passionate and working hard to strengthen the development of the platform and are proud of the outcome so far.

We're looking for an intern to further progress the endeavor.

We provide a B2C and B2B marketplace platform (SaaS) in the automobile industry, focusing on hybrid- and electric cars. We also partner with B2G for charging infrastructure.

You don't have to be knowledgeable in the automotive industry but excellent and experienced coding front-end, structured, meticulous, curious for answers and solutions, and creative.

No need to be experienced or knowledgeable in the automotive sector, you need to be an excellent developer, and experienced with Next.js, Typescript, connecting to MongoDB (back-end).

We are looking for the right candidate to help us further develop our platform.

Expectations


Experienced with Next.js, Typescript, Tailwind, Redux
Experienced with SEO
Knowledgeable with MongoDB, data flow
Experienced with Accessibility
Experienced with analytics tools and others, e.g. Hotjar, Google Analytics, tags, heat maps, events, etc
Can collaborate with and code from mockups designed by the UX/UI team
Ability to handle a dynamic position within a startup


When joining you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of our company. We have a team and looking to add an additional member.

This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self and celebrated for the skills, talent, curiousness, problem-solving, perspective, solution-finding, and honest opinion you bring to the table.

If you are an introvert or someone who doesn't handle large groups that easily, there is room for you here. We believe that diverse, inclusive teams drive innovation, performance, and excellence.

We provide equal opportunities without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, religion, political opinion, nationality, ethnic background, social origin, social status, indigenous status, disability, age.

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Full Stack Engineer – AI Startup - Copenhagen – Up to 65,000 DKK




We are currently working with an innovative startup company who are building an autonomous AI platform to help businesses with their hiring needs. Backed by top investors and scaling rapidly, they’re revolutionizing recruitment for essential industries across Europe.




Having just gone through a new funding round, they're looking to add another two engineers to the team.




About the Role:




They’re looking for a passionate full stack developer to join their core team and work closely with the CTO. This is a unique chance to improve and shape the future of their platform and take ownership of impactful, cutting-edge solutions.




Because of the nature of their platform, AI will play a pivotal role in your day to day work. They use Cursor, and are looking for someone who sees the benefit of such tools. Most of your time will be spent working on backend / architecture but their engineers work on features end to end, so some frontend work will be involved too.




You’ll be working in their Copenhagen office most of the time, though they do offer some flexibility to work from home when needed.




What They’re Looking For:




Strong passion for building impactful products
Minimum 4 years’ experience
A growth mindset and interest in AI
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




What You’ll Get:




Significant responsibility and ownership
The opportunity to work with AI at the forefront of recruitment
Equity in a fast-growing startup




On offer is up to 65,000 DKK plus benefits!




If you think this role could be for you, drop me an email with your latest CV at jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com and we can set up a call.

Title: Backend Engineer
Description:
About Us Kaima is a climate tech startup making renewable energy a better and more reliable investment. We're building tools that boost ROI on solar and wind assets across Europe, while making both the investments and the energy produced accessible for any type of consumer, big or small. We’ve already launched for several paying customers just a few short months in, and are part of the first real citizen driven energy community in Denmark. Right now we're 4 people with big dreams and a passion for building stellar products that improve society, and we’d love to expand our team with someone who wants to help us realize those dreams.




The Role We’re looking for a talented Backend Engineer who's both curious and adaptable, and who wants to be part of the early culture of a growing startup. Early employee = real impact + actual ownership. No corporate ladder climbing here, just direct influence on what we build.




Level Junior to Senior




What We Offer

45.000 - 75.000 DKK monthly (adjusted for qualifications and geographic location).
Equity that might actually be worth something someday.
Remote from anywhere in Europe; or hybrid with our office in Copenhagen.
Budget for a home office setup.
1 week extra vacation, on top of location-dependent norm.
Free lunch (because nobody likes sad desk sandwiches).




Our Culture

Honesty (even when it's awkward)
Kindness (even on Mondays)
Enjoying what we do.
Business-focused problem solving.
Working alone when it makes sense, together when it doesn't.




Responsibilities

Write code in our C# backend (and possibly C# frontend).
Help decide what features to build next.
Keep our cloud from raining on us.
Turn business ideas into great products and software.
Wear multiple hats (actual hat-wearing optional).
Be an opinionated part of fostering our work culture.




Qualifications

Someone who knows code but isn't a jerk about it.
C# experience is nice, but not strictly necessary.
Industry experience is nice, but not necessary.
Comfort with "I don't know yet" situations.
Solid problem-solving and communication skills.




Join Us! Help us make renewable energy more profitable while getting in early enough for your equity to matter. We're really excited to add to our little team. If you're ready to help revolutionize renewable energy investments while growing with an early-stage startup, we'd love to hear from you!




You can apply here on LinkedIn, or through The Hub at https://thehub.io/jobs/681cae434fd44613aa5a7ac4

Title: Technical SME - AI/ML and Core System Integration
Place: Gladsaxe, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Swiss Delivery Excellence: Transforming Life Science Consulting Worldwide.

Fusion Consulting is a globally leading Business and IT boutique consultancy specialized in the Life Sciences industry, partnering with leading companies in pharma, healthcare, and animal health.

With over 450 employees and 25 offices worldwide, our mission is to revolutionize our clients' business transformation challenges and set new industry standards through innovative solutions.

Focused on S4HANA, Data & Cloud, and innovative technologies, Fusion Consulting brings unparalleled expertise and commitment to excellence to every project we undertake.

Grounded in our commitment to fast and intelligent decision-making, our client-first and open-hearted approach defines our ethos. With unwavering support and an entrepreneurial spirit, our global teamwork transcends boundaries and turns shared visions into reality.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Technical SME specializing in AI/Machine Learning and Core System Ingestion & Integration to support the implementation of an AI/ML solution for reading Certificates of Analysis (CoAs) and integrating the data into the core systems. The SME will play a crucial role in providing technical guidance, estimating implementation resources, and developing a strategic roadmap for successful rollout.

Key Responsibilities


Act as a sparring partner, offering technical input on the AI/ML solution to read CoAs.
Support solution scoping and estimate the resources required for implementation.
Develop a roadmap for prioritized initiatives to facilitate rollout and implementation.
Collaborate with solution architects to ensure seamless data ingestion into core systems.
Guide the analysis lead in gathering necessary information for timely proposal delivery.
Provide insights on GxP validation requirements and phased rollout strategies.
Contribute to proposal development for Steering Committee recommendations.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements while aligning with business needs.


Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI/ML, or related field.
Proven experience in implementing AI/ML solutions for data ingestion and integration.
Strong understanding of CoA processing and core system integration.
Experience working in GxP-regulated environments.
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional global environment.
Familiarity with AI/ML regulatory considerations in the pharmaceutical industry.


Additional Information

At Fusion, we unite entrepreneurial minds from around the globe to develop and implement game-changing solutions that build lasting relationships with our clients.

We value employees who challenge the status quo through innovation, adapt to diverse client needs in ever-changing environments, and commit to continuous learning—for themselves and their colleagues.

Why Fusion?

We provide a competitive salary and benefits package, along with an outstanding work environment that fosters long-term career development opportunities.

Our Benefits


Workflex: Enjoy 25 working days off annually, giving you the flexibility to work from your preferred global location.
Flexible Time Off: Take time off as needed to recharge and maintain a healthy work-life balance. Let’s shape the future together—how far will you take yourself with Fusion Consulting?
Annual Training Budget: You will receive 1,500 CHF to support your professional development.
Unity Scheme: Benefit from loyalty rewards starting after 3 years of service.


At Fusion Consulting, your growth has no limits. How far will you go?
