Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
In A Nutshell

We are building the leading B2B electricity supplier in Europe. We are building an exceptional team and are on a trajectory to drive impact at scale.
Reel is rethinking electricity procurement to accelerate the renewable energy transition and reduce emissions.
As a workplace, we highly value trust, autonomy, and time for focused deep work.
You have a high passion for renewable energy and want to put your skills to use in a highly purpose-driven, supportive and collaborative organization.
For more info on Reel, see our careers page.




How You Can Contribute

The Impact You Will Make

As our new Software Engineer, you will be directly helping companies achieve lower electricity costs and drive real climate impact. You will work closely with Christian, our CTO, and the rest of the tech team to build the digital infrastructure of the renewable energy transition.




What You Will Work On

These are some (not all) of the things you will be working on

Build software for controlling grid-scale batteries to help stabilize the grid in real-time.
Develop features for our user-facing analytics tools to provide insights into consumption, production, emission and financial data.
Build secure integrations with physical (solar, wind and battery) assets.
Build out best-in-class data pipelines handling vast amounts of data.
Expand our electricity billing engine, ensuring accurate and on-time billing for our customers.
Take part in making key technical decisions.
Perform code reviews, sharing constructive feedback with your colleagues.




How You Can Thrive In This Role

You are enthusiastic about having a real impact on climate change. With a keen interest in renewable energy and sustainability, you are motivated to use your skills to contribute to a cleaner, greener future. You do not need to have prior knowledge about renewables, PPAs, or electricity.




In addition, you will have some (not necessarily all) of the following traits:

Enjoy working on projects all the way from 0 to 1, shipping multiple times a week.
Like to work across the entire tech stack, but with a focus on back-end and data.
Have 2+ years of professional experience working with software engineering.
Value learning and growing your skillset with support from your team.
You thrive working in an environment with a high degree of autonomy and responsibility, but are also not afraid to reach out and ask for help.
We work in Elixir, using the Phoenix framework and LiveView for the front-end + Python for ML and trading. We’re hosted on Fly.io and GCP, data in Postgres and BigQuery. Experience in this stack is by no means a requirement - several engineers on the team today had no prior experience in Elixir.




What We Offer You

We aim to provide you with a workplace environment where you can grow both professionally and personally. We offer an attractive base salary as well as a generous warrant program for all full-time employees.




Benefits

Vacation: Enjoy 30 days (5 weeks + 1) of paid holidays to recharge.
Pension: Benefit from an attractive employer-supported pension scheme, including health insurance.
Parental leave: Take advantage of our generous parental leave policy.
Equipment: Choose your preferred IT setup (Mac, Windows, etc.) with a budget of 25,000 DKK.
Learning: Grow your skills with an annual 4,000 DKK learning and development budget.
Office: Experience our vibrant office-first culture in our beautiful waterside location in Christianshavn, with a flexible work-from-home or remote work policy.
Lunch: Enjoy employer-supported catered lunch at the office every day.
Socials: Join us for monthly social events and bi-annual offsites, fostering a strong team spirit.
Visa: We support non-EU residents by sponsoring VISAs.




Interested?

We are very excited to hear from you. You can find more information about the interview process here.




You don't feel like you fulfil all the criteria?

We know that 'perfect' candidates do not exist. Don't hesitate to apply even if you don't meet all of the criteria listed on paper.




We encourage all candidates, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religious beliefs, etc., to apply.

Title: Soon-to-be or newly graduated Software Developer
Description:
Are you passionate about developing and delivering valuable software solutions that help improve the daily lives of our customers in the defence sector? Then seize this opportunity to get your career off to an exciting start at Systematic! The knowledge and drive that you will undoubtedly bring to the job will be greatly valued from day one.

The job we offer
Joining Systematic as a newly graduated Developer, you will work alongside dedicated colleagues who share your passion for creating the best solutions for our customers. We encourage knowledge sharing and are constantly trying to develop smarter processes. In a working environment characterised by a structured work environment, high levels of responsibility, influence, and freedom, you can grow and determine your path, either as a Software Specialist, Software Architect or Project Manager.

This job is for you if you want to work with various technological solutions and methods. It is an advantage for your work if you are familiar with some of the following technologies, which we use:


Java EE, .NET (C#), Scala – here, experience with Java would be a plus
HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Angular/AngularJS)
REST, HTTP/S
SQL (MSSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL)
Spring Boot
Docker
Kubernetes



However, let us talk to see whether we can find the perfect match for you! As long as you bring the foundation and motivation, we can support you in learning much of the rest. 

Developing excellent software to save lives
At Systematic, we believe that software, when built and used properly, can help create a better society for everyone. As a Software Developer within our Defence business area, you will have the opportunity to develop software solutions that simplify complex processes and increase efficiency for our customers.

Our teams value collaboration and a commitment to excellence, which means you will have the chance to work closely with and learn from experienced professionals who are dedicated to delivering high-quality software solutions. From your first day with us, you will receive comprehensive training and ongoing support to ensure your success – and this includes having a mentor. We know that you still have to learn, but what better way to learn than by doing it?

Right now, we are looking for new colleagues who are passionate about software development and making a difference in the world. So, if you share this passion with us and are excited about the prospect of working with meaningful projects impacting society, while growing your professional software competencies, we sincerely hope that you apply.

Your Qualifications
We are looking for new colleagues with a master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or something similar. Especially if you are about to graduate and are keen to apply your technological skills. The specific tech stack that you will work with depends on your interests and which team you will join.

Nevertheless, it is advantageous if:


You are cooperative and strive to make a positive contribution to team dynamics.
You are ambitious and always working to improve yourself as a motivated team player.
You work systematically while paying close attention to detail, and you take pride in understanding complex solutions and customer challenges.
You are fluent in English, as it is our corporate language used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

What To Expect From Systematic
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your career with us
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis and expect to conduct interviews ongoingly too, expectedly in May and June as we wish to welcome our new colleagues for a thorough onboarding programme after the Summer, starting September 1st.

So click Apply Now and send us your CV today.

If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Julie Lysbjerg Christensen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant, for more information about the position.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about developing and delivering valuable software solutions that help improve the daily lives of our customers in the defence sector? Then seize this opportunity to get your career off to an exciting start at Systematic! The knowledge and drive that you will undoubtedly bring to the job will be greatly valued from day one.

The job we offer
Joining Systematic as a newly graduated Developer, you will work alongside dedicated colleagues who share your passion for creating the best solutions for our customers. We encourage knowledge sharing and are constantly trying to develop smarter processes. In a working environment characterised by a structured work environment, high levels of responsibility, influence, and freedom, you can grow and determine your path, either as a Software Specialist, Software Architect or Project Manager.

This job is for you if you want to work with various technological solutions and methods. It is an advantage for your work if you are familiar with some of the following technologies, which we use:

  • Java EE, .NET (C#), Scala – here, experience with Java would be a plus
  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Angular/AngularJS)
  • REST, HTTP/S
  • SQL (MSSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL)
  • Spring Boot
  • Docker
  • Kubernetes


However, let us talk to see whether we can find the perfect match for you! As long as you bring the foundation and motivation, we can support you in learning much of the rest. 

Developing excellent software to save lives
At Systematic, we believe that software, when built and used properly, can help create a better society for everyone. As a Software Developer within our Defence business area, you will have the opportunity to develop software solutions that simplify complex processes and increase efficiency for our customers.

Our teams value collaboration and a commitment to excellence, which means you will have the chance to work closely with and learn from experienced professionals who are dedicated to delivering high-quality software solutions. From your first day with us, you will receive comprehensive training and ongoing support to ensure your success – and this includes having a mentor. We know that you still have to learn, but what better way to learn than by doing it?

Right now, we are looking for new colleagues who are passionate about software development and making a difference in the world. So, if you share this passion with us and are excited about the prospect of working with meaningful projects impacting society, while growing your professional software competencies, we sincerely hope that you apply.

Your Qualifications
We are looking for new colleagues with a master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or something similar. Especially if you are about to graduate and are keen to apply your technological skills. The specific tech stack that you will work with depends on your interests and which team you will join.

Nevertheless, it is advantageous if:

  • You are cooperative and strive to make a positive contribution to team dynamics.
  • You are ambitious and always working to improve yourself as a motivated team player.
  • You work systematically while paying close attention to detail, and you take pride in understanding complex solutions and customer challenges.
  • You are fluent in English, as it is our corporate language used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.


Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

What To Expect From Systematic
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your career with us
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis and expect to conduct interviews ongoingly too, expectedly in May and June as we wish to welcome our new colleagues for a thorough onboarding programme after the Summer, starting September 1st.

So click Apply Now and send us your CV today.

If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Julie Lysbjerg Christensen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant, for more information about the position.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, designing robust and scalable software infrastructure, and collaborating with dedicated colleagues — all while playing a key role in scaling our business even further.




Does this sound exciting? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been a market leader in automating financial markets since our inception in 2008, pioneering fully automated natural language processing systems to read and interpret financial news.




To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.




In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.




Key responsibilities include:

Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.




About you

Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets and training distributed models
Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
A few years of experience in production-grade environments working with the full Machine Learning stack from dataset generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask)
Familiarity with containerization technologies (for example Docker Compose or Kubernetes)




Nice to have

A scientific and inquisitive mind
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.




If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

Show more

Title: Quantitative Developer
Company: Recruit IT - Rekruttering af IT specialister
Description:
For our client, EIO Energy, we are looking for a Quantitative Developer to join their team. Are you passionate about building efficient models to predict prices, trends, and more in the electricity market? Do you have strong coding skills? Are you interested in market processes and enjoy collaborating with analysts, traders, and other developers?




Then keep reading!




If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!




You are naturally curious and eager to learn. New challenges excites you, and when a topic fascinates you, you dive deep into it.
You always ask "why." You seek context to understand the full picture and thrive in complex environments.
You make data-driven decisions because data enhances precision and accuracy. You have a natural talent for working with numbers and a critical mindset.
You quickly visualize scenarios and patterns when planning. You have a keen interest in the future, technology, and new trends.
Integrity is crucial to you. When you make a commitment, you take ownership, and you expect the same from your colleagues.
You are highly organized. You structure your work meticulously and dislike delivering anything that hasn’t been thoroughly reviewed.
You thrive in a workplace with a welcoming and friendly culture. You value teamwork and enjoy being part of a supportive environment.




Your Responsibilities




Develop and implement robust predictive models for pricing and market trends.
Collaborate with analysts and traders to understand their needs and translate them into effective modeling solutions.
Identify projects and models that add value—and recognize those that do not.
Continuously gather knowledge about the market and spot trends to benefit the team.




What EIO Expect from You




A Master's or PhD's degree in a technical field such as Economics, Physics, Data Science, etc. Alternatively, equivalent education combined with professional experience that equips you with the necessary skills.
Experience with Python, including Pandas, NumPy, and one or more modeling/ML libraries.
Experience with modeling or model development.
Professional-level English proficiency (spoken and written).
Danish proficiency is a plus but not mandatory.
EU work permit and residency in Denmark.




Nice-to-Haves (Not Required, but a Plus):




1+ years Work experience.
Experience with Git for version control.
Experience using APIs as both a consumer and provider, including designing and implementing RESTful APIs and integrating third-party services.
Experience with CI/CD practices.




About EIO Energy and the Team Culture




EIO Energy is a newer energy trading company based in Aarhus. They take a quantitative approach to trading, meaning every decision is backed by data. Through a fund they are giving both private and institutional investors access to returns from European energy markets.




At Eio Energy they embrace a ‘freedom with responsibility’ mindset.




"What do we mean by freedom with responsibility?" They hire people they trust to excel at what they do. And what they don’t know, they teach them. They foster a workplace where autonomy is key, and employees thrive under the responsibility they take on. When you enjoy solving problems, you naturally take ownership, and high quality follows.




What EIO Offer




Flexible working hours – as long as the work gets done, we offer a lot of freedom.
A fantastic team with a great sense of humor – we believe work should be fun!
Possibly the best lunch arrangement in Aarhus N.
Free gym access in the building.
Show more

Title: We’re Hiring Testers for My Bike Guard!
Description:
We’re Hiring Testers for My Bike Guard!




At My Bike Guard, we're on a mission to revolutionize cycling safety, and we need curious, passionate individuals who want to be a part of shaping the future of cycling tech.




We're looking for testers to try out the pre-launch version of our app and help us make it even better. Your feedback will play a crucial role in fine-tuning the features that will keep cyclists safer on the road!




If you're excited about:

Cycling safety
Innovative tech
Making a difference

Then we want to hear from you!




What we need:

Cyclists who are ready to test out the latest version of our app.
Curious minds willing to share insights, feedback, and suggestions.
People who care about the cycling community and want to help create a smarter, safer riding experience.




What you’ll get:

Early access to My Bike Guard.
A chance to influence the future of cycling safety.
Recognition for helping us build something meaningful.



Interested? Drop us a message or apply now, and let’s make cycling safer, together!




Apply => http://mybikeguard.com/signup




#MyBikeGuard #CyclingSafety #CyclingTech #AppTesting #JoinTheJourney #CyclingCommunity #TestersWanted #InnovativeCycling #FutureOfCycling

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Sky Labs Aalborg are looking for a talented Senior Developer to join our highly skilled team. So if you are passionate about developing software for embedded products, which set the reference for broadcast and streaming media – Then you might be the developer we are looking for.




Sky Labs Aalborg is part of Sky Plc and Comcast Inc. Sky is one of Europe’s leading media and entertainment companies and part of Comcast Corporation. Across six countries our innovative products connect millions of customers to the best apps, and all the entertainment, sports, news and arts they love, including our own award-winning original content.




At the Aalborg office, we develop key software components for consumer devices used by Sky and Comcast broadcast and internet customers. We are expanding our presence in Denmark, adding additional technical areas and you will have a unique opportunity to grow as part of a new team starting here.




The UI team here in Aalborg consists of nine great developers, and together with them you will have the opportunity to influence the workflow and improve the performance for customer facing features on the Sky’s Glass TV. You will also be working with colleagues worldwide, to create the best solutions and continue the development.




What are we looking for?

Master or BSc in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar education
Experience with project-oriented software development
Experience with C++ or extensive experience in a similar object-oriented language like C#, Kotlin or Swift.
Strong unit testing experience
Experience with Python or similar scripting languages
Preferably experience with CMake or similar project build environment
Experience with Linux is a plus
Strong continuous improvement mindset
Talented people with a passion for software architecture, designs and implementation of software systems
Proactive and adaptable attitude
Testing mindset




What will you be doing?

As part of this team, you will participate in the development of UI software for Sky’s Glass TV which is used by millions of customers every day. The team’s mission is to optimise engineering practices through continuous innovation with new tools, processes and frameworks.




Your key responsibilities will be:

Analysing and improving existing workflows
Over time contribute to customer facing UI features
Sharing knowledge and good programming habits




We offer more than just a job

At Sky Labs you can look forward to meeting high professionalism. But also, plenty of space to learn more and get lots of support from your colleagues. Learning and development means a lot to us, which is why we also hold development weeks several times a year and look for curious and open minded people for our teams.




We offer a competitive salary package taking your skills and qualifications into consideration and we offer flexible working hours and numerous employee benefits. We are international, and therefore have colleagues from all around the world, but our experience and age is also very diverse, which means we have colleagues who have been around for more than 20 years, as well as newly educated engineers.




We believe in better. Better products, better service, and better value. Which is why we are constantly reinventing, to meet the needs of our millions of customers worldwide – Do you want to join the team?

Show more

Title: Senior Backend Developer (Python) - Remote
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Game Analytics

GameAnalytics is a leading analytics tool for anyone building a mobile game. Our platform helps everyone in the industry, from indie developers, to growing games studios, to global publishers. Our network includes more than 100k games, which are played by north of 2 billion people each month. That's more than ⅓ of the world's mobile gamers. What's our mission? To help game developers make the right decisions based on data. And by joining our team, you'll be working on new and innovative products to help tens of thousands of people in the industry do just that.

About The Team

You will join our backend API development team as a remote member outside of Denmark, where our head office is based. Together you'll be working on some of our most critical APIs handling authentication, authorisation and the business logic for all our users, studios & games, providing the backbone that powers our web application. We work using a modern development stack (Python 3, MySQL, Terraform, ECS/Fargate), use cloud technologies (AWS, GCP) and we value simplicity, code quality, automation; with the aim of iterating fast and delivering value. We have major new product offerings in development and the team will be involved in all areas of planning, designing and development.

What we are looking for


As an experienced developer you will be a key contributor involved in planning, designing and developing current and new product offerings
Making sure we build the right thing at the right time. We value the ability to make reasonable and informed decisions with minimal supervision
Be able to take ownership (together with the other team members) of several APIs (currently based on Python), our main user management database or any future production critical systems
Managing AWS resources and deployment procedures in collaboration with our other engineering teams
Keeping code quality high using code reviews (pull requests) and documented coding standards
Ability to collaborate and communicate well with other teams, including product and support
Understanding of business processes and data governance implications, when working with customer accounts
Train, coach and support hiring of team members



Requirements


Essential:


Excellent understanding of Python OR an excellent understanding of another backend related language (Java, Erlang, Elixir, Golang, Ruby...) AND some Python experience
Excellent understanding of API development; including best practices, industry standards, performance implications..
3+ years of experience building and managing production systems
Experience with SQL and RDBMS concepts, using these on large projects, preferably using MySQL or PostgreSQL
Ability to write high quality and maintainable code, only embracing complexity when truly needed. Approach coding so that others can read and work with your code
Experience with modern development life cycle, including automated testing and deployment
Excellent communication and team collaboration skills
Experience with developing software in a cloud environment, preferably in AWS



Desirable:


A degree in computer science or equivalent
Good knowledge of FastAPI, Flask or other Python API frameworks
Knowledge of SQLAlchemy or other ORM frameworks
Experience with infrastructure-as-code systems (Terraform, Ansible, etc.)
Experience with containerized applications (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS/Fargate or similar)
Comfortable working in a Linux environment
Experience with, or interest in, other programming languages besides Python
Experience with authentication/authorization protocols, such as OAuth2
An interest in project management and software development methodologies
Passion in videogames and the industry



Benefits


Working flexibility
(When in office) Food, snacks and drinks
25 Days paid holiday (excluding bank holiday)
Year-end office closure (paid holiday downtime between Christmas and New Year's)
Company sickness leave
Carers' leave
Additional compassionate leave
"Work-from-Anywhere" Scheme (15 days per year)
Learning budgets
Monthly social nights
Expense phone bill
Show more

  • Be able to take ownership (together with the other team members) of several APIs (currently based on Python), our main user management database or any future production critical systems
  • Managing AWS resources and deployment procedures in collaboration with our other engineering teams
  • Keeping code quality high using code reviews (pull requests) and documented coding standards
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate well with other teams, including product and support
  • Understanding of business processes and data governance implications, when working with customer accounts
  • Train, coach and support hiring of team members


Requirements


Essential:

  • Excellent understanding of Python OR an excellent understanding of another backend related language (Java, Erlang, Elixir, Golang, Ruby...) AND some Python experience
  • Excellent understanding of API development; including best practices, industry standards, performance implications..
  • 3+ years of experience building and managing production systems
  • Experience with SQL and RDBMS concepts, using these on large projects, preferably using MySQL or PostgreSQL
  • Ability to write high quality and maintainable code, only embracing complexity when truly needed. Approach coding so that others can read and work with your code
  • Experience with modern development life cycle, including automated testing and deployment
  • Excellent communication and team collaboration skills
  • Experience with developing software in a cloud environment, preferably in AWS


Desirable:

  • A degree in computer science or equivalent
  • Good knowledge of FastAPI, Flask or other Python API frameworks
  • Knowledge of SQLAlchemy or other ORM frameworks
  • Experience with infrastructure-as-code systems (Terraform, Ansible, etc.)
  • Experience with containerized applications (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS/Fargate or similar)
  • Comfortable working in a Linux environment
  • Experience with, or interest in, other programming languages besides Python
  • Experience with authentication/authorization protocols, such as OAuth2
  • An interest in project management and software development methodologies
  • Passion in videogames and the industry


Benefits

  • Working flexibility
  • (When in office) Food, snacks and drinks
  • 25 Days paid holiday (excluding bank holiday)
  • Year-end office closure (paid holiday downtime between Christmas and New Year's)
  • Company sickness leave
  • Carers' leave
  • Additional compassionate leave
  • "Work-from-Anywhere" Scheme (15 days per year)
  • Learning budgets
  • Monthly social nights
  • Expense phone bill

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
I'm currently working with a well-known software business in Aarhus, as they look to add an experienced backend developer/SRE to their team.




They own a platform that transforms traditional content into interactive digital experiences, enhancing engagement and accessibility, make creating a catalogue a lot easier.




They have recently released a new platform which means a lot of new projects to work on.







The role:




They are looking for a backend developer/SRE with:

2 years’ experience with .Net and C#
DevOps experience







This role will also evolve into a mix of a backend and SRE, so I am looking for someone that is open and interested in this.




The whole engineering team is currently made up of 20 experienced engineers, with a mix of front end and back end. You will be joining a team of 4 others.




This is a hybrid role, 2-3 days a week in the office.




The package on offer is up to 50,000 DKK per month plus pension, 30 days of vacation per year, hybrid working.




Would you be open to discussing the role with me?

Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
Description:
Are you a top-motivated Software Developer looking for your next big challenge? Do you have a passion for innovation and a drive to contribute to mission-critical communications solutions? At Chora, we continue to successfully serve our market, and we are therefore strengthening our team in Aarhus.




YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

In this position, you will contribute to the development of our mission critical communication equipment used by e.g. the electronic warfare sector.

You will work with full-stack development, primarily using C++
You will play a crucial role in developing new innovative Chora solutions for our customers
You will contribute to optimization, expansion and maintenance of existing products and features
You will be part of one of our agile Scrum teams with a high degree of autonomy and responsibility




YOUR PROFILE

You have a minimum of 3 years of experience as C++ software developer, preferably more
You have a Bachelor or a Master’s degree in computer science or similar
You have strong coding skills in C++ and preferably C#
Familiarity with Git and Jenkins, as well as code review tools like Gitea, is a plus
Experience with object-oriented design and design patterns is a plus
You have the ability to overview and understand the entire system design
You take ownership of your tasks and responsibilities, just as you thrive on working independently
You also enjoy working closely with your colleagues within an agile Scrum team setup

You live within commuting distance of Aarhus, and you speak and write Danish and English at professional level. You have a clean criminal record and you are a Danish citizen or you have lived in Denmark for at least the last 7 years.




CHORA AS A WORKPLACE

Chora is a small corporation with room for differences. At Chora everyone knows everybody, and as an employee you have the opportunity to influence how work is done. We are a dedicated team with the ambitions of being the most respected corporation within our field. At Chora we offer:

Variation in assignments
A dynamic atmosphere with an informal tone
Good stable working conditions
An exciting niche market with unique products
Pension scheme
Salary according to qualifications and an attractive Bonus scheme.
Great colleagues, influence on your own work, and focus on quality
Staff association, Summer party, Christmas party
Health Insurance
Delicious lunch every day, free fruit, coffee, tea, and water




ABOUT CHORA

Chora is an international corporation with headquarters in Aarhus and a subsidiary in Munich, Germany. Chora cooperates with acknowledged corporations all over the world. Chora was founded in 1994, and since then we have developed and sold high-tech communication solutions. We sell our products to the B2B and B2G market. Our customer segment is quite different, as we work within a fascinating and interesting niche-market. Chora is a healthy business with sound ownership and an international perspective not to mention strong core values.

If you have any questions or need more information, you are welcome to contact us at tel: +45 86 18 99 55. We look forward to receiving your application and CV at job@chora.com

We review applications continuously, and we treat your information discretely.

Title: Dallas Software Engineer
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join our Team

About This Opportunity

We are now looking for a Dallas System Verification Engineer to maintain our Packet Core Load Test Tool in high quality standard.

We adapt to Lean and Agile ways of working. We organize in multi-functional development teams in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work.

What you will do


Secure the Packet Core Load Test Tools' release on time with system test regression testing
Perform End-to-end testing: test analysis, test case/ tool/ script design and test case execution and result reporting
Troubleshooting and Trouble Report writing.
Support for internal users via Service Desk ticket.
Maintain the Continuous Integration Toolkit in good shape.
Drive the improvements on test efficiency and effective.
Support channel for external users globally and take the comments back to improve our Test Tool or organization.


You will bring


Master or Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Telecommunication, Information Technology, Electronics or equivalent formal education
Min 3 years of working experience of 3GPP and TCP/IP
Solid knowledge in 2G/3G/4G/5G Packet Core system architecture
Good knowledge in Linux or Unix (Solaris)
Result oriented, flexible and innovative.
Learning new technology quickly and apply to work tasks.
Willing to accept challenges
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, and able to express own thinking clearly
Be initiative and accountable
Good communication and collaboration skills


Nice to have:


Basic programming experience in Python
Basic integration knowledge of cloud native and Kubernetes


Role requires relocation to Krakow, Poland

Why join Ericsson?

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

What happens once you apply?

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Ericsson uses a merit-based hiring approach that values people with different experiences, perspectives and skillsets. We truly believe this approach drives innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action (Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities) employer, learn more.

If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com.

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

Primary country and city: Poland (PL) || Krakow

Job details: Developer

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Engineer og Azure udvikler




Har du evnen og interessen for at prøve kræfter med udvikling af komplekse Azure cloud-løsninger? cVation søger erfarne software udviklere til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og udviklerglæde er i højsæde.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloud-løsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development, og er på forkant med mange af de nye teknologier, herunder IoT. Vi sætter desuden en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet.

Hvilken rolle får du?




Du vil blive en del af et team, der designer og udvikler avancerede cloud-løsninger på MS Azure. Din rolle bliver bl.a. at rådgive om valg af Azure services, implementere og vedligeholde værktøjer, der sikrer continuous integration og continuous delivery og understøtter applikationsudviklingen. Vi har en meget høj release-frekvens i vores projekter, da brugen af vores egenudviklede tool CADD resulterer i ekstremt agile IT-projekter.




Udviklerne i cVation er samlet i teams på 5-8 udviklere. Du vil have fuldt fokus på et projekt/team af gangen. Ud over de hyppige releases til produktion har vi en ekstrem høj grad af automatisering af alt fra unit tests til integrationstests og UI-tests. Det betyder, at de repetitive processer er fjernet, så der er luft til at tænke innovativt, hvilket kommer vores kunder til gode. Kort sagt får de hurtigere udviklede løsninger af højere kvalitet og med en større forretningsmæssig værdi – og du får mulighed for faglig fordybelse og udvikle dig indenfor de nyeste teknologier.




Vi har også etableret et CCoE (Cloud Center of Excellence), som løbende vurderer nye cloud services og opdaterer værktøjskassen med relevante opdateringer. CCoE arbejder tæt sammen med de enkelte udviklingsteams, som har fingeren på pulsen ude på kundeprojekterne.

Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Erfaring med cloud udvikling og særligt PaaS services fra MS Azure, vil være en klar fordel.

Kandidat i softwareudvikling
Du er erfaren i C#, og at du går op i kodekvalitet og at skrive testbar kode
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure med hovedfokus på PaaS
Du har erfaring med at arbejde med automatisering af byg og test af applikationer
Du har erfaring med softwareudvikling og gerne webudvikling
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du har arbejdet med automatisering af test, build og release pipelines samt Infrastructure as code
Du er vant til at arbejde med versionskontrol, gerne Git
Du taler/skriver flydende dansk, og taler/skriver engelsk på et medium/højt niveau.

Som person er du ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og resultatorienteret. Du gør dig umage med dine opgaver og trives med at løfte i flok som del af et team. Hvis du også er engageret, nysgerrig, drevet af at lære nyt og sætter en ære i at dygtiggøre dig passer du perfekt ind hos os. Du må også gerne gå op i at forbedre både kode, værktøjer samt processer.

Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, forbedre og udvikle cVation.

Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig. Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag.

Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
The role

As a software engineer at PSQR you will become a part of a highly skilled team. PSQR favour above all the relevancy of technical solutions coming from the team: the hierarchy is flat, and the process of decision making is collaborative – we strive towards choosing good solutions no matter who came up with them.




We are a diverse team of international employees working together at our head office located in the city centre of Copenhagen.




Your profile

We are looking for a candidate with an innovative and solution-oriented approach who can think creatively in complex situations. You are a team player who naturally collaborates across various disciplines and thrives on achieving results together with your colleagues.




Succeeding in a position at PSQR isn’t about a specific set of tools or a fixed process. Instead, it’s your mindset, dedication, and ability to see opportunities rather than limitations that will be key to your success.




You have solid experience with Java development and knowledge with some of the tech stacks mentioned below:

Java
React
Linux
Docker
Cassandra/ScyllaDB
MySQL/MariaDB
RabbitMQ
ElasticSearch
ZooKeeper




Your task and responsibilities:

Develop and maintain backend systems: build, optimise, and maintain backend services for secure supply chain traceability, ensuring scalability and performance
Integrate external systems: Integrate into APIs for external systems, or develop supplemental APIs in the solution for external systems to connect, to secure data-sharing protocols to maintain data integrity and enhance traceability
Extend front-end and mobile components: Extend the web UI or mobile application with additional functionality to serve the needs of the customers
Debug, test, and optimise codebase: identify and resolve software bugs, write tests to ensure code accuracy, and optimise performance
Enhance system security: conduct security audits, manage vulnerabilities, and implement best practices to maintain a secure platform
These are the core tasks that emphasise PSQR’s focus on secure, reliable, and collaborative software development







PSQR is offering

A diverse team of international employees, representing 13 different nationalities, working together at our head office in the city centre of Copenhagen.

A flat organisation, promoting open communication. The employees are empowered to contribute directly, focusing on collaboration and results over titles. This structure creates an agile, dynamic workplace where everyone’s input is valued.

They foster a relaxed, open environment for creativity and open communication, while maintaining high standards in delivering quality work




Application and contact

Randstad manages the recruitment process on behalf of the company. If the position has caught your interest, please apply for the role through this site.




For more detailed information regarding this position, please contact Chief Consultant Kasper Kjærgaard on +45 61 95 92 51. All inquiries will be handled confidentially.




About PSQR

PSQR is a Danish software development company that specialises in providing highly scalable software for storing, processing, and analysing vast amounts of traceability data to industry- as well as government customers. The software is modular and extensible which allows PSQR and our software integration partners to bring it into play for any product vertical all the way from raw materials, through processing, to finished goods, and finally recycling – establishing the complete traceability circle.




About Randstad

Randstad is the world’s largest talent company and a partner of choice to clients. As a Partner for Talent, we are committed to providing equitable opportunities to people from all backgrounds and helping them remain relevant in the rapidly changing world of work.




We have a deep understanding of the labour market and help our clients to create the high-quality, diverse and agile workforces they need to succeed. We support people to realise their true potential throughout their entire working life. This is what we do and what motivates us every day.




Randstad DK is part of the international Randstad Group. Every day, we help more than 600,000 people around the world find jobs. We specialise in finding, attracting, and retaining skilled talent to power businesses at speed and at scale. Randstad DK is a leader in this field, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, Aalborg, and Kolding.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning developer with DSP experience (Python/C++)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in Signal Processing and Machine Learning? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team!

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, and the Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, fusing the radar signal with information from video feeds and other sensors.

You will play a significant role in the development of our world-leading, proprietary golf and baseball sensor technology, which is now also being applied in football and many other sports. You will have the opportunity to do your own research and development work, and to see the direct impact of it.

In the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team we seek to expand the use of machine learning and you will play a significant role in including neural networks in our tracking software.

Responsibilities:


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis.
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions.
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team.
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.


Requirements


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Machine learning and neural networks
Digital Signal Processing (DSP)


Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills


Responsibilities


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments


We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

We offer:


Highly skilled colleagues
Career growth inside trackman
International environment with more than 35 nationalities in our HQ
Working with the leading golf technology brand in the industry
Social activities


Are you our new colleague?

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

In the radar tracking & signal processing team we value teamwork and openness. Therefore, we expect you to enjoy working with other highly motivated colleagues and help provide a good working environment. We do not expect that you can be an expert on every aspect of being a developer, but rather strive to improve and learn together with the team.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology.

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud of working in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our new headquarter located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, Seoul and Tokyo.  We employ more than 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where all hardware and most software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At TrackMan, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of the exceptional solution. This mix is what makes TrackMan an inspiring company – for our customers and our colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application including and your diploma as soon as possible to join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow. Working place for this position is at Trackman Innovation Center in Hørsholm, our new HQ building. Contact Troels Bastholm at troels@trackman.recruitee.com for further information.

Apply now
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Rust) - AI Tutor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Rust
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: App & web developer
Description:
Brænder du for native og webudvikling? Som softwareudvikler i Native Tech-teamet kommer du helt tæt på udviklingen af Bankdatas mobil- og netbank – med ansvar for centrale komponenter som login og signering. Her arbejder du med en kompleks hybrid-løsning, hvor kvalitet, samarbejde og de nyeste teknologier går hånd i hånd.

Din mission: Byg sikker og moderne mobilbank

Bankdatas mobil- og netbank er blandt de mest brugte finansielle apps i Danmark – og det stiller høje krav til både sikkerhed, stabilitet og brugervenlighed. I rollen som softwareudvikler bliver du medansvarlig for at videreudvikle de komponenter, der binder hele løsningen sammen: login, signering og andre kritiske sikkerhedsfunktioner.

Du kommer til at arbejde i grænselandet mellem native mobiludvikling og web, hvor du bygger videre på vores hybride platform. Her har du mulighed for både at dykke teknisk dybt og tænke på tværs – så vi sikrer, at mobilbanken ikke bare fungerer, men opleves gnidningsfri, moderne og tryg at bruge for slutbrugeren.

Teamet består af 5 udvikler og én PO. Vi er et tæt og erfarent team med højt til loftet, masser af sparring og frihed til at eksperimentere med ny teknologi – for vi har ambitioner om at sætte standarden for digital bankoplevelse.

Din rolle: Udvikl kernefunktioner i en af Danmarks mest brugte apps

Som softwareudvikler i Native Tech kommer du til at:


Udvikle og vedligeholde centrale komponenter i mobil- og netbanken – fx login og signering
Arbejde i krydsfeltet mellem native og web – med Angular, Capacitor, Android og iOS
Bidrage aktivt til teamets DevOps-setup og vores teknologiske retning
Tage ansvar for løsninger med høj kvalitet og sikkerhed
Være med til at sætte retning og udvikle teamets arbejdsformer



Din profil – Faglighed, nysgerrighed og lyst til at lære

Vi forestiller os, at du har en baggrund som datalog eller ingeniør – og vigtigst: at du er nysgerrig, lærevillig og teamorienteret.

Du har:


Erfaring med Android og/eller iOS udvikling – eller lyst til at dykke ned i det
Erfaring med Angular eller andet SPA-framework
Interesse for DevOps og at arbejde med drift og udvikling i samme team
Et øje for kvalitet og evnen til at tænke i helheder
Lyst til at tage ansvar og bidrage aktivt til teamet



Hvad tilbyder vi?


Opgaver med direkte indflydelse på brugeroplevelsen i mobil- og netbank
Et erfarent og fagligt stærkt team med høj trivsel og samarbejde
Udviklingsmuligheder gennem kurser, guilds og løbende sparring



Er du klar til at tage udfordringen op?

Send os dit CV allerede i dag via nedenstående link. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt – vi indkalder løbende til samtaler. Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Nikolas Bram, leder for Team Native Tech, på nbm@bankdata.dk eller +45 24770158.

Velkommen til Bankdata

Bankdata bygger software til finanssektoren. Vi er næsten 1000 kolleger på holdet, og vi udvikler digitale produkter, platforme og infrastruktur, som ca. hver tredje dansker, 200.000 virksomheder og flere tusinde bankansatte bruger hver dag.

Vi tror på struktureret personlig udvikling, et stærkt kollegialt fællesskab og at ambitiøse medarbejdere med fleksible og bæredygtige arbejdsliv præsterer bedre. Bliv klogere på arbejdslivet i Bankdata her.

Hos Bankdata arbejder vi aktivt med at fremme mangfoldighed og diversitet blandt vores medarbejdere, og vi opfordrer derfor alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder og kulturel baggrund til at søge job hos os.

Bankdata er en af Danmarks vigtigste teknologivirksomheder. Vi går på arbejde for at finde teknologiske svar på finanssektorens forretningsproblemer. For at udvikle og bygge fremtidens digitale bank.
Show more

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Picture yourself in our Vision Lab, testing a prototype that paves the way for automating quality control for a leading Danish industrial client. You will work closely with colleagues who share your passion for vision technology, and your ideas will become reality—from the initial sketch to the final, customised solution implemented in industry. Does that sound like something for you?




Turning Ideas into Reality – From Lab to Industry

As part of the Robot Technology Centre at Danish Technological Institute, you will create value for our clients by developing innovative solutions to complex problems in vision-guided robot control and industrial process and quality inspection. You will collaborate across industries and with both research institutions and technology/system suppliers. You will participate in research and development projects with leading European partners and continuously transform new knowledge into tangible results for our clients.




Your Day-to-Day

You will be involved throughout the entire process—from selecting sensors and working with 2D, 3D, and hyperspectral camera technologies, to developing rule-based and AI-driven algorithms, conducting laboratory experiments, and implementing solutions at customer sites.




What you can expect in this role:

Translating complex challenges into innovative solutions through close collaboration with colleagues and customers.
Participating in the entire development cycle: from idea generation, solution design, and building prototypes in the lab to delivering industry-ready solutions.
Developing and optimizing AI models for image processing, focusing on automated inspection and quality control.
Working in an environment that fosters both personal and professional growth through challenging projects, sharing knowledge with skilled colleagues, and access to our laboratory facilities where you can experiment, test, and develop vision solutions.




Shape the Future of Vision Technology

Your specific responsibilities will depend on your background and experience, and may include:

Development of industrial computer vision solutions, such as automated quality control, inspection, or vision-guided robot control.
End-to-end process development: solution design, selection of lighting and camera technology, building test setups, designing and developing both rule-based and AI-based vision algorithms, software development, and implementation at the client’s site.
Training and optimizing AI models for image processing, with a focus on high performance and robustness.
Participating in national and international research and development projects, and staying up to date with new technologies and methods.




We Are Looking for Someone Who:

Can translate their knowledge of computer vision and image processing into practical solutions—from image acquisition and processing to implementation in industrial systems.
Has experience with algorithm development, both rule-based machine vision methods and AI/deep learning for image analysis.
Possesses a strong technical background—perhaps with a master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or similar—and is eager to use their knowledge to create real-world results together with the team.

As many of our customers are Danish, we expect you to be open to learning Danish. We will provide the language lessons as part of the job.




Join Danish Technological Institute

You will be part of the Robotics and Automation Centre, where dedicated colleagues with broad and deep expertise develop and implement new technologies in both existing and new products, particularly for the manufacturing and production industry. We are one of Europe’s leading robotics innovators and a respected, in-demand research partner in national and international R&D projects. See examples of our work here.




Are You Our New Colleague?

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Vice Director Jacob Kortbek at +45 72 20 11 52. Application materials may be submitted in either Danish or English.




We are conducting interviews on an ongoing basis. Please send your application as soon as possible and no later than June 5, 2025.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer med interesse for AI og Large Language Models til Nykredits AI Center of Excellence
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring datainfrastruktur, og vil du være med til at forme fremtidens AI-løsninger i stor skala? Har du solid erfaring med data pipelines, cloud-teknologier og DevOps-principper? Og er du nysgerrig på at arbejde tæt sammen med et team, der udvikler og anvender Large Language Models (LLM) i en finansiel kontekst? Så er du måske vores nye Data Engineer i Nykredits AI Center of Excellence.

Hos Nykredit arbejder vi målrettet på at udnytte de nyeste AI- og Machine Learning-teknologier til at skabe reel forretningsværdi. Vores AI Center of Excellence er et tværfagligt team, der udvikler, operationaliserer og driver avancerede AI-løsninger. Som Data Engineer bliver du en nøglespiller i at sikre, at data-infrastrukturen og vores ML/AI-løsninger er skalerbare, robuste og klar til produktion.

Din rolle

Som Data Engineer hos Nykredit kommer du til at arbejde med at designe og opbygge den datainfrastruktur, der understøtter vores AI- og LLM-initiativer. Du vil bl.a.:


udvikle og vedligeholde pipelines til brug i ML- og analyseprojekter
implementere og optimere batch- og streaming-pipelines
bidrage til at automatisere data workflows gennem CI/CD, containerisering og Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
arbejde med moderne teknologier som Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Spark og eventuelt Kafka
samarbejde tæt med Data Scientists og softwareudviklere for at sikre en smidig overgang fra data til modeller i produktion.



Hvem er du?


Du har solid erfaring med data engineering, herunder udvikling og drift af dataplatforme og pipelines.
Du har erfaring med cloud-baserede løsninger, gerne i Azure-miljøer.
Du har kendskab til data governance, sikkerhed og compliance – særligt i regulerede miljøer som den finansielle sektor.
Du har erfaring med CI/CD, Docker og gerne Kubernetes i forbindelse med dataprojekter.
Du trives i agile teams og kan både samarbejde tæt og arbejde selvstændigt.
Du kommunikerer ubesværet på både dansk og engelsk.



Hvad tilbyder vi?


En vigtig rolle i et strategisk fokusområde med høj ledelsesopbakning.
Mulighed for at arbejde med data, der direkte bidrager til udviklingen af moderne AI-løsninger.
Et inspirerende arbejdsmiljø med fokus på vidensdeling, innovation og samarbejde.
Fleksible arbejdsforhold med mulighed for hjemmearbejde og en sund work-life balance.
Konkurrencedygtige vilkår, pensionsordning og sundhedsforsikring.



Vil du vide mere?

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen eller Nykredit som arbejdsplads, er du velkommen til at kontakte Technology Lead, Lasse Daniel Sander Jensen på tlf. 52 17 25 28. Har du spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, kan du kontakte rekrutteringsteamet på nytjob@nykredit.dk.

Hvis du er klar til at tage næste skridt i din karriere og blive en del af Nykredits AI Center of Excellence, så ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning.
Show more

Title: Student Worker - Backend development
Description:
Are you passionate about technology and eager to apply your knowledge from your studies to make a tangible impact? Are you ready to contribute to innovative projects and improve the user experience across our platforms?

This is your chance to join our Supplier Tech team as our new Student Worker! Take your first steps in the professional world and gain valuable insights into working with backend development in a dynamic environment.

YOUR TEAM

Join our dedicated team of tech enthusiasts based in Aarhus. We work in an agile environment, embracing change and striving for the best possible outcomes. Our team consists of an architect, a product owner, analysts & scrum master, back-end and front-end developers and a digital product designer. You'll have the opportunity to collaborate closely with our backend developers and the rest of our dedicated team, ensuring you're never alone. We value being social and hold socializing events often to foster team spirit and collaboration.

YOUR ROLE

You'll have the opportunity to enhance and improve some of the key business-critical IT systems used for our garment suppliers. We offer plenty of room for growth, both personally and professionally, and a chance to get hands-on experience working with some of the latest technologies to generate real-life value for many end-users throughout the organization. You get the chance to take ownership of your tasks and help drive our projects forward.

Your responsibilities will include:


Developing features and fix bugs in our backend. Our tech stack comprises Java 8 or higher, Spring Boot, REST and SQL
Working with Github, Kubernetes, Docker and CI/CD tools
Maintaining and improving the quality of our codebase through the implementation of software development best practices.
Bringing new perspectives and ideas on how to streamline and improve our codebase and workflow.


If you are curious and interested in learning about the rest of our stack, it’s definitely a plus - but not a requirement.

You will be based in Aarhus with the option to work from home. The estimated workload is 10-16 hours weekly and you’ll have the flexibility to plan your own time.

Your Benefits

We believe in growing stronger together. By joining us, you'll have the opportunity to enhance your skills, gain valuable experience in tech, create software that makes a difference for the users, and explore your own abilities and interests while doing so. We foster a supportive culture where everyone helps each other, so if you need assistance, it's always available. You'll have a lot of responsibility and opportunities to learn and grow.

YOUR PROFILE

Your primary role will be to turn features into code and fix bugs as they arise. We are looking for someone who takes great pride in software development as a craft, aspires to write code that is easy to work with, and is informed by best practices while recognizing that nothing is ever black and white. You'll have the opportunity to put your theoretical knowledge about professional software development into practice and apply it to exciting and demanding challenges that allow you to grow and make a real difference for our end users throughout the organization.

We are looking for a proactive and curious student worker to become part of our back-end team: If you're someone who isn't afraid to challenge existing processes and question the status quo, you'll fit right in!

We are especially looking for someone who:


Are enrolled in a relevant field of study, such as Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT-product Development or similar.
Have experience with or a desire to learn Java 8 or higher, Spring Boot, REST and SQL.
Are proactive, curious, and eager to learn and grow, and take pride in developing resilient, stable, and well-written software that is highly maintainable and a joy to work with.
Are a team player and not afraid to ask questions.
Fluency in English, both spoken and written.


Curious for more?

Get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH follow this link and be sure to visit us on us on LinkedIn.

We look forward to hearing from you!

If you have any questions, please contact Magnus Bach on +4530853154. Otherwise, send us your CV and application as soon as possible or no later than May 28 2025. We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the ad when we have found the right candidate. We expect to conduct interviews in week 22-23.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more
