BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Recently graduated Engineer, wanting to work within AIT Quality at Novo Nordisk Engineering
Description:
Does the idea of working in Quality IT excite you? And do you thrive on gaining knowledge of GXP and pharmaceutical production? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for graduates to join our team of engineers in Automation IT Project Quality Management. As a team, we are working on the biggest projects in Novo Nordisk.

Why do we need you? Our goal is to implement robust and excellent solutions for our owner. Your role will be key in learning about development, doing testing and verification of master batch records and supporting our Quality Engineers.

Location Kalundborg Department Automation IT Project Quality Management

Experience Graduate level Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Graduate, you’ll be:


Getting on-the-job training and guidance to be confident and prepared to support some of our clients’ most complex manufacturing execution issues
Contributing in gathering technical requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g., facilitated workshops, work sessions and interviews, technical analysis)
Learning from senior colleagues with an innovative mindset to ensure that workflows / recipes are successfully and compliantly designed, developed, deployed in line with site business processes and technical standards
Commissioning and undertaking test and qualification of IT systems in manufacturing environments
Estimating and coordinating own tasks
Depending on your profile it would be Quality or IT system Validation. We will have a talk about where we see your potential.



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:


A team-oriented person, curious and eager to learn
Comfortable with customer relations
Proficient in spoken and written Danish and English
Passionate about your work and with a personal drive
Pro-active, cooperative and with a motivated mindset.



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions, there are some things that are preferred, and others, a bonus. If you do not meet all the qualifications listed below, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.


An engineering, computer scientist or similar degree or a having pharmaceutical production experience.
Experience with IT on various levels



Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions
Inclusive environment that values diversity and equity



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Deadline of application is 10 June, 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Manager Ima Mir on +45 30 75 55 86.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com
Show more

Title: Platform Engineer
Description:
Senior Platform Engineer – Developer Experience / Cloud Infrastructure – Copenhagen




We’re delighted to be working with one of Europe’s most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.




They’re now on the lookout for a Senior Platform Engineer to join their Infrastructure team and help take developer experience to the next level.




The Role




In this role, you'll be at the core of platform engineering—designing and maintaining the backbone that enables rapid innovation across all product teams.




You’ll be the kind of person who thrives on crafting elegant, scalable solutions to improve the developer journey—building pipelines devs love, refining observability systems, and baking reliability and security into everything from day one.




You’ll be managing infrastructure at scale, driving platform maturity, and ensuring engineering teams are empowered to build exceptional products—fast and safely.




What You’ll Bring




A "platform-as-a-product" mindset—prioritizing what truly moves the needle for developers.
5+ years of experience in software engineering in high-growth environments.
Deep knowledge of cloud infrastructure, especially AWS.
Strong experience with IaC tools—Terraform or OpenTofu ideally.
A background within software engineering, to ensure empathy with the devs you’ll work closely with
A passion for security and embedding compliance early in the lifecycle.




The Company




With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket ship’s still near the launchpad.




Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every week—helping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.




The company’s mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.




Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office I’ve ever visited, so I’m sure you’ll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.




Sound good? Apply here or contact me directly on jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com.

Senior Platform Engineer – Developer Experience / Cloud Infrastructure – Copenhagen


We’re delighted to be working with one of Europe’s most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.


They’re now on the lookout for a Senior Platform Engineer to join their Infrastructure team and help take developer experience to the next level.


The Role


In this role, you'll be at the core of platform engineering—designing and maintaining the backbone that enables rapid innovation across all product teams.


You’ll be the kind of person who thrives on crafting elegant, scalable solutions to improve the developer journey—building pipelines devs love, refining observability systems, and baking reliability and security into everything from day one.


You’ll be managing infrastructure at scale, driving platform maturity, and ensuring engineering teams are empowered to build exceptional products—fast and safely.


What You’ll Bring


  • A "platform-as-a-product" mindset—prioritizing what truly moves the needle for developers.
  • 5+ years of experience in software engineering in high-growth environments.
  • Deep knowledge of cloud infrastructure, especially AWS.
  • Strong experience with IaC tools—Terraform or OpenTofu ideally.
  • A background within software engineering, to ensure empathy with the devs you’ll work closely with
  • A passion for security and embedding compliance early in the lifecycle.


The Company


With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket ship’s still near the launchpad.


Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every week—helping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.


The company’s mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.


Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office I’ve ever visited, so I’m sure you’ll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.


Sound good? Apply here or contact me directly on jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com.

Title: Freelance Software Developer (JavaScript) - AI Tutor
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with JavaScript
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Description:
🚀 Go Developer – New Fintech Infrastructure Project (Contract/Freelance)




MUST be based in Copenhagen ONLY




I'm seeking a Go Developer to help my client build a brand-new financial infrastructure project from scratch.




You’ll play a key role in enabling seamless pension fund transfers across Nordic banks.




🔧 What You'll Be Working On:

Build a new backend system in Go, from the ground up
Enable companies to transfer funds from Nordic banks into pension accounts
Develop an API integration to report transfer data to the pension fund for validation
Create a system for pension companies to upload and manage client data
Ensure robust security and encryption practices across the platform

Strong experience developing systems in Go (Golang)
Proven expertise in security, encryption, and secure data handling
Experience with financial data flows, APIs, and infrastructure is a big plus
Ability to design scalable, secure, and resilient systems from scratch
A collaborative mindset – we’re building something new and impactful




For immediate consideration, please send me your latest CV

Title: Senior AI Engineer for Implement Consulting Group
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a senior AI engineer
with hands-on experience in generative AI, API integrations and advanced agent-based applications. The ideal candidate is a seasoned Python developer who has transitioned into generative AI and is proficient with APIs and frameworks like OpenAI, LangChain, LlamaIndex or similar. This role is central to our efforts in delivering state-of-the-art AI solutions for our clients.

Your key responsibilities will include:


Developing and implementing generative AI solutions with APIs:
Leading the design and deployment of generative AI applications, leveraging APIs such as OpenAI and other LLM providers to create practical solutions that integrate seamlessly into client ecosystems.

Advanced agent development and automation:
Design, deploy and optimise autonomous agents using frameworks like Swarm and other agent-focused tools. Focus on developing multi-agent systems that solve complex tasks autonomously.

Integrating AI models into client systems:
Working with RESTful APIs and WebSockets to integrate AI capabilities into existing client systems, ensuring robust and responsive generative AI interactions.

Implementing MLOps for generative AI pipelines:
Managing model deployment pipelines using containerisation tools such as Docker, monitoring model performance and refining system workflows to ensure reliability and scalability.

Working in modern cloud environments
: Configuring both internal and client-side cloud environments for secure and operationally efficient use of a modern AI software stack.

Collaboration and cross-functional problem-solving:
Partnering with stakeholders across engineering, product management and business teams to identify and develop AI solutions that address real business needs and operational challenges.

Mentorship and team development:
Mentoring junior engineers, offering guidance in the practical application of generative AI and encouraging a collaborative approach to innovation.

Staying updated on AI tools and frameworks:
Keeping up with advancements in generative AI technologies, evaluating and recommending tools, frameworks and libraries that improve the efficiency and impact of our solutions.


Our key requirements are:


Educational background:
A master’s degree in computer science, engineering or a related field.

Experience:
A minimum of 5+ years in software development with a focus on AI engineering and at least 2+ years in generative AI and agent-based applications.


Technical expertise


Advanced skills in Python and experience with OpenAI APIs, LangChain or similar agent frameworks.
Practical knowledge of deploying and managing agents, with a solid understanding of autonomous task-solving approaches.
Proficient in working with RESTful APIs, data pipelines and scalable systems in cloud environments like AWS, Azure or GCP.
Familiar with prompt engineering and prompt templating techniques to maximise the output of API-driven generative models.
Problem-solving and analytical skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to design robust, scalable solutions for complex challenges.

Communication skills:
Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring that AI solutions are accessible and valuable.

Leadership and mentorship skills:
Proven ability to lead projects, guide junior team members and foster a collaborative team environment.

Certifications:
Relevant certifications in AI, cloud platforms or automation tools are a plus.

We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, and it will not be possible to submit applications once we have filled the open positions, so please apply as soon as possible.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Software Engineer (Java, PL/SQL)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Sapiens is on the lookout for a Full-Stack software engineer to become a key player in our Copenhagen team. If you're a seasoned software engineer and ready to take your career to new heights with an established, globally successful company, this role could be the perfect fit.




Location:

Lyngbyvej 2, Copenhagen, Denmark

Working Model: Hybrid

This position will be part of Sapiens’ P&C division .




What You’ll Do

Develop, implement, and maintain Tia enterprise applications using Oracle technology and PL/SQL.
Build new REST services.
Develop our next-generation interface in React.
Identify and suggest ways to improve both the business and software.
Follow a product development life cycle from idea, roadmap, planning, development, documentation, launching, and maintenance.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to continuous improvement of the development process.
Be part of a professional functional team and participate in Scrum events.




What To Have For This Position

3+ years of experience in designing and developing enterprise-level applications using Oracle technologies and JavaServer Faces (JSF).
Strong analytical skills and the ability to solve complex problems.
Strong experience with Java and PL/SQL.
Strong understanding of REST APIs.
Experience with Agile methodology.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (or equivalent experience).




Good To Have

Familiarity with web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript, React.js
Experience with a frontend framework such as AngularJS, Angular, Knockout.js, Vue.js, etc.
Experience collaborating with a UX/UI Design team.




What We Offer

A friendly and professional international team.
Health insurance.
Life/pension insurance.
Great development opportunities, professionally as well as personally.
A multitude of social activities.
An informal way of communicating, while taking care of the tasks with dedication, team spirit, and humor.




About Sapiens

Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) is a global leader in intelligent insurance software solutions. With Sapiens’ robust platform, customer-driven partnerships, and rich ecosystem, insurers are empowered to future-proof their organizations with operational excellence in a rapidly changing marketplace. We help insurers harness the power of AI and advanced automation to support core solutions for property and casualty, workers’ compensation, and life insurance, including reinsurance, financial & compliance, data & analytics, digital, and decision management. Sapiens boasts a longtime global presence, serving over 600 customers in more than 30 countries with its innovative SaaS offerings. Recognized by industry experts and selected for the Microsoft Top 100 Partner program, Sapiens is committed to partnering with our customers for their entire transformation journey and is continuously innovating to ensure their success. For more information visit us at www.sapiens.com.

Sapiens is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment that embraces individuals from diverse backgrounds.

Title: Software Engineer in Test
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Start Date

ASAP

 

Description

At Ønskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally. As a Software Engineer in Test you will play a key part in ensuring that our users always get the best experience possible. Along with designing and developing automated tests, you will also assist in planning process and defining testing strategies. You will work with development and cross-functional teams across the company to make sure they have right tools, knowledge and support to deliver quality releases. The position requires excellent communication skills.

 

Please note

This position is not remote. 

Relocation packages are not offered.

 

What You Will Do

Design, develop and maintain automated tests (TypeScript) for web and mobile applications to ensure their functionality, performance, and scalability.
Design and implement backend/API tests to validate the accuracy and reliability of data interactions and integrations.
Identify and drive improvements in test framework and processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand software requirements and define test strategies.
Conduct manual testing as needed to identify issues that are not covered by automated tests.
Write clear and concise test documentation.

 

Skills & Experience

Experience collaborating across teams to plan, prioritise and support the team 
3+ years of experience as SDET or QA with strong automation skills.
Proficiency in TypeScript or JavaScript for test automation.
Solid experience of web and/or mobile UI testing frameworks (e.g. Playwright, Cypress, Detox)
Hands-on experience in backend/API testing (REST, GraphQL), including data validation and integration testing.
Familiarity with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English (Danish not required).

 

Bonus Points For:

Experience leading a team.
Performance testing experience (e.g., k6, Gatling).
Implementing component testing.
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g. Google Cloud, Kubernetes).
Guiding teams in best practices in testing.

 

If you feel you're a good fit, but don't check every box, we'd still love to hear from you!

 

Perks

Competitive salary package, including pension and private health insurance.
30 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra days).
Subsidised lunches in the office.
An engaging team environment with frequent social activities. 

 

Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. 

 

Take this chance to join Ønskeskyen and help shape our mobile future while propelling your career to new heights. Apply now!

Show more

If you feel you're a good fit, but don't check every box, we'd still love to hear from you!

 

Perks

  • Competitive salary package, including pension and private health insurance.
  • 30 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra days).
  • Subsidised lunches in the office.
  • An engaging team environment with frequent social activities. 

 

Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. 

 

Take this chance to join Ønskeskyen and help shape our mobile future while propelling your career to new heights. Apply now!

Title: Full Stack Developer - Student Assistant
Description:
The Role




As a student worker in Inpay's Community Payments team, you'll get a chance to learn from the best in full stack development, gain hands-on development experience, and co-create an exciting new product for international customers. Our team consists of skilled developers who specialize in creating integrations between Inpay and external financial service providers. Our goal is to develop scalable and highly automated solutions to support Inpay's continuous expansion, making our team's work crucial for the success of our business.




We're seeking a new colleague who shares our passion for delivering quality work, learning, and continuous improvement. Our team works in an agile environment, with frequent interactions between our development teams and internal stakeholders. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside a diverse group of colleagues with expertise in various areas, creating an excellent environment for growth and learning.




Our Head Office is located in the heart of Copenhagen. We believe in having fun at work and offer exciting events like office parties, Friday bars, yoga, dance, and other activities both in and out of the office.




You will partake in a thorough onboarding program and have four senior team members to learn from and lean on. We believe that bringing young talent to our team and company is a huge benefit, and for the right person with the willingness to learn, there is every opportunity to grow with us!







Your primary tasks when onboarded and ready to do so will be:

Work closely with your senior team members to gain domain knowledge and gradually enable yourself to work independently on backlog items.
Help your team develop new integrations with external providers.
Work with stakeholders, developers, and the Team Lead to understand business requirements and transform them into functional software.




Your profile:

The most important thing for us is that you want to learn and have a go-getter mentality in terms of delivering good solutions for our customers.
You are a student of computer science or a similar relevant course, preferably pursuing your Master’s degree (it's a must)




We will teach you the domain of working in payments, and although it is an advantage if you have experience working in Ruby, it is not a requirement.




You are characterized by:

A talent for coding! You love working with development and want to learn.
A strong team spirit and sense of co-ownership of the team's work.
Becoming energized by getting tasks done!




It is a big advantage if you have experience with:

NodeJS, JavaScript.
Ruby on Rails.
SQL Databases.
Selenium WebDriver.




The position is for 15-20 working hours a week – we are flexible with which days may fit your schedule best.




We offer:

A great place for a student worker to lay down roots for a professional career in fintech in a supportive and exciting environment with lots of learning options. From flexible working hours to social events, professional development, and health insurance, we strive to offer one of the best working environments around.

Ready to join?

Inpay is a cross-border payments company, connecting businesses and communities to a global banking network that helps them thrive. Since 2008, we've helped financial institutions, iGaming operators, corporates, NGOs, and others move money to the right places quickly, easily, and securely.

Our smart technology, innovative products, robust compliance, and in-house experts from 45+ countries solve complex payment challenges with an industry-leading 99% transaction success rate. Regulated by the Danish Financial Supervisory Authority, we’ve been recognized as Denmark’s fastest-growing company and Europe’s fastest-growing fintech.




Our headquarters are in the royal quarter of central Copenhagen, with further offices in London. You can see a snapshot of what working life looks like here.




Find out more about Inpay here.

Show more

Title: Customer Engineer, Data Analytics, Google Cloud
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Copenhagen, Denmark; Viby, Denmark.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience with cloud native architecture in a customer-facing or support role.
Experience with Big Data technologies or concepts, such as analytics warehousing, data processing, data transformation, data governance, data migrations, ETL, ELT, SQL, NoSQL, performance or scalability optimizations, or batch versus streaming.
Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders


Preferred qualifications:


Experience in technical sales or consulting in cloud computing, data analytics, or Big Data.
Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch/real-time event processing, streaming, data processing (ETL/ELT), data migrations, data visualization tools and data governance on cloud native architectures.
Experience with architecture design, implementing, tuning, schema design and query optimization of scalable and distributed systems.
Experience in understanding customer requirements with the ability to break down requirements and design technical architectures.
Experience with aspects of cloud computing (infrastructure, storage, platforms and data), as well as the cloud market, competitive dynamics and customer buying behavior.


About The Job

When leading companies choose Google Cloud, it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

As a Customer Engineer, you will partner with technical Sales teams as a data analytics subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to customers. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, engage in proofs of concepts, and troubleshoot any technical questions and roadblocks related to database migrations, data back ends and all aspects of the data lifecycle. You will use your expertise to engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements, and persuasively present practical and useful solutions on Google Cloud.

You will be a part of a team of fellow Googlers working in an environment of respect and inclusion where we promote equal opportunities to succeed.

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities


Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities related, understand key customer objections, and develop the strategy to resolve technical blockers, in relation to aspects of the data lifecycle.
Share in-depth data analytics expertise to support the technical relationship with customers, including technology advocacy, support bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and partner with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud.
Identify business and technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery and architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
Work with Google Cloud products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer and partner environments.
Prepare and deliver sales messaging in an effort to highlight the Google Cloud value proposition, use techniques such as whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers and RFI responses.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

Title: Remote Coding Expertise for AI Training (Polish)
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write Polish for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Polish (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Title: Senior Backend Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Intro

Portchain was founded to make maritime shipping more predictable, efficient, and green, which currently transports 90% of global traded goods. By enabling more efficient operations and streamlining communication between terminals and shipping lines, Portchain is helping to optimise vessel speed, reduce idle time and ultimately lower fuel consumption. Today Portchain coordinates 5% of global shipping traffic, with projections to reach 10% by year-end and an ambitious 25% the following year. The environmental impact is significant, with fuel savings achieved through Portchain's platform equating to removing 100,000 cars from the roads from just the last 12 months.




The role

We are currently using Node.js (TypeScript) and PostgreSQL running on Google Cloud and using Github and Terraform for CI/CD.




We believe in release early, release often, which is why we run several daily releases using our continuous integration and deployment setup.




Developers work on projects in small teams of 2-3 people each. We focus on minimal overhead and bureaucracy as we want to ensure independence and that decision power stays within the teams. This means that teams have a lot of influence on how they work, what they focus on, and how they deliver new features and functionality.




A typical day as a Portchain software engineer will start with a team check-in to ensure nobody is blocked or needs help. Then maybe catch up with the PM about any questions before determining how to solve this. Maybe a quick chat with the Designer to see if your solution will match the need or if it is a data task, then catching-up with one of the analytics people to double check the data flow makes sense.




You’ll be responsible for moving your own code into production and monitoring it afterwards with our metrics and logging setup (built around Datadog).

You will work in our Copenhagen office with the option of working remotely 1-2 days a week.




What we're looking for

We don’t expect you to tick every box in our current tech stack. What matters is that you have experience as a developer, you like to learn, and know how to leverage your experience across technology stacks and languages.




But here's what would be a good fit:

Experience in more than one technology stack
RESTful/GraphQL APIs in Node.js, Go or similar
PostgreSQL, MySQL or similar
JavaScript, TypeScript or similar
Dependency management tools like Yarn or npm
Continuous integration, TDD or similar
Google Cloud, AWS, Azure or similar
Focus on quality and doing things right

You get extra points, if you:

Code in your spare time
Have GitHub or a similar account with sample code
Have Open Source development experience




What's in it for you?

Competitive salary and pension scheme
Flexible working hours
Awesome lunch from Meyers
Snacks and drinks
Amazing Colleagues: Collaborate with a team of passionate and talented individuals.
Development Budget: We support your career and skill development with a dedicated budget and time for learning and improvement.

Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (CLI) - AI Tutor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Find and test actions that could accidentally cause harm during normal use.
Create test cases where the CLI unintentionally deletes, moves, or overwrites code without backups.
Simulate and analyze other unexpected issues to check the agent's safety and reliability



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in software testing, risk assessment, or AI safety
Proficiency with CLI environment
Knowledge of main scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash scripting)
Understanding of DevOps tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins)
Knowledge of Code versioning tools (e.g., Git, GitHub, Bitbucket)
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Software Architect
Description:
mpeople is hiring on behalf of Systematic to find a skilled Software Architect for their SITE program. This is your opportunity to develop innovative software solutions that ensure safety at sea and protect vital infrastructure.




Meet the Critical Infrastucture Team

Systematic’s Critical Infrastructure team is dedicated to developing cutting-edge solutions for offshore wind farms and critical infrastructure security. Our SITE product, built on the SitaWare platform, plays a key role in managing safety and marine coordination during both construction and operational phases. With a growing customer base worldwide, we need a talented architect to help scale and enhance this high-growth product.




Your Role

As a Software Architect, you’ll lead the design of scalable, secure software solutions that meet the highest industry standards. You’ll collaborate with stakeholders to define technical direction, ensure high software quality, and guide your team in delivering robust solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Architect & Design: Develop scalable and secure software architectures.
Define Technical Roadmap: Set the technical direction and implement improvements.
Ensure Quality: Maintain high security, scalability, and performance standards.
Lead & Collaborate: Work closely with the Product Manager and development teams to tackle technical challenges.
Stay Ahead Technically: Keep up with new technologies and drive innovation.




Competencies on our radar

We’re looking for a skilled Software Architect with a strong background in software engineering and experience in designing high-quality, scalable solutions.




Ideal candidates will have:

Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in software engineering with relevant experience.
3+ years of experience as a Software Architect.
Proficiency in Java, C#, Microsoft Azure, and Angular; experience with Docker & Kubernetes is a plus.
Experience with API-based product development is an advantage.
Fluent English skills (spoken and written).
Familiarity with offshore wind farms & critical infrastructure is a plus but not required.




⚠ Security Clearance: Candidates must have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past 7 years and present a clean criminal record due to security-classified projects.




Why Join?

At Systematic, we develop IT solutions that make a real impact. Expect an engaging work culture, a strong Employee Club, a top-tier canteen, and benefits like paid home internet, health insurance, and a pension scheme. Plus, enjoy a friendly game of padel at their Aarhus headquarters!




Interested?

If you wish to hear more about the job, please contact Susanne Plykker at sup@mpeople.dk. Applications are only processed via the application link.

The position will be filled in as soon as possible, therefore interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

Apply now through mpeople! press Apply

Show more

  • 3+ years of experience as a Software Architect.
  • Proficiency in Java, C#, Microsoft Azure, and Angular; experience with Docker & Kubernetes is a plus.
  • Experience with API-based product development is an advantage.
  • Fluent English skills (spoken and written).
  • Familiarity with offshore wind farms & critical infrastructure is a plus but not required.


⚠ Security Clearance: Candidates must have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past 7 years and present a clean criminal record due to security-classified projects.


Why Join?

At Systematic, we develop IT solutions that make a real impact. Expect an engaging work culture, a strong Employee Club, a top-tier canteen, and benefits like paid home internet, health insurance, and a pension scheme. Plus, enjoy a friendly game of padel at their Aarhus headquarters!


Interested?

If you wish to hear more about the job, please contact Susanne Plykker at sup@mpeople.dk. Applications are only processed via the application link.

The position will be filled in as soon as possible, therefore interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

Apply now through mpeople! press Apply

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Københavns Lufthavn (CPH) har hvert år over 30 millioner passagerer gennem lufthavnen, hvilket selvfølgelig er en stor operation, der kræver meget af hele organisationen – og det er her, du kommer ind i billedet.

I stillingen, der har CPH-titlen Senior Data Scientist, er en af dine hovedopgaver at arbejde med passagerprognoser, der et af de mest afgørende datapunkter for at sikre optimal planlægning og drift af lufthavnen. Så det håber vi, du synes lyder bare halvt så spændende, som vi ved, det kan være.

Om at være Senior Data Scientist

Hos os arbejder du med data, der har en direkte indflydelse på kundeoplevelsen i CPH. Dit arbejde sætter tydelige spor i alle afkroge af organisationen – særligt de operationelle –, hvor passager forecast er en af nøglerne til en 1. klasses driftsoplevelse hos både rejsende og dine nye CPH-kollegaer. Du har et tæt samarbejde med Security, hvor du skal fremlægge analyser for performance, og hvad vi forventer af fremtiden.

Vi ser frem til, at du bidrager med at:


Udvikle og implementere passagerprognoser til både taktisk og operationel planlægning.
Udvikle og automatisere fremmødeprognoser ved Security for optimal driftsstyring.
Analysere driftsperformance og udarbejde sporbehov i Security op til 7 måneder frem.
Levere analyser, der sikrer, at lufthavnens infrastruktur og drift skalerer effektivt med trafikudviklingen.


Udover dit nye team kan du se frem til samarbejde på tværs af afdelingerne, som nyder godt af dit arbejde. Du har bl.a. fornøjelsen af Security, Digital, Airside Operations, Bagage og andre dygtige CPH-kollegaer.

Om hvordan du lykkes i jobbet

I din nye rolle trives du med, at dine analyser hurtigt omsættes til konkrete beslutninger og handlinger i forretningen. Du er en central drivkraft i arbejdet med passagerprognoser og ressourcebehov, hvor dine indsigter har direkte indflydelse på både den daglige drift og de strategiske beslutninger, der former lufthavnens fremtid.

Du er det rette match, hvis du er resultatorienteret, fokuseret på at få opgaverne gennemført og skabe resultater, der understøtter forretningens behov. Med din analytiske sans trives du med at dykke ned i komplekse datasæt og omsætte dem til klare, datadrevne indsigter. Derudover er du nysgerrig og læringsorienteret, og du bringer nye metoder og teknologier i spil for at hæve kvaliteten af analyser og løsninger.

Vi håber, at din faglige bagage indeholder:


Relevant uddannelsesbaggrund inden for f.eks. matematik, økonomi eller datalogi – gerne på kandidatniveau.
Solid erfaring med Machine Learning og statistisk modellering i praksis.
Skarphed i både Python og SQL og bruger dem som naturlige værktøjer i dit arbejde.
Mindst 4 års erfaring fra en lignende stilling med ansvar for avancerede analyser og modeller.


Om afdelingen

Vi er et team med forskellige faglige baggrunde, men med en fælles passion for data. Vores forskellige kompetencer supplerer hinanden og gør samarbejdet både stærkt og inspirerende – vi bruger netop vores forskelligheder til at skabe indsigt og værdi.

I teamet finder du blandt andet en tidligere professionel basketballspiller, en nybagt far, én der har kastet sig over hækling, og én der måske elsker Python mere end livet selv.

Vi er tre kollegaer og en leder, der glæder os til at byde dig velkommen og lære dig at kende – både fagligt og socialt.

Om Ali, din nye leder

Som leder prioriterer jeg frihed i opgaveløsningen, da jeg mener, at høj faglighed og frihed i opgaveløsningen komplementerer hinanden og skaber de bedste resultater. Med det sagt står jeg selvfølgelig altid til rådighed med sparring eller råd om en opgave – og det gør teamet også.

Jeg går meget op i personlig og faglig vækst, hvor der er plads til at prøve nye tilgange og lære undervejs. Det er derfor også vigtigt for mig, at vi har fokustid hver dag til fordybelse, samt at vi hver 3. uge bruger 1 time til læring og/eller optimering af eksisterende leverancer.

Om os | Hvad tilbyder vi

Du bliver en del af en helt særlig atmosfære og en organisation, der hver dag arbejder engageret for, at vores passagerer får den bedste rejseoplevelse.

Udover frokostbuffet, pension og IT-udstyr tilbyder vi:


Frihed til planlægning af dine opgaver – det betyder for eksempel, at du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra efter aftale med din leder
Fri parkering, cykelservice (i arbejdstiden), bilrengøring og gode rabataftaler
Fysioterapi og træningslokale, yoga, rådgivning fra træner mv.
Sundhedssikring – børn er dækket automatisk
Individuelle udviklingssamtaler.


Om ansøgningen | Stig ombord på dit nye job

Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning, så send den gerne snarest muligt og senest den 20. maj.

Vi modtager kun ansøgninger via vores rekrutteringssystem og ikke pr. mail.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet inden da, kan du kontakte Ali Agha Javed, Senior Manager Analytics på ali.agha.javed@cph.dk eller 53 65 03 26.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive politigodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde politigodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.

Derudover er det en forudsætning for at arbejde i Københavns Lufthavne, at du begår dig komfortabelt på dansk- både skriftligt og mundtligt.
Show more

Title: GenAI Model Evaluation Expert
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you wish to be part of a team that promotes responsible AI within financial services? Join Danske Bank’s Responsible GenAI Team as a GenAI Model Evaluation Expert and contribute to advancing AI risk governance in the financial sector.

Who are we?

The Responsible GenAI Team is committed to exploring and implementing AI technologies with a focus on safety, ethics, and performance. We work with teams across the organisation to ensure innovative solutions align with our compliance and governance standards, thereby enhancing the Group's offerings and customer experience.

The role

In this critical role, you will lead the evaluation of foundation models and their applications, ensuring their safe and ethical use. Your responsibilities will include:


Conducting lifecycle assessments of GenAI foundation models and use cases.
Analysing SaaS solutions with embedded GenAI features.
Benchmarking models for accuracy, bias, fairness, and adversarial robustness.
Collaborating with case owners to tailor risk testing strategies.


We imagine you are

We are seeking an experienced AI/ML model risk assessor with a deep understanding of GenAI technologies. You should be adept at engaging with both business and technical teams. Ideal candidates will have:


5+ years of experience in AI/ML model risk assessment, including GenAI.
Strong knowledge of large language models (LLMs), foundation models, and their risks.
Experience with AI testing and evaluation frameworks.
Proficiency in Python programming.


Meet the Team

Our team comprises AI specialists committed to evaluating and mitigating risks associated with emerging technologies. We work on impactful projects that influence industry standards, striving for excellence in AI governance and risk management. Together, we contribute to progress in a collaborative environment.

Have we caught your attention?

If you feel this opportunity aligns with your aspirations, we would love to hear from you. For any questions, please contact Head of Responsible AI, Thomas Eatmon at teat@danskebank.dk . Join us and contribute to AI risk governance in the financial sector!
Show more

Title: Sproganalytiker
Description:
DataAnnotation er dedikeret til at skabe AI af høj kvalitet. Bliv en del af vores team og hjælp med at træne AI-chatbots, samtidig med at du nyder fleksibiliteten ved fjernarbejde og selv bestemmer din arbejdstid.




Vi søger en tosproget professionel til at slutte sig til vores team og undervise AI-chatbots. Du vil føre samtaler på både dansk og engelsk med chatbots for at måle deres fremskridt samt skrive nye samtaler for at lære dem, hvad de skal sige.




Fordele:

Dette er en fuldtids- eller deltids-fjernarbejdsstilling
Du kan selv vælge, hvilke projekter du vil arbejde på
Du kan arbejde efter din egen tidsplan
Projekter betales pr. time, startende ved $30+ USD pr. time, med bonusser for høj kvalitet og stor volumen




Ansvarsområder (både på dansk og engelsk):

Udarbejde varierede samtaler om en bred vifte af emner
Skrive svar af høj kvalitet ud fra specifikke opgaver
Sammenligne præstationen af forskellige AI-modeller
Undersøge og faktatjekke AI-svar




Kvalifikationer:

Flydende på dansk og engelsk
En bachelorgrad (færdiggjort eller under uddannelse)
Fremragende skrive- og grammatikfærdigheder
Stærke research- og faktatjekfærdigheder for at sikre nøjagtighed og originalitet




Bemærk: Betaling sker via PayPal. Vi vil aldrig bede dig om penge. PayPal håndterer eventuelle valutaomregninger fra USD.

Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Rust) - AI Tutor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Rust
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Machine Learning developer with DSP experience (Python/C++)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in Signal Processing and Machine Learning? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team!

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, and the Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, fusing the radar signal with information from video feeds and other sensors.

You will play a significant role in the development of our world-leading, proprietary golf and baseball sensor technology, which is now also being applied in football and many other sports. You will have the opportunity to do your own research and development work, and to see the direct impact of it.

In the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team we seek to expand the use of machine learning and you will play a significant role in including neural networks in our tracking software.

Responsibilities:


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis.
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions.
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team.
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.


Requirements


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
Machine learning and neural networks
Digital Signal Processing (DSP)


Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills


Responsibilities


Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis
Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions
Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team
Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks
Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments


We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

We offer:


Highly skilled colleagues
Career growth inside trackman
International environment with more than 35 nationalities in our HQ
Working with the leading golf technology brand in the industry
Social activities


Are you our new colleague?

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

In the radar tracking & signal processing team we value teamwork and openness. Therefore, we expect you to enjoy working with other highly motivated colleagues and help provide a good working environment. We do not expect that you can be an expert on every aspect of being a developer, but rather strive to improve and learn together with the team.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology.

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud of working in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our new headquarter located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, Seoul and Tokyo.  We employ more than 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where all hardware and most software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At TrackMan, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of the exceptional solution. This mix is what makes TrackMan an inspiring company – for our customers and our colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application including and your diploma as soon as possible to join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow. Working place for this position is at Trackman Innovation Center in Hørsholm, our new HQ building. Contact Troels Bastholm at troels@trackman.recruitee.com for further information.

Apply now
Show more
HTML:
Do you have an interest in Signal Processing and Machine Learning? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcast all around the world?  Then come and join our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team!

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, and the Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, fusing the radar signal with information from video feeds and other sensors.

You will play a significant role in the development of our world-leading, proprietary golf and baseball sensor technology, which is now also being applied in football and many other sports. You will have the opportunity to do your own research and development work, and to see the direct impact of it.

In the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team we seek to expand the use of machine learning and you will play a significant role in including neural networks in our tracking software.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis.
  • Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions.
  • Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team.
  • Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.
  • Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.

Requirements

  • Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, or equivalent
  • Machine learning and neural networks
  • Digital Signal Processing (DSP)

Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

  • Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Optimization algorithms
  • Statistical signal processing
  • Software development experience
  • Strong communication skills

Responsibilities

  • Design, prototype, and evaluate machine learning models tailored for radar analysis
  • Stay abreast of and incorporate the latest research findings and methodologies in machine learning and radar into our solutions
  • Build knowledge of machine learning methods in the radar tracking & signal processing team through close collaboration with Vision & AI team
  • Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks
  • Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments

We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

We offer:

  • Highly skilled colleagues
  • Career growth inside trackman
  • International environment with more than 35 nationalities in our HQ
  • Working with the leading golf technology brand in the industry
  • Social activities

Are you our new colleague?

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.

In the radar tracking & signal processing team we value teamwork and openness. Therefore, we expect you to enjoy working with other highly motivated colleagues and help provide a good working environment. We do not expect that you can be an expert on every aspect of being a developer, but rather strive to improve and learn together with the team.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology.

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud of working in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our new headquarter located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, Seoul and Tokyo.  We employ more than 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where all hardware and most software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At TrackMan, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of the exceptional solution. This mix is what makes TrackMan an inspiring company – for our customers and our colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application including and your diploma as soon as possible to join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow. Working place for this position is at Trackman Innovation Center in Hørsholm, our new HQ building. Contact Troels Bastholm at troels@trackman.recruitee.com for further information.

Apply now

Title: Data Platform Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Role Overview

As a Data Platform Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you'll play a crucial role in building and evolving our streaming-first, self-service data platform, enabling software developers, data scientists, analysts, and product teams to efficiently address complex operational and analytical challenges. Your contributions will directly influence data-driven decision-making and product innovation across the organization.




You will focus on engineering scalable, automated infrastructure solutions—leveraging technologies such as Pub/Sub, Flink, BigQuery, Kubernetes, Terraform, and Airflow—while ensuring reliability, security, and operational excellence. Expect the role to involve substantial infrastructure automation, performance optimization, and close collaboration with Data Enablement Engineers to ensure seamless adoption and optimal utilization of the platform.




About Us

At Ønskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally.




Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. Our benefits include daily lunches, comprehensive health insurance, lively social events, and much more. This position is not remote. Relocation packages are not offerred.




Key Responsibilities

Build, manage, and evolve the self-service infrastructure (Pubsub, Flink, Bigquery, Dataflow, Dataproc, Airflow, etc).
Set up automated deployment, CI/CD, monitoring, observability, security, scalability.
Maintain and enforce schema governance, metadata management, and observability frameworks.
Provide infrastructure-level support for complex operational scenarios (e.g., scaling, latency optimization, infrastructure stability).

Technical qualifications

Mulitple programming languages
We primarily use Scala, Java, SQL and Python
Distributed processing frameworks
Spark, Flink, Beam, or similar
Infrastructure & Cloud
GCP/AWS/Azure (we use GCP)
Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, Helm
Storage & Lakehouse
Delta lake, Apache Iceberg, Apache Paimon
Observability & Monitoring
Prometheus, Google Cloud montioring, Grafana
DevOps & Automation
Github Actions, ArgoCD

Solid grounding in data engineering principles, and data visualisation.Strong problem-solving abilities and collaboration skills.Skilled in processing large datasets and deriving actionable insights.Prompt engineering for LLM applications.




Nice-to-Have

Strong understanding of distributed systems, scalability, and high availability.
Schema governance and serialization formats (Avro, Protobuf, JSON Schema).
Security fundamentals: IAM, RBAC, Encryption, network security principles.
Infrastructure-as-Code practices.




Preferred Qualifications

3–5+ years experience in Data/Platform Engineering or DevOps roles.
Experience implementing or managing streaming data platforms at scale.
Excellent debugging, troubleshooting, and performance-tuning skills.
Show more

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Senior Software Developer | TypeScript, JavaScript, Serverless, AWS | Copenhagen /Remote




TypeScript Developer with knowledge of JavaScript and AWS is sought after by a start-up company in Copenhagen who provide an investment platform to help fund creative content and products. In this role, you will be an essential part of their development team and will be involved in maximising the availability of their platform to further increase their market dominance. Having recently investing in the advancement of their platform, they need a developer with strong skills to both work on the engineering and consult with the team to improve their knowledge.




Skills and experience required:

At least 4 years of experience using TypeScript and JavaScript
Strong skills using AWS
Confidence to consult with lower skilled members of the team and advise
Fluent English language skills




In return the client can offer:

Monthly salary of up to 55,000kr depending on your experience
Flexible working hours with fully remote options from within Denmark
Sociable team with weekly nights out, activities etc.
Generous benefits package




If you are a Senior Software Engineer with strong skills in TypeScript and AWS then apply to this role or contact Luke Rose directly to find out more!
