Title: Full-stack Developer – customized code, AI and machine learning
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want a role as trusted advisor, where you will help our customers with a range of challenges focusing on delivering customized code tailored to each project? And are you passionate about working with AI and machine learning? Then you are the new colleague, we are looking for. This position is based at our office in Viby or in Nordhavn in Copenhagen with the flexibility to work from home.

Lead efficient and customized full-stack development solutions

You will be part of our Custom Software team, where we provide expert advice on software design and development. We help different customers in Denmark achieving digital transformation by analyzing business challenges and building custom software solutions to realize their visions.

As Full-stack Developer you will be responsible for designing and building complete software solutions ranging from setting up cloud infrastructure in Microsoft Azure; to developing robust, expressive, and well-tested backend code; as well as building accessible and flexible UIs. You will also have the opportunity to build AI-powered agents and applications.

Overall, your areas of responsibility will include:


Investigating customer needs to find the best fit software solution
Designing and architecting systems from front to back
Developing high-quality software that provides value to our customers
Monitoring and maintaining running software
Renovating legacy software to match new needs and challenges
Working with a range of technologies, languages, and frameworks to provide value across the whole stack
Working with AI to build powerful agents and tools to push our clients forward


Some of the skills we are interested in:


3+ years of experience in software development / full-stack development
A relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree within Computer Science or similar
Experience interacting with end customers
Experience with C# and .NET development
Experience working with web frontend frameworks and libraries such as Angular, React, HTMX and any others
Experience with cloud architecture and Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of or interest in project management
General good technical understanding and insight
Fluent in English – Danish is a plus but not a must


We understand that working with software involves an impossible number of technologies and frameworks to master, so don’t worry if you haven’t worked with every tool listed – we’d still love to hear from you!

Personal qualifications:


A skilled communicator: good at listening and building common understanding
A reasoned approach to decision making – you can consider the options available against the constraints of a task instead of just copy/pasting the same solution
Curiosity about how different parts of software fit together and how to build things from scratch
A knack for debugging and finding the causes of errors
Structured and diligent, you have the details covered
A team player, happy to work alongside your colleagues so we can build and improve together


What we can offer you:


Interesting and varied work: we have customers from many different industries that need software for different purposes
A hybrid workplace – a lot in the team work remotely for most of the week, but we group up when we want to run in person discussions or regularly on Fridays so we can keep regular contact with all our colleagues
Skilled and knowledgeable colleagues and the opportunity to learn and grow together
Opportunities for development: we want you to be the best you can be, and we attend conferences, run hackathons, maintain a solid library of professional literature and are always on the lookout for better ways that we can develop our skills
Social events, professional gatherings, and 1,700 amazing teamm8s as colleagues


Ready to be part of itm8?

We’re looking forward to receiving your CV.

If you have questions concerning the position, please feel free to contact Software Architect, Custom Software Adam Guest at phone +45 2493 9060 or e-mail adgue@itm8.com or TA Partner Trine Larsen at phone +45 2815 5806 or e-mail trlar@itm8.com.

All inquiries are treated confidentially. We hold ongoing interviews and complete the recruitment process when the right candidate is found. Furthermore, we obtain a criminal record prior to employment.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (C++) - AI Tutor
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with C++
Code review experience is a must
Experience with AI projects is a plus
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: AI konsulent – skab fremtidens AI-løsninger i Energinet
Place: Fredericia, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI konsulent – skab fremtidens AI-løsninger i Energinet

Har du lyst til at udforske nye idéer? Og vil du være med til at teste nye og spændende

AI-løsninger?

Sammen skaber vi fremtidens løsninger

Du bliver en del af vores nyetablerede AI Accelerator-team, som er forankret i Tech og Innovation og har base i Fredericia. Vi arbejder agilt og tværgående for at levere tekniske løsninger, der understøtter forretningen under temaet ”AI for Alle”, og vores mål er at fremskynde værdiskabende brug af AI på tværs af Energinet.

Vi eksperimenterer og udvikler løsninger med standard- og low-code-værktøjer som Agent, Copilot Studio og Open AI. Samtidig har vi fokus på compliance og udvikling af AI-kompetencer i hele Energinet i tæt samarbejde med resten af Energinets AI-netværk.

Vær med til at udvikle og teste nye AI-løsninger

Som AI konsulent i et agilt team er din kerneopgave at udvikle AI-løsninger – i starten primært i Copilot Studio.

”Vi får use cases ind fra forretningen. Nogle gange er det løsninger, som vi skal hjælpe med at videreudvikle. Andre gange tager vi det helt fra scratch. Så selvom vi sidder med det tekniske, har vi også meget direkte kontakt med forretningen,” forklarer din nye kollega, Frederik Bruun, AI konsulent.

Som Frederik beskriver det, så er opgaverne mangeartede. Konkret vil dine opgaver bl.a. være:


Indgå i løbende dialog med kunderne for at forstå deres krav og optimere løsningerne
Udvikle prototyper baseret på kundernes specifikke behov og feedback
Teste AI-løsninger for at sikre funktionalitet og brugervenlighed



Du har en god teknisk forståelse – og er nysgerrig på AI

Vi forventer ikke, at du er hardcore udvikler. Til gengæld har du en teknisk forståelse for AI-løsninger, og ved hvordan man omsætter idéer til prototyper og konkrete løsninger.

Det et stort plus, hvis du har erfaring med Copilot Studio (Power platform), som bliver dit primære arbejdsværktøj. Derudover arbejder vi også i andre Microsoft AI værktøjer (Copilot, Agenter, AI Foundry) - og vi forventer, at du har kendskab til dem eller tilsvarende/sammen-

lignelige systemer samt forståelse for prompt engineering, API-kald o.l.

Derudover er det vigtigste, at du har teknisk erfaring og kan arbejde struktureret med innovation og udvikling. Du må gerne være lidt visionær og samtidig kunne argumentere for, hvorfor vi skal gå videre med bestemte idéer frem for andre. Endelig er du nysgerrig og initiativrig, og du har lyst til at samarbejde med mange forskellige typer af kolleger på tværs af Energinet.

Særlige forhold: Jobbet kræver, at du kan opnå og opretholde sikkerhedsgodkendelse.

På PET's hjemmeside kan du læse mere om sikkerhedsgodkendelse . I enkeltstående situationer kan det være nødvendigt at foretage et baggrundstjek forud for sikkerheds-

godkendelsen.

Vil du være med til at gøre en forskel sammen med os?

Så ser vi frem til at modtage din motiverede ansøgning og CV senest den 18. maj. Sæt allerede nu et par forsigtige kryds i kalenderen 20. maj, hvor vi holder 1. samtale online, og 26. maj, hvor vi holder 2. samtale i Fredericia.

Er du nysgerrig på din kommende leder, eller har du spørgsmål til jobbet? Se nærmere på LinkedIn eller ring til Agile People Leader, Marie Søndergaard på tlf. 2180 2686.

Vi ser mangfoldighed som en styrke og opfordrer alle kvalificerede, uanset baggrund, til at søge jobbet. Vi arbejder aktivt og målrettet med mangfoldighed i Energinet og opfordrer dig derfor til at udelade billede, oplysninger om alder, civilstand og lignende, for at minimere ubevidste biases i processen. Du kan læse mere om vores mangfoldighedspolitik her.

Du bliver en del af Tech & Innovation, der understøtter hele Energinet inden for innovation, digitalisering, IT-udvikling og -drift. Som strategisk partner arbejder vi på tværs af hele Energinet for at levere innovation og teknologiske løsninger, der støtter Energinets kerneopgave med at forsyne samfundet med el og gas. Tech og Innovation er organiseret efter agile principper, hvor teams samarbejder effektivt for at skabe de mest effektive løsninger for Energinet.

Glæd dig til at blive en del af en organisation med et meningsfuldt formål, hvor vi forsyner Danmark med el og gas, og omstiller energisystemet til grøn energi.

I en god balance mellem dine ønsker og værdien for Energinet får du stor indflydelse på hvor og hvornår du løser dine arbejdsopgaver. Læs mere om vores fleksible medarbejderfordele , der også inkluderer en aktiv personaleforening, en attraktiv forældrepakke, hjemmearbejdsplads og -udstyr, seniorordning mv.
Show more

Vi arbejder agilt og tværgående for at levere tekniske løsninger, der understøtter forretningen under temaet ”AI for Alle”, og vores mål er at fremskynde værdiskabende brug af AI på tværs af Energinet.

Vi eksperimenterer og udvikler løsninger med standard- og low-code-værktøjer som Agent, Copilot Studio og Open AI. Samtidig har vi fokus på compliance og udvikling af AI-kompetencer i hele Energinet i tæt samarbejde med resten af Energinets AI-netværk.

Vær med til at udvikle og teste nye AI-løsninger

Som AI konsulent i et agilt team er din kerneopgave at udvikle AI-løsninger – i starten primært i Copilot Studio.

”Vi får use cases ind fra forretningen. Nogle gange er det løsninger, som vi skal hjælpe med at videreudvikle. Andre gange tager vi det helt fra scratch. Så selvom vi sidder med det tekniske, har vi også meget direkte kontakt med forretningen,” forklarer din nye kollega, Frederik Bruun, AI konsulent.

Som Frederik beskriver det, så er opgaverne mangeartede. Konkret vil dine opgaver bl.a. være:

  • Indgå i løbende dialog med kunderne for at forstå deres krav og optimere løsningerne
  • Udvikle prototyper baseret på kundernes specifikke behov og feedback
  • Teste AI-løsninger for at sikre funktionalitet og brugervenlighed


Du har en god teknisk forståelse – og er nysgerrig på AI

Vi forventer ikke, at du er hardcore udvikler. Til gengæld har du en teknisk forståelse for AI-løsninger, og ved hvordan man omsætter idéer til prototyper og konkrete løsninger.

Det et stort plus, hvis du har erfaring med Copilot Studio (Power platform), som bliver dit primære arbejdsværktøj. Derudover arbejder vi også i andre Microsoft AI værktøjer (Copilot, Agenter, AI Foundry) - og vi forventer, at du har kendskab til dem eller tilsvarende/sammen-

lignelige systemer samt forståelse for prompt engineering, API-kald o.l.

Derudover er det vigtigste, at du har teknisk erfaring og kan arbejde struktureret med innovation og udvikling. Du må gerne være lidt visionær og samtidig kunne argumentere for, hvorfor vi skal gå videre med bestemte idéer frem for andre. Endelig er du nysgerrig og initiativrig, og du har lyst til at samarbejde med mange forskellige typer af kolleger på tværs af Energinet.

Særlige forhold: Jobbet kræver, at du kan opnå og opretholde sikkerhedsgodkendelse.

På PET's hjemmeside kan du læse mere om sikkerhedsgodkendelse . I enkeltstående situationer kan det være nødvendigt at foretage et baggrundstjek forud for sikkerheds-

godkendelsen.

Vil du være med til at gøre en forskel sammen med os?

Så ser vi frem til at modtage din motiverede ansøgning og CV senest den 18. maj. Sæt allerede nu et par forsigtige kryds i kalenderen 20. maj, hvor vi holder 1. samtale online, og 26. maj, hvor vi holder 2. samtale i Fredericia.

Er du nysgerrig på din kommende leder, eller har du spørgsmål til jobbet? Se nærmere på LinkedIn eller ring til Agile People Leader, Marie Søndergaard på tlf. 2180 2686.

Vi ser mangfoldighed som en styrke og opfordrer alle kvalificerede, uanset baggrund, til at søge jobbet. Vi arbejder aktivt og målrettet med mangfoldighed i Energinet og opfordrer dig derfor til at udelade billede, oplysninger om alder, civilstand og lignende, for at minimere ubevidste biases i processen. Du kan læse mere om vores mangfoldighedspolitik her.

Du bliver en del af Tech & Innovation, der understøtter hele Energinet inden for innovation, digitalisering, IT-udvikling og -drift. Som strategisk partner arbejder vi på tværs af hele Energinet for at levere innovation og teknologiske løsninger, der støtter Energinets kerneopgave med at forsyne samfundet med el og gas. Tech og Innovation er organiseret efter agile principper, hvor teams samarbejder effektivt for at skabe de mest effektive løsninger for Energinet.

Glæd dig til at blive en del af en organisation med et meningsfuldt formål, hvor vi forsyner Danmark med el og gas, og omstiller energisystemet til grøn energi.

I en god balance mellem dine ønsker og værdien for Energinet får du stor indflydelse på hvor og hvornår du løser dine arbejdsopgaver. Læs mere om vores fleksible medarbejderfordele , der også inkluderer en aktiv personaleforening, en attraktiv forældrepakke, hjemmearbejdsplads og -udstyr, seniorordning mv.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

But what truly sets us apart? Our people. We’re a diverse group of innovative thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers who believe in delivering an incredible product—and having fun while doing it.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a skilled Senior Software Engineer to join our product team focused on empowering coaches and players with the tools and insights to level up their team and individual performance. Whether it's designing seamless user experiences, leveraging edge AI to craft the optimal solution or building scalable systems, your work will touch the sports community worldwide.

What You Will Do


Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to deliver products that empower coaches, players, and their supporters, and meet business goals
Contribute to the full product lifecycle—ideation, development, deployment, and monitoring—while leveraging customer feedback loops to iteratively refine and improve products
Ensure high performance, security, and scalability across all aspects of the software
Leverage and enhance Veo’s design system to create intuitive user experiences
Participate in technical discussions, reviews, and decisions to shape Veo’s technology landscape




What You Could Bring


5+ years of experience in software engineering, in a high growth environment
A collaborative spirit, working well with others to reach shared goals
A drive for building products that solve real problems and bring value to users
A growth mindset, focused on continuous improvement and learning
A problem-solving mindset and clear understanding of what good looks like when it comes to building and operating large-scale systems.
An eye for architecture: you can discuss the tradeoff between architectural choices, both on a theoretical level and on an applied level
An appreciation for clean, maintainable code and best practices
Proficiency in both backend (e.g., Python, typescript, Node.js … and with ability to pick up new ones) and frontend (e.g. React) technologies
Experience with testing practices, including unit testing, integration testing, and implementing CI/CD pipelines
Interest in coaching others and supporting their growth as engineers
Comprehensive verbal and written English communication skills




Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

What Values We Hold at Veo.

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We value diversity and inclusion and welcome applicants from all backgrounds, even if your experience doesn’t completely match every qualification listed. What matters most is your creativity, potential, and ability to contribute meaningfully.
Show more

Title: Internship - Frontend Developer in Startup
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have a passion for front-end development and creating perfect design?

Do you want to work in a fast-growing tech startup where you’ll get real responsibility and hands-on experience from day one? At AdPlenty, we’re looking for a motivated developer to help us shape the future of digital advertising! (please note - Unpaid internship)

About AdPlenty

At AdPlenty, we're working towards providing the ultimate local marketing platform. We are a software company developing SaaS advertising for B2B clients, with our fully automatic “all-in-one” platform. It is designed to simplify professional online advertising by generating and streamlining marketing campaigns. But more than that, we are a community of dedicated individuals, who believe in fostering a supportive and inclusive culture where your ideas are valued.

We are now looking for an ambitious and driven front-end developer with a passion for developing great-looking web apps. If you are excited about delivering compelling digital user experiences then you are the right candidate.

What You Will Be Doing

Overall supporting the team with platform design implementation: implementation of new designs and features in collaboration with our designer and full-stack developers.


Develop & maintain frontend features that enhance the platform’s user experience. Work closely with experienced software engineers in an agile, fast-moving environment. Help set up banners, ads, and HTML structures that power our ad tech solutions Gain real-world experience with projects that directly impact businesses


Details

The internship is 3 months

Start Date

15 May 2025 or

15 August 2025

Please note the internship is unpaid.

Who You Are

You have an interest in frontend development and min. 1 year work experience Have experience with frontend frameworks (React, Angular JS, etc.), good understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript Detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and Eager to learn and contribute to real projects

Need To Have Qualifications


HTML5, CSS3
Javascript
AngularJS / Angular / React


Nice To Have Qualifications


Node JS, Docker
Amazon AWS (ECS, S3)
Figma


We are based in central Copenhagen at Matrikel1 - in a fun and innovative startup community. Its an on-site position

Ready to Apply?

If this sounds like a good fit for you, we’d love to hear from you

Do not hesitate to send your application. We need you urgently and will be interviewing candidates as applications come in. For more information or questions please contact our Technical Lead Ignas @ advative.io
Show more

Title: Freelance Software Developer (CLI) - AI Tutor
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Find and test actions that could accidentally cause harm during normal use.
Create test cases where the CLI unintentionally deletes, moves, or overwrites code without backups.
Simulate and analyze other unexpected issues to check the agent's safety and reliability



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in software testing, risk assessment, or AI safety
Proficiency with CLI environment
Knowledge of main scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash scripting)
Understanding of DevOps tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins)
Knowledge of Code versioning tools (e.g., Git, GitHub, Bitbucket)
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: IT Platform Engineer for MLOps (Machine Learning) Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a “2 in a box” model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models


About you:


Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
In-depth knowledge of AWS services and Databricks
Proficiency in Python, Pyspark
Experience in CI/CD tools Terraform and container orchestration
Problem-solving and debugging skills
Understanding and practical experience with PubSub and Kafka streaming services would be beneficial
Upper-Intermediate English skills


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.


Show more

Title: Recently graduated Engineer, wanting to work within AIT Quality at Novo Nordisk Engineering
Description:
Does the idea of working in Quality IT excite you? And do you thrive on gaining knowledge of GXP and pharmaceutical production? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for graduates to join our team of engineers in Automation IT Project Quality Management. As a team, we are working on the biggest projects in Novo Nordisk.

Why do we need you? Our goal is to implement robust and excellent solutions for our owner. Your role will be key in learning about development, doing testing and verification of master batch records and supporting our Quality Engineers.

Location Kalundborg Department Automation IT Project Quality Management

Experience Graduate level Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Graduate, you’ll be:


Getting on-the-job training and guidance to be confident and prepared to support some of our clients’ most complex manufacturing execution issues
Contributing in gathering technical requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g., facilitated workshops, work sessions and interviews, technical analysis)
Learning from senior colleagues with an innovative mindset to ensure that workflows / recipes are successfully and compliantly designed, developed, deployed in line with site business processes and technical standards
Commissioning and undertaking test and qualification of IT systems in manufacturing environments
Estimating and coordinating own tasks
Depending on your profile it would be Quality or IT system Validation. We will have a talk about where we see your potential.



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:


A team-oriented person, curious and eager to learn
Comfortable with customer relations
Proficient in spoken and written Danish and English
Passionate about your work and with a personal drive
Pro-active, cooperative and with a motivated mindset.



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions, there are some things that are preferred, and others, a bonus. If you do not meet all the qualifications listed below, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.


An engineering, computer scientist or similar degree or a having pharmaceutical production experience.
Experience with IT on various levels



Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions
Inclusive environment that values diversity and equity



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Deadline of application is 10 June, 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Manager Ima Mir on +45 30 75 55 86.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com
Show more
HTML:
Does the idea of working in Quality IT excite you? And do you thrive on gaining knowledge of GXP and pharmaceutical production? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for graduates to join our team of engineers in Automation IT Project Quality Management. As a team, we are working on the biggest projects in Novo Nordisk.

Why do we need you? Our goal is to implement robust and excellent solutions for our owner. Your role will be key in learning about development, doing testing and verification of master batch records and supporting our Quality Engineers.

Location Kalundborg Department Automation IT Project Quality Management

Experience Graduate level Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Graduate, you’ll be:

  • Getting on-the-job training and guidance to be confident and prepared to support some of our clients’ most complex manufacturing execution issues
  • Contributing in gathering technical requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g., facilitated workshops, work sessions and interviews, technical analysis)
  • Learning from senior colleagues with an innovative mindset to ensure that workflows / recipes are successfully and compliantly designed, developed, deployed in line with site business processes and technical standards
  • Commissioning and undertaking test and qualification of IT systems in manufacturing environments
  • Estimating and coordinating own tasks
  • Depending on your profile it would be Quality or IT system Validation. We will have a talk about where we see your potential.


Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:

  • A team-oriented person, curious and eager to learn
  • Comfortable with customer relations
  • Proficient in spoken and written Danish and English
  • Passionate about your work and with a personal drive
  • Pro-active, cooperative and with a motivated mindset.


The miles you’ve walked

In all positions, there are some things that are preferred, and others, a bonus. If you do not meet all the qualifications listed below, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.

  • An engineering, computer scientist or similar degree or a having pharmaceutical production experience.
  • Experience with IT on various levels


Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:

  • Vibrant and project-based work environment
  • Collaboration and innovation-based culture
  • True empowerment and flexible working conditions
  • Inclusive environment that values diversity and equity


Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

 Deadline of application is 10 June, 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Manager Ima Mir on +45 30 75 55 86.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Københavns Lufthavn (CPH) har hvert år over 30 millioner passagerer gennem lufthavnen, hvilket selvfølgelig er en stor operation, der kræver meget af hele organisationen – og det er her, du kommer ind i billedet.

I stillingen, der har CPH-titlen Senior Data Scientist, er en af dine hovedopgaver at arbejde med passagerprognoser, der et af de mest afgørende datapunkter for at sikre optimal planlægning og drift af lufthavnen. Så det håber vi, du synes lyder bare halvt så spændende, som vi ved, det kan være.

Om at være Senior Data Scientist

Hos os arbejder du med data, der har en direkte indflydelse på kundeoplevelsen i CPH. Dit arbejde sætter tydelige spor i alle afkroge af organisationen – særligt de operationelle –, hvor passager forecast er en af nøglerne til en 1. klasses driftsoplevelse hos både rejsende og dine nye CPH-kollegaer. Du har et tæt samarbejde med Security, hvor du skal fremlægge analyser for performance, og hvad vi forventer af fremtiden.

Vi ser frem til, at du bidrager med at:


Udvikle og implementere passagerprognoser til både taktisk og operationel planlægning.
Udvikle og automatisere fremmødeprognoser ved Security for optimal driftsstyring.
Analysere driftsperformance og udarbejde sporbehov i Security op til 7 måneder frem.
Levere analyser, der sikrer, at lufthavnens infrastruktur og drift skalerer effektivt med trafikudviklingen.


Udover dit nye team kan du se frem til samarbejde på tværs af afdelingerne, som nyder godt af dit arbejde. Du har bl.a. fornøjelsen af Security, Digital, Airside Operations, Bagage og andre dygtige CPH-kollegaer.

Om hvordan du lykkes i jobbet

I din nye rolle trives du med, at dine analyser hurtigt omsættes til konkrete beslutninger og handlinger i forretningen. Du er en central drivkraft i arbejdet med passagerprognoser og ressourcebehov, hvor dine indsigter har direkte indflydelse på både den daglige drift og de strategiske beslutninger, der former lufthavnens fremtid.

Du er det rette match, hvis du er resultatorienteret, fokuseret på at få opgaverne gennemført og skabe resultater, der understøtter forretningens behov. Med din analytiske sans trives du med at dykke ned i komplekse datasæt og omsætte dem til klare, datadrevne indsigter. Derudover er du nysgerrig og læringsorienteret, og du bringer nye metoder og teknologier i spil for at hæve kvaliteten af analyser og løsninger.

Vi håber, at din faglige bagage indeholder:


Relevant uddannelsesbaggrund inden for f.eks. matematik, økonomi eller datalogi – gerne på kandidatniveau.
Solid erfaring med Machine Learning og statistisk modellering i praksis.
Skarphed i både Python og SQL og bruger dem som naturlige værktøjer i dit arbejde.
Mindst 4 års erfaring fra en lignende stilling med ansvar for avancerede analyser og modeller.


Om afdelingen

Vi er et team med forskellige faglige baggrunde, men med en fælles passion for data. Vores forskellige kompetencer supplerer hinanden og gør samarbejdet både stærkt og inspirerende – vi bruger netop vores forskelligheder til at skabe indsigt og værdi.

I teamet finder du blandt andet en tidligere professionel basketballspiller, en nybagt far, én der har kastet sig over hækling, og én der måske elsker Python mere end livet selv.

Vi er tre kollegaer og en leder, der glæder os til at byde dig velkommen og lære dig at kende – både fagligt og socialt.

Om Ali, din nye leder

Som leder prioriterer jeg frihed i opgaveløsningen, da jeg mener, at høj faglighed og frihed i opgaveløsningen komplementerer hinanden og skaber de bedste resultater. Med det sagt står jeg selvfølgelig altid til rådighed med sparring eller råd om en opgave – og det gør teamet også.

Jeg går meget op i personlig og faglig vækst, hvor der er plads til at prøve nye tilgange og lære undervejs. Det er derfor også vigtigt for mig, at vi har fokustid hver dag til fordybelse, samt at vi hver 3. uge bruger 1 time til læring og/eller optimering af eksisterende leverancer.

Om os | Hvad tilbyder vi

Du bliver en del af en helt særlig atmosfære og en organisation, der hver dag arbejder engageret for, at vores passagerer får den bedste rejseoplevelse.

Udover frokostbuffet, pension og IT-udstyr tilbyder vi:


Frihed til planlægning af dine opgaver – det betyder for eksempel, at du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra efter aftale med din leder
Fri parkering, cykelservice (i arbejdstiden), bilrengøring og gode rabataftaler
Fysioterapi og træningslokale, yoga, rådgivning fra træner mv.
Sundhedssikring – børn er dækket automatisk
Individuelle udviklingssamtaler.


Om ansøgningen | Stig ombord på dit nye job

Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning, så send den gerne snarest muligt og senest den 20. maj.

Vi modtager kun ansøgninger via vores rekrutteringssystem og ikke pr. mail.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet inden da, kan du kontakte Ali Agha Javed, Senior Manager Analytics på ali.agha.javed@cph.dk eller 53 65 03 26.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive politigodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde politigodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.

Derudover er det en forudsætning for at arbejde i Københavns Lufthavne, at du begår dig komfortabelt på dansk- både skriftligt og mundtligt.
Show more

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Vil du bruge dine Java-kompetencer til noget, der virkelig betyder noget?

CompuGroup Medical søger en erfaren backend-udvikler med passion og et højt drive (Aarhus)




Er du en ambitiøs og teknisk stærk Java backend-udvikler, der ønsker at arbejde med løsninger, som har reel betydning for mennesker? Så er det måske dig, vi leder efter til at styrke vores udviklingsteam hos CompuGroup Medical – Danmarks største leverandør af IT-systemer til den primære sundhedssektor (Software produkthus)




Det her er til dig, der:

Har en passion for backend-udvikling og stærk erfaring med Java.
Ønsker at være med til at videreudvikle IT-løsninger til sundhedsområdet.
Trives i et ambitiøst, vidensdelende miljø med høj faglighed.
Har drive og tager naturligt ansvar for arkitektur, kvalitet og fremdrift.




Om jobbet:

Du bliver en nøglespiller i et dedikeret team, hvor I sammen videreudvikler praksissystemet til terapeuter som fysioterapeuter, psykologer og kiropraktorer.

Fokus på backend-udvikling i Java med et webbaseret MVC-framework.
Du arbejder med relationelle databaser, moderne arkitektur og DevOps.
Du får stor indflydelse på teknologi og metoder – og bliver en central sparringspartner i teamet.




Vi leder efter dig, der har:

Plus 8 års erfaring med Java webudvikling – med tungt fokus på backend.
Erfaring med relationelle databaser og en struktureret tilgang til kodekvalitet.
Forståelse for frontend-teknologier som HTML, JavaScript og CSS – og gerne erfaring med Angular, React eller Vue (ikke et krav).
En holdning til dit håndværk og lysten til at udvikle dig fagligt – sammen med andre.
Erfaring med sundheds-IT er en fordel – men ikke et krav.




Vi tilbyder:

En rolle med mening og faglig udfordring – og software der gør en forskel.
Et stærkt og inkluderende udviklingsmiljø, hvor vi løfter i flok.
Fleksible forhold og mulighed for hjemmearbejde (typisk 3 dage på kontoret, 2 hjemme).
Konkurrencedygtig lønpakke med pension, sundhedsforsikring, frokostordning og fysioterapi på jobbet.




Herudover tilbyder Compugroup Medical god videns delende kultur, tillids baseret ledelse, højt fagligt niveau blandt samtlige kolleger og sidst men ikke mindst gode kolleger der elsker deres arbejdsplads, fordi man vægter medarbejder tilfredshed højt.




Du vil komme til at arbejde ud fra CompuGroup Medicals hovedkontoret i Aarhus.




Interesseret?

Rekrutteringen varetages af We Compare i tæt samarbejde med CompuGroup Medical.

Kontakt Tanja Kaysen, Founder hos We Compare, på

+45 93 83 83 54

tka@compare.dk




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig – og vi lover, du ikke bliver skuffet.

Show more

Title: आवाज़ अभिनय के लिए AI प्रशिक्षण - हिंदी
Description:
Outlier दुनिया की सबसे नवोन्मेषी कंपनियों को मानव फीडबैक प्रदान करके उनके AI मॉडल को सुधारने में मदद करता है। क्या आप शोधकर्ताओं की मदद करने में रुचि रखते हैं ताकि वे ऑडियो मशीन-लर्निंग मॉडल की अगली पीढ़ी को प्रशिक्षित कर सकें? यह शोध मानव भाषण और अनुरोधों की समझ को बेहतर बनाने और उन्हें अधिक मित्रवत और सहानुभूतिपूर्ण बनाने का लक्ष्य रखता है।

आवश्यकताएँ:


हिंदी में मूल प्रवाह
आवाज़ के माध्यम से विभिन्न भावनाओं को व्यक्त करने की क्षमता
शांत वातावरण में बिना पृष्ठभूमि शोर के रिकॉर्ड करने की क्षमता
घर पर रिकॉर्डिंग स्टूडियो तक पहुँच
किसी भी आवाज़ से संबंधित काम का अनुभव (जैसे, वॉयसओवर अभिनय, पॉडकास्टिंग, ऑडियो वर्णन)
रिकॉर्डिंग के लिए उच्च-फidelity माइक्रोफोन तक पहुँच


अच्छा होगा:


स्क्रीन या मंच पर अभिनय, शास्त्रीय आवाज़ प्रशिक्षण, या वोकल संगीत का बैकग्राउंड
ऑडियो इंटरफेस डिवाइस तक पहुँच


जिम्मेदारियाँ:


छोटी बातचीत रिकॉर्ड करें जो विभिन्न भावनाओं, लहजों, और ऑडियो मॉड्यूलेशन को व्यक्त करती हैं
अन्य उपयोगकर्ताओं द्वारा की गई रिकॉर्डिंग पर समीक्षा करें और फीडबैक प्रदान करें
स्क्रिप्ट की समीक्षा और संपादन करें
स्पष्ट, पेशेवर रिकॉर्डिंग बनाए रखकर उच्च गुणवत्ता वाले ऑडियो सुनिश्चित करें
फ़ाइलों को Audacity में सहेजें और संगठित फ़ाइल प्रबंधन बनाए रखें


भुगतान:

वर्तमान में, आवाज़ रिकॉर्डिंग के लिए मुख्य परियोजना कार्य के लिए भुगतान दरें प्रति घंटे 40 USD तक हैं।

कृपया ध्यान दें: हम अपने पेशेवर व्यावसायिक उद्देश्यों के लिए व्यक्तिगत डेटा एकत्र करते हैं, बनाए रखते हैं और उपयोग करते हैं, जिसमें आपको उन अवसरों के बारे में सूचित करना शामिल है जो आपकी रुचि के हो सकते हैं और हमारे सहयोगियों के साथ साझा करना शामिल है। हम जो व्यक्तिगत डेटा एकत्र करते हैं, उसे हम उस तक सीमित करते हैं जिसे हम उचित और आवश्यक मानते हैं ताकि आवेदकों की आवश्यकताओं का प्रबंधन किया जा सके, अपनी सेवाएँ प्रदान की जा सकें, और लागू कानूनों का पालन किया जा सके। आपकी आवेदन से संबंधित कोई भी जानकारी Outlier की गोपनीयता नीति और हमारे आंतरिक नीतियों और कार्यक्रमों के अनुसार संभाली जाएगी जो व्यक्तिगत डेटा की सुरक्षा के लिए डिज़ाइन की गई हैं।

यह Outlier.ai प्लेटफ़ॉर्म पर 1099 अनुबंध का अवसर है। चूंकि यह एक फ्रीलांस अवसर है, हम इंटर्नशिप, प्रायोजन, या रोजगार की पेशकश नहीं करते हैं। आपको अपने निवास देश में काम करने के लिए अधिकृत होना चाहिए। यदि आप एक अंतरराष्ट्रीय छात्र हैं, तो यदि आपके पास वीज़ा है तो आप Outlier के लिए साइन अप कर सकते हैं। आपको अपनी परिस्थितियों के संबंध में विशिष्ट प्रश्नों के साथ अपने कर और/या आव्रजन सलाहकार से संपर्क करना चाहिए।
Show more
HTML:
Outlier दुनिया की सबसे नवोन्मेषी कंपनियों को मानव फीडबैक प्रदान करके उनके AI मॉडल को सुधारने में मदद करता है। क्या आप शोधकर्ताओं की मदद करने में रुचि रखते हैं ताकि वे ऑडियो मशीन-लर्निंग मॉडल की अगली पीढ़ी को प्रशिक्षित कर सकें? यह शोध मानव भाषण और अनुरोधों की समझ को बेहतर बनाने और उन्हें अधिक मित्रवत और सहानुभूतिपूर्ण बनाने का लक्ष्य रखता है।

आवश्यकताएँ:

  • हिंदी में मूल प्रवाह
  • आवाज़ के माध्यम से विभिन्न भावनाओं को व्यक्त करने की क्षमता
  • शांत वातावरण में बिना पृष्ठभूमि शोर के रिकॉर्ड करने की क्षमता
  • घर पर रिकॉर्डिंग स्टूडियो तक पहुँच
  • किसी भी आवाज़ से संबंधित काम का अनुभव (जैसे, वॉयसओवर अभिनय, पॉडकास्टिंग, ऑडियो वर्णन)
  • रिकॉर्डिंग के लिए उच्च-फidelity माइक्रोफोन तक पहुँच

अच्छा होगा:

  • स्क्रीन या मंच पर अभिनय, शास्त्रीय आवाज़ प्रशिक्षण, या वोकल संगीत का बैकग्राउंड
  • ऑडियो इंटरफेस डिवाइस तक पहुँच

जिम्मेदारियाँ:

  • छोटी बातचीत रिकॉर्ड करें जो विभिन्न भावनाओं, लहजों, और ऑडियो मॉड्यूलेशन को व्यक्त करती हैं
  • अन्य उपयोगकर्ताओं द्वारा की गई रिकॉर्डिंग पर समीक्षा करें और फीडबैक प्रदान करें
  • स्क्रिप्ट की समीक्षा और संपादन करें
  • स्पष्ट, पेशेवर रिकॉर्डिंग बनाए रखकर उच्च गुणवत्ता वाले ऑडियो सुनिश्चित करें
  • फ़ाइलों को Audacity में सहेजें और संगठित फ़ाइल प्रबंधन बनाए रखें

भुगतान:

Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
Description:
Are you a top-motivated Software Developer looking for your next big challenge? Do you have a passion for innovation and a drive to contribute to mission-critical communications solutions? At Chora, we continue to successfully serve our market, and we are therefore strengthening our team in Aarhus.




YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

In this position, you will contribute to the development of our mission critical communication equipment used by e.g. the electronic warfare sector.

You will work with full-stack development, primarily using C++
You will play a crucial role in developing new innovative Chora solutions for our customers
You will contribute to optimization, expansion and maintenance of existing products and features
You will be part of one of our agile Scrum teams with a high degree of autonomy and responsibility




YOUR PROFILE

You have a minimum of 3 years of experience as C++ software developer, preferably more
You have a Bachelor or a Master’s degree in computer science or similar
You have strong coding skills in C++ and preferably C#
Familiarity with Git and Jenkins, as well as code review tools like Gitea, is a plus
Experience with object-oriented design and design patterns is a plus
You have the ability to overview and understand the entire system design
You take ownership of your tasks and responsibilities, just as you thrive on working independently
You also enjoy working closely with your colleagues within an agile Scrum team setup

You live within commuting distance of Aarhus, and you speak and write Danish and English at professional level. You have a clean criminal record and you are a Danish citizen or you have lived in Denmark for at least the last 7 years.




CHORA AS A WORKPLACE

Chora is a small corporation with room for differences. At Chora everyone knows everybody, and as an employee you have the opportunity to influence how work is done. We are a dedicated team with the ambitions of being the most respected corporation within our field. At Chora we offer:

Variation in assignments
A dynamic atmosphere with an informal tone
Good stable working conditions
An exciting niche market with unique products
Pension scheme
Salary according to qualifications and an attractive Bonus scheme.
Great colleagues, influence on your own work, and focus on quality
Staff association, Summer party, Christmas party
Health Insurance
Delicious lunch every day, free fruit, coffee, tea, and water




ABOUT CHORA

Chora is an international corporation with headquarters in Aarhus and a subsidiary in Munich, Germany. Chora cooperates with acknowledged corporations all over the world. Chora was founded in 1994, and since then we have developed and sold high-tech communication solutions. We sell our products to the B2B and B2G market. Our customer segment is quite different, as we work within a fascinating and interesting niche-market. Chora is a healthy business with sound ownership and an international perspective not to mention strong core values.

If you have any questions or need more information, you are welcome to contact us at tel: +45 86 18 99 55. We look forward to receiving your application and CV at job@chora.com

We review applications continuously, and we treat your information discretely.

Title: Software development - Join the Subsea Revolution: Innovate, Disrupt, and Transform with NOV!
Description:
Job Description

Software development - Join the Subsea Revolution: Innovate, Disrupt, and Transform with NOV!

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our dynamic team in Denmark. You will play a crucial role in developing and maintaining internal software applications that directly support our global operations in Denmark, Brazil, and Scotland.

In this role, you will develop simple solutions to complex problems, working closely with end-users to ensure our applications are efficient, scalable, and aligned with business needs. You will take ownership of projects, leading cross-functional initiatives and mentoring other developers.

Your work will involve continuously refactoring code, improving system architecture, and integrating AI-driven applications into our workflow. You will thrive in an agile, low-meeting environment, focusing on actual development rather than rigid frameworks.

This is an opportunity to make a real impact, drive innovation, and shape the future of software development at NOV.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain in-house desktop and web applications for the Subsea Production Systems business area.
Optimize SQL databases and API services for performance and scalability.
Reduce complexity in existing and future code architecture.
Work closely with end-users and production teams to enhance usability and efficiency.
Lead technology projects across the Subsea Production Systems business area.
Drive the adoption of AI-powered applications in our workflows.
Contribute to a collaborative, innovation-driven team environment.


Key Requirements


B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience) or autodidact within software development.
Full-Stack Development experience with a strong focus on:    - Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Vue.js    - SQL databases and FastAPI   -  Pydantic models and Dataclasses
Experience with Numpy/Scipy (bonus: scikit or other ML frameworks).
Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes for deploying containerized applications.
Strong GitHub and Copilot experience.
Comfortable working in agile and product development environments.
Several years of hands-on experience in software development and product development.


Why Join Us?


Competitive salary package, including health insurance. Hybrid work model – minimum 3 days in our Brøndby office, with flexibility to work from home.
Efficient work environment – no unnecessary meetings, just a focus on building great software.
Dedicated learning time – up to 2 hours per week for personal growth and innovation per week.
Close collaboration with end-users – build what really matters.
Work in a global environment – collaborate with colleagues in Denmark, Brazil, USA and Scotland.


About NOV

At NOV’s Subsea Production Systems (SPS), we specialize in designing and producing cutting-edge shallow and deep-water pipes for the oil and gas industry. With production facilities in Denmark, Brazil, and Scotland, we are dedicated to driving innovation and solving complex engineering challenges.

Our team is made up of problem-solvers who collaborate globally to develop software solutions that optimize operations, improve efficiency, and support our production teams worldwide.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
hackajob is collaborating with Version 1 to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.

Version 1 has celebrated over 26 years in Technology Services and continues to be trusted by global brands to deliver solutions that drive customer success. Our expertise enables our customers to navigate the rapidly changing Digital-First world we live in. We foster strong partnerships with leading technology giants including Microsoft, AWS, Oracle, Red Hat, OutSystems, and Snowflake, ensuring that our customers are provided with the highest quality solutions and services.

We’re An Award-winning Employer Reflecting How Our Employees Are At The Very Heart Of Version 1 And What We Do


UK & Ireland's premier AWS, Microsoft & Oracle partner
3400+ strong, €350/£300m revenue business
10+ years as a Great Place to Work in Ireland & UK
Best Workplace for Women in the UK & Ireland by GPTW
Best Workplace for Wellbeing in the UK by GPTW
We’re a core values driven company, we hire people who share our values, and we reward those who display and foster them, it’s deeply embedded within our DNA. Invest in us and we’ll invest in you


Job Description

As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will be working in a Scrum Team of cross-functional skills in tight collaboration practising Agile. You will be contributing to real decisions about technology to create maintainable solutions for our customers and participating in a highly collaborative group of software engineering professional’s. Learning, developing your skills further and continuously improving will be part of your role. You will develop software to meet our client's user needs using Python, follow best practice guidelines and help to improve those guidelines. You will have a strong background in AWS architecture and a passion for emerging technologies, particularly in AI and machine learning. You will have experience working with AI/ML frameworks or a keen interest in the field, along with the ability to quickly learn and deploy AWS services. In addition to Python you will contribute to the React frontend development within the project.

This role requires someone who stays ahead of technology trends, thrives in an environment that encourages experimentation with minimal guidance, and can effectively document technical insights for stakeholders.

Qualifications


Experience of working in a Scrum Team and an Agile environment
Strong software engineering background covering SOLID principles with extensive experience in Python
Experience working with AI/ML frameworks or a strong interest in AI/ML is required.
Experience developing REST-based APIs
Knowledge and some experience with DevOps and CI/CD tools (such as Jenkins, Ansible, Packer, Docker)
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration of applications.
Strong front-end development experience with React.
Strong experience in developing and deploying solutions on AWS Cloud, with expertise in AWS services such as Lambda, S3, EC2, DynamoDB, SQS, SNS, and Cognito (AWS Certified Developer or Solutions Architect preferred)
Experience writing unit tests and integration tests
Financial Services or Capital Markets experience with FIX protocol is preferred.
Ability to manage and co-ordinate stakeholder engagements and meetings.
Ability to mentor junior members on the team

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist at Meta, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a wide-range of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development's biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Meta, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Meta. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product's ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a varied toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.Communication and influence: You won't simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Scientist, Product Analytics Responsibilities:


Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches
Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends
Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions
Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses
Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations


Minimum Qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, a relevant technical field, or equivalent
2+ years experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)
2+ years of experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches, understanding ecosystems, user behaviors & long-term product trends, and leading data-driven projects from definition to execution [including defining metrics, experiment, design, communicating actionable insights]


Preferred Qualifications:


Master's or Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Please no recruitment agents**


We are looking for a talented and driven individual to join our forward-thinking data science team. In this role, you will play a vital part in analysing and interpreting complex data across research projects, clinical trials, and customer studies. You will also contribute to shaping the future of our lung disease research by developing impactful statistical models. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will have the opportunity to work alongside major pharmaceutical companies and leading research institutions worldwide.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:


Provide statistical expertise across all initiatives, including clinical study design and business development activities.
Assess current tools and methods, recommend improvements, and develop enhanced algorithms and methodologies.
Design, expand, and maintain robust data processing pipelines, statistical analysis workflows, and data visualisation tools for experimental and clinical research.
Develop new and refine existing statistical analysis processes in collaboration with clinicians.
Partner with stakeholders to identify challenges and tailor data-driven statistical solutions to meet their needs.
Prepare and deliver study design protocols, analysis reports, presentations, and other materials to effectively communicate insights and findings to stakeholders and customers.
Collaborate as an innovative and creative member of a multidisciplinary team, driving novel approaches to advance the company's mission.



Experience, Skills and Knowledge:


2+ years of industry experience in applied data science
Full right to work in the UK without restriction, time limit, or sponsorship
Deep understanding of probability and statistics, including power and sample size calculations, hypothesis testing, parametric and non-parametric methods, multivariate analysis, covariate adjustments, and survival analysis techniques such as Cox regression and Kaplan-Meier estimation.
Proven experience applying statistical methodologies and best practices—such as data preprocessing, feature engineering, and method selection—to real-world datasets, including clinical trial data, particularly within the pharmaceutical sector or in collaboration with contract research organizations.
Strong communication and presentation skills and a collaborative mindset.
High level of competence with Python (Pandas, Jupyter, Scikit-learn, NumPy, SciPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly)
Ability to write clean, efficient and maintainable Python code following best practices, including modular design, version control (Git), clear documentation, error handling, testing, and performance-conscious data processing (e.g. vectorisation, memory management)
Expert skills with data wrangling and cleaning large datasets



Optional Experience, Skills & Knowledge:


Experience of more advanced statistical models such as mixed-effects models is a plus
Ability to use matching techniques to create synthetic arms in clinical trial cohorts
Proficiency with command line
Experience of cloud providers (AWS preferred)



Qualifications & Education:


Degree in statistics, mathematics or a related quantitative or scientific subject



Benefits

The chance to join a friendly, motivated group of people on a mission for universal good in healthcare.


Flexible working hours
Hybrid working policy
Competitive salary
25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays
Annual enrichment programme
Salary exchange pension scheme
Private medical insurance (including pre-existing)
Medical Cash Plan benefit
Death In Service benefit
Discretionary employee share options scheme
Opportunities for professional development and academic collaborations in a vibrant and fast-acting company
Co-working passes


Qureight reserve the right to amend or remove any of these at any given time.
Show more

Title: Growth Data Scientist/ Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a dynamic Growth Data Scientist/Analyst to join our Growth team. The successful candidate will be instrumental in leveraging data to drive strategic decisions, optimize growth initiatives, and enhance user acquisition strategies.




Responsibilities
Develop and maintain acquisition and engagement (e.g. influencer/affiliate, organic, VIP, paid acquisition etc.) dashboards to monitor user growth and campaign effectiveness
Assist in building predictive models to guide strategic decisions on acquisition and engagement, encompassing time series, predictive analytics, and recommender systems
Analyze data to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions and performance improvements
Automate repetitive tasks and data processes to enhance team efficiency
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decisions and project implementations
Engage in continuous learning to stay ahead of industry trends and leverage new tools and techniques in data analysis





Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields
Up to 3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field. Experience in the crypto industry is a plus
Familiarity with User Acquisition (UA) and/or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) concepts is advantageous
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau
Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python) and libraries for managing, manipulating, and analyzing data
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings
Knowledge of acquisition campaign platforms and tools such as Appsflyer, SensorTower, or similar platforms
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Title: Data Scientist, MSAT
Description:
Location: London (Hybrid)

Reporting to: Senior Director of MSAT

Job Summary

The Data Scientist will support the MSAT organisation at Orchard Therapeutics and will lead data-driven initiatives to support process and analytical control strategy development, trend monitoring, manufacturing investigations and lifecycle management of cell and gene therapy products. This role will be the primary point of contact for the development and implementation of a centralised manufacturing data repository, ensuring seamless data integration from CDMOs and internal data repositories. The job holder will drive insights that enhance process understanding, control and continuous improvement. The role will include the creation of specific processes to ensure seamless and compliant data flow and integration, data interpretation and analysis to support multiple MSAT activities linked to successful manufacture of CGT products. This role is also critical to enabling understanding of complex manufacturing processes and product characterisation.

This is an exciting opportunity to work with vector, cell process, and analytical scientists involved with Chemistry, Manufacturing, and Control (CMC) data management of gene therapy products, from early phase development to commercial production. The candidate should have experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, as well as a strong statistical knowledge, DoE study experience and hands-on experience with JMP or similar software and building appropriate systems to interrogate database. Experience in working in a regulated environment is essential and the candidate must have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data and be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams to improve process outcomes.

Requirements

Required Experience & Knowledge:


Experienced in statistical modeling, multivariate data analysis and process analytics and experienced with applications (e.g. JMP...)
Proficiency using programming languages (e.g. R, Python, SQL, SAS, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Proficient in DoE applied to biological processes
A solid understanding of biological and bioprocessing concepts, data, and information types, experience working with CGT processes and analytical method is a plus
Experience building databases compliant with requirements for regulatory filings (ICH Q8-Q10, Regulatory CPV guidance)
Experience using/developing data visualization tools
Knowledge of GMP data integrity, process validation (PPQ) and CPV principles
Demonstrated experience applying knowledge in relevant industry fields such as Biopharma, CGT or manufacturing data analytics


Skills And Abilities


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to translate complex dataset into actionable insights
Ability to work in and lead diverse cross-functional teams
Attention to detail and compliance mindset
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Excellent communication skills with an ability to visualize / present data to communicate ideas, concepts and results to technical and non-technical audiences (both internally and externally)
Interest in continuous improvement of processes by integrating innovative solutions


Education

MSc or PhD in data sciences, statistics, bioprocess engineering, Bioinformatics, Engineering or related discipline.
